As we were putting on our jackets the manager finally came by and hastily apologized and said she'd checked with her "sub-manager" and they were comping the partial meal we'd gotten, which is hilarious because there's no way I was letting any us pay after all the screw ups on their end. 

Oh, and did I mention that the couple at the table next to our group seemed to be having the same kind of problems, but the manager managed to go over there and apologize and even sit with them for a bit. This is probably the last time we ever try to go here for a group outing (or even as a couple).
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Starting off, the ambiance in this place is amazing for a date. I love the fireplace in the middle of the restaurant. The service was good and friendly. The Bread they start you out with is to die for!! I couldn't stop eating the bread! I ordered Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo. It was yummy, but not enough shrimp in the dish.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
If you absolutely have to go here for their mediocre food and their mediocre service,  BEG the Host/Hostess to seat you as far away from the bathrooms as possible.  They seem to have a problem with the P traps and every time someone went into the bathroom we were engulfed by the smell of sewage.  

My friend said her chicken cannelloni was quite tasty.  I didn't make it past some bread and a few bites of my chicken parmesean before someone went into the bathroom.  The rest of my dinner had to go home with me (then in the trash this morning...)

It still gags me just to think about it!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Tonight wasn't our first night here, but it was definitely our last.

I really like the lighting in this place, and that's about it.

The service was extremely slow and forgetful, we had about three different people randomly helping us, and still doing poorly. I got the veal, which was terrible. The pasta that came with it was even worse and I literally didn't take more than two bites.
The boyfriend liked his main course but his salad was warm and full of browning lettuce.
We were both seriously disappointed and wished we'd spent our money somewhere else :/
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I tried the tasting menu.  The ravioli were good. It came with a Caesar salad, and fettuccine Alfredo. Tha main coarse was chicken Marsala. I didn't much care for the chicken Marsala. Everything else was good. I usually get the spaghetti and meat balls.  Those are great. I think I am going to stick with that next time.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Very disappointed! We were so excited to see a Macaroni grill on our visit this time, we had eaten many times at the macaroni grill in the Bay Area and were never disappointed. This time however we struck out! We ordered the lobster bisque and one of the bowls of soup was served cold while the other hot! The soup was extra salty and did not have even a hint of lobster in it! When this was brought to the notice of the manager she kind of blew it off as oh well yes we keep the soup in the fridge so that it doesn't spoil, also saying she had never had lobster bisque with lobster in it!! Then she reheated the soup in the microwave and returned it Luke warm. The rest of the meal was so so my lobster ravioli was also served partly hot and partly cold like it had just been reheated in the microwave !! Not going back to this location for sure! The servers however were polite and did their jobs well!! I think they need a quality check for sure!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went to macaronis grill today and ordered the pasta Marini  which had mussels in addition to other seafood. My plate came out with the majority of the mussels not opened. Now although I didn't grow up on the coast, my New England born wife has always said that unopened mussels should never be eaten. I returned it and the next plate was ok. But the blackened chicken pamasan that my wife ordered was as tough as shoe leather. Additionally my table was not cleaned well with cheese remnants still in the table and stains on the table cloth. We sat near the fireplace, which was nice, but decided this is our final visit as the quality of their food and ambiance has deteriorated. We've been customers from the time they first opened!! What changed? It stinks from the head is an old polish saying.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Arrived for lunch at 12:40. David immediately came up to us and led us to a nice booth towards the back. He wrote his name with (1 of the 3 available crayons) upside down & backwards towards him on the paper covering the table cloth, but easily readable for us. He introduced himself as he wrote it and asked what he could get us to drink. He quickly brought a warm loaf of fresh bread for us to tear apart and dredge in their delicious garlic and olive oil. 

We ordered Mozzarella caprese, warm spinach salad, and capellini pomodoro to split between the two of us. David brought out mozzarella frittas by mistake, but when we told him that wasn't what we ordered, he quickly apologized and offered to replace it with the mozzarella caprese. The frittas looked so good, we decided to keep them. They were delicious, lightly breaded with a tasty arrabbiata sauce. When the frittas were gone, I dipped the remainder of the bread in the extra sauce. 

The spinach salad was topped with creamy, toasted goat cheese that really added to the flavor of the spinach. Try to get a small bit of cheese in every bite. Supposed to have prosciutto, but there wasn't any? We don't care to eat the garlic slices, so picked them out, but loved the flavor they left behind, which blended perfectly with the lemon juice. The pomodoro provided a generous helping of tender capellini pasta covered with juicy, ripe grape tomatoes. 

This was our first time to ever go to a Romano's Macaroni Grill, but thanks to the excellent service provided by David, the delicious food, and reasonable prices, we can't wait to return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Great bar Happy Hour 4-7 every day. Wine & Drafts $3, $5 pizza, $4.50 apps. To-go Dinners and lunches are very reasonable and fast. Staff are as friendly as it gets.

Love the HH Pizzas. A flatbread style thin crust pepperoni and only  $5.  Peroni, Sam Adams Seasonal, Icky and BudLite on tap.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Normally a great place to eat and great customer service. The last time we were here was horrible. Took 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order. Ordered bread when it came out it was super hard and cold in the center. Waitress came back over and told us the bread could have been frozen and that she would have them put more in the oven. 

Finally got our food and we needed to go boxes. We had to ask another waiter for the boxes. Our waitress came over and asked if we needed to go boxes when we had already received them from the other waiter. Asked for a bag three times. When the waitress brought us our check she asked how old our baby was and completely ignored me and was staring at my husband for an answer. He told her that I was speaking to her and she had the nerve to ask me if I still love my baby. And then said just kidding and walked away. 

We paid and the waiter that was being trained by the waitress brought our receipts and card back to us and stood there at the table waiting for us to sign the receipt. 

We spoke with the general manager as we were leaving and he stated that this was not an off day and people have been acting the same today as they have been for months. Didn't seem to really care that his employees are very rude to his customers and we will probably not go back because of this experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My wife, son and I went to this place a while ago and have never been back.  The service was terrible, the menu overpriced, the noise level extra loud, and after waiting for nearly an hour our meals were served to us cold and bland.

Sometimes I'll give one bad experience a pass and try again to verify before forming an opinion. However, when a chain restaurant makes this poor an impression, I only need one visit. There's plenty of good family-owned Italian food in Reno, so 

Thanks, but no thanks.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The best part about our experience was walking out the door. It took about 10 minutes before our hostess noticed we hadn't been visited by a server. Once the waiter came the service actually got worse! Gino (run if he's your server!) arrived as though he'd been at the table right after being seated. No apology or promptness to the service thereafter. He then proceeded to spill olive oil all over the table, sloshed drinks everywhere (of which they were out of Coke), and bring out bread within a whopping 20 minute time period. Everyone around us had been served by the time our drink order was taken. The only time he offered to refill drinks was after we asked for the bill and a box. His attitude was terrible (we even remained polite throughout the whole ordeal and he continued to be rude and disrespectful, tossing the to-go box on the table and crumbling the bill before briskly walking off with the debit card). We have never experienced such profoundly terrible service. Gino takes the cake on this one and we will never return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My family was very hungry when we dined here, and Romano's did not disappoint us!

I had the "Chicken Portobello" which was a huge portion that was plated over a very ample bed of "orzo with spinach & vegetables".  The flavors of this dish were quite impressive, not too salty as with most chain restaurants.  Only $13.99.....well worth the price due to the unlimited fresh baked bread that was delivered piping hot to our table.

Daughter had one of those Bowtie pasta dishes with chicken....it looked a lot like the dish she orders at the Cheesecake Factory.  She devoured every drop on the plate.

Wifey ordered the salmon "low calorie" plate, which consisted of baked salmon and fresh vegetables.  She seemed very pleased.

They are offering a special "extra" where you can get your choice of Appetizer and choice of dessert for only $5.99 extra. (a $13.50 value based on the individual prices of the crab-stuffed mushrooms and the smothered chocolate cake, which we all shared).

The total bill, including the tip, was under $55.  We were completely satisfied with both the food quality and service from Tyler, our young waiter.

As chain restaurants go, you could do a LOT worse than Romano's.

Due to the competition with the nearby BUFFETs at the casinos and hotels, THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION must try harder in order to lure the Reno tourists away from the cheap buffet deals that proliferate in Nevada.  

Now, if only the local Romano's in Roseville CA had the same competition.....they would be much better.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I was so disappointed by this Macaroni Grill! I love the restaurant, but this location in Reno was just so scattered! I don't even know who my server was through the night and when I simply asked for my pizza to be more crispy, the chef came out as if he was at a funeral and just dropped it to our table and gave us a mean look!!! I really wish I could get a refund because the entire experience was not what my other experiances have been in the Macaroni in Los Angeles. I did not enjoy the food or service at this Reno location and most of our food went to waste. Please grant me my refund!!!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Cannot say anything about the food itself, just the horrible service. There was no sign in plain sight specifying whether or not to "wait to be seated" or "to sit down yourself". A server looked me in the eye as he walked past us twice and did not acknowledge me or my mother. Another server did the same thing, we walked out. Never coming back again, don't recommend the restaurant, save your time and go somewhere else. Also place wasn't as crowded as Chili's across the street that we ultimately went to after our unpleasant experience here, so no excuse to stop and acknowledge a customer.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My wife and I went here for our anniversary and were very disappointed.  Although the wait staff was extremely nice and our server Holly was exceptional, they didn't make up for a bad experience.  The food was mediocre and extremely over priced.  We chose a very simple spaghetti dish, no extras, not even salad.  One iced tea and one small glass of an inexpensive wine and our bill was almost $70.  Like I said, the service did not make up for the overpriced and lackluster meal.  Needless to say, we will never go back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The food was great and the service though slow was done with finesse.  When we arrived and parked it became apparent there were no handicap ramps for the wheelchair. 2 wonderful gentlemen helped us get up the curb. This was our first visit. No signs indicating handicap parking anywhere.  Inside we were told there was handicap parking on the other side of the building.  If you didn't know there was another side you'd never find it. Please spend a back to indicate handicap parking on other side with an arrow. Basic consideration
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Well they have a new menu since the last time I went. It is much less daunting than the old menu.

The good stuff:
-Nice ambience and lighting. Romantic/chill.
-Some nice new dishes, and a low calorie notifier for the healthier dishes, as the portions here can be quite out of hand.
-Pretty good wine selection. I had a nice syrah from Spain.
-You can still draw on the tables. I don't have kids, but I was bored and drew something anyway. I imagine this allows the parents to go to a decent restaurant with the kids, since they will have something to do.

Cons:
-Service was meh.
-Food came cold and late.
-Vegetables were a bit too marinated in oily stuff. It was a low calorie dish, but apparently few restaurants know how to prepare nice fresh veggies without completely masking the tastes of the vegetables themselves.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Seen its name on the back of my gift cards for years finally decided to try one in Reno. Definitely interesting but when it comes down to it not very impressed. We skipped the appetizers since they bring you bread and have a oil on the table. I suggest asking for balsamic since the oil has a strong flavor. We ordered the Butternut asiago pasta, it was not at all what you would expect with a cheese filled pasta and diced chunks of butternut squash's on top sitting in a very salty asiago alfredo sauce. What they advertised as prosciutto tasted more like little strips of thick bacon, which you didn't need because it was already too salty. Our other meal was blackened chicken parmisan which was actually quite delicious and spicy chicken and a buttery garlic pasta with some greens. Overall it wasn't horrible but with prices like those it wouldn't be first on my list for Italian.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I had the worst customer service of my life. The food was good up until the dessert. When I started to eat my sorbet, THERE WAS A SHARD OF PLASTIC ABOUT AN INCH LONG. I told the waiter and when he told his manager about it, she literally ignored it and shooed him away. I am very disappointed in the customer service, seeing as if I was a health inspector, the place would have been shut down immediately. What I experienced could have sent me to the hospital if I had actually swallowed it. I am never ever going back there again, seeing as I want to keep my life.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My family and I are not high maintenance customers in any way. When we arived were seating by a very nice host. As we sat down out waitress served the family next to us and promptly walked past us. No eye contact, no hello, no "I will be right with you". We waiting 23 minutes to be exact, as she walked passed us 4 other times, not saying one word or attempting to make eye contact. Never have I been stood up by a waitress.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Went for lunch and I was not impressed with the food or the service. The soup-salad-bread lunch was off the menu and the food we did get tasted like it had been under the heat lamp for hours. The server left the check with out entrees and then didn't return to fill our drinks or check on our food. Terrible.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Just got done eating here, really disappointed at the quality of the food. Kind of a bummer since we don't get to go out to dinner much.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Reno, NV

A little slow being seated.  Friendly people, nice and ambient place to be. Good house Red wine if you want my recommendation.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This review is less about the food (which is generally good), and not about the service either (which is usually great). Rather this review is about the somewhat dishonest $7, 7 minutes lunch special.

We were short on time, and on a budget after Christmas shopping. We went into the Macaroni Grill for lunch and were seated as usual. Only to find out we had to get up, walk over to the "Kitchen Counter" to place our order and sit in a different seating area in order to get the $7 lunch special.

An awkward experience to say the least. Probably less likely to return now.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I really enjoyed the pick 2 mix and match option for lunch. Good selection of tasty options. My favorite was the chicken Caesar calzonetto. It was really very yummy! The seating outside was nice and shaded so a good option for enjoying a meal outside during the summer. To top it all off our waitress was fantastic!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We stopped in to the Macaroni Grill for a friends birthday lunch and this is where she wanted to go.  I'm a sucker for ravioli and I had heard they have really good ravioli.  They share a parking lot with Barnes & Noble and Great Basin Brewing so I imagine parking can be an issue during busy times.  They have two dining options - the first is with their traditional menu where you sit and a waiter takes care of you, the second is their express dining.  It's sort of a lunch line where they make the food fresh, but it's a limited menu and they do it for both lunch and dinner.  We went with the traditional dining and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was friendly and he kept the drinks and fresh bread coming.  The bread was delicious, piping hot with rosemary and they have olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli for lunch and it was really good with lots of mushrooms.  However, I think the plate may have been left under the warmer a bit too long.  The plate was scalding hot - no biggie but the parts of ravioli without sauce were very dry and almost crunchy.  That's really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4.  I was really looking forward to that cheat lunch and it just didn't live up to my expectations.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Refer to the Check-in description. 
Again the staff were great and food was at the high standards of Macaroni grill. 
The house wine (Rossi) was a good choice with the meal.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I'm still hunting for a decent Italian restaurant in Reno.  This isn't it.  The food had too much cheese and my daughter's meal barely had any meat on it at all.  Neither one of us ate very much of our meal.

   On the plus side the service was great and the manager comped my daughter's meal since she didn't eat it but I definitely won't be returning here.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We typically go to Macaroni Grill  to celebrate  special occasions, due to my moms terminal illness, we have not had opportunity in over a year to  dine out together but  decided to  go for my daughters 24th birthday -  so on 4-2-12 we  picked Macaroni Grill as it had  always been   good in the past. This turned out to  a huge disappointment on several levels -

We  went for lunch  the restaurant  was  basically  empty at 1:45 when we  arrived - 
the service  was  terrible - 
We were presented with the dinner menu  and when we asked for the lunch menu were told  this was all there was...

Once the  order was placed, the waiter parked himself  by the cooking line  & never came back, so we had to ask the bus boy for the Focaccia bread. The waiter then brought  everything  directly after the bread arrived, therefore we didn't have time to enjoy the bread, which  we  normally  devour as soon as it is put in front of us. Then had  to again wait for someone to come back so we could  ask  for balsamic vinegar to  add to the dipping olive oil.

My mom ordered:
Calamari Fritti crisp-fried, pepperoncini, arrabbiata 10
& house salad

The birthday girl ordered:
Bellini Cipriani - la marca prosecco, white peach purée 7

and we shared

Italian for Two @ $25.00

Tappas - Zucchini Fritti
 
Eggplant Quadratini
roasted eggplant, basil, tomato, ricotta salata, red chile 13.5

Chicken Milanese (add $3.00)
arugula Parmesan salad, roasted potatoes,  lemon butter

ok the -   Bellini  in a  tulip glass - lovely  but  $7.00??
The  Calamari was  a disappointment -  pale & - not  crispy  as  advertised-  the  house salad was  good.
Zucchini Fritti -  my daughter & I  each ordered one,  which for a change  was a mistake because one would have been enough for 3,  it was good but... not as good  as it looked on the menu or  I had hoped -  the " ribbons" were  not  long ribbons  instead they were small  pieces and a little greasy - should have  ordered only one of these and a different 2nd  tappas...
The Chicken Milanese was  pounded so thin  that it was  dried out &  had  no flavor -  the coating  was thicker than the chicken& the sauce  over top was  almost  non existent  - the arugula salad  had  absolutely no  taste what so ever,  the potatoes were plentiful, cooked  correctly &  had   loads of roasted garlic  which I did  love -

The eggplant quadratini was good going down, not so  much  later that evening when my daughter became ill and eventually  threw up after being miserable for several hours ... therefore she never touched the  leftovers...

The  ambiance we had always loved  in the  dining room  was  gone -  the music was no longer classic Italian music, the beautiful white gladiolas  were gone and  the happy birthday song which the waiters sing  in Italian never even happened - 
The hostess never looked up from the stand  to say goodbye -


Total for lunch for 3 guests including tip  almost  $70.00 

I don't think we  will  be using  Macaroni Grill for our special occasions anymore...
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Food was delicious and place is not crowded at all. Nice experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: If there was an option for no stars, this restaurant would receive a zero rating. I'm not surprised though, the last time we were here, the food was bad then too. I must say that over the many years dining at this particular restaurant, the food has gone downhill. I ordered mamas trio and the food came out cold! Not just sitting in the window warmed ready to be taken the table, but cold out of the frig. I had our server touch the fettuccini with his finger to verify and he concurred that the noodles were refrigerator cold. He then took my plate and must have placed it in he oven and yes it came back hot, but the bottom of the lasagne was burnt and stuck to the plate, I couldn't scrape it off to eat it. Not to mention that he price of $19 was way too much for the small portions without a salad. We were one of only four tables in the restaurant and not once did my tea get refilled. My husbands tea sat empty at the edge of the table for quite some time and was refilled as we were paying our bill. My husband had the chicken scallopini--the exact same item he has had for years and obviously the recipe has changed...for the worse. There was no sear in the chicken, it tasted boiled. The cheeses for the first time tasted like velveeta, not the original butter and cream recipe.  The kids each had spaghetti and meatballs and no thank you, we don't want to mix those leftovers to take home. And just like last time, the bread was dry and tasted like it was old, not fresh out of the oven like we used to get.  Not once did our server come back and ask us how we were doing or if we needed anything. Sad to say, but you lost our business.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I used to eat here weekly, but have been consistently disappointed for the past few years. The food is bad and you have to wait forever to get it. I don't know how they're staying in business. After the last visit I will never be back. Seriously, it's garbage, and I leave angry every time. Go anywhere else.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We ate here once, I love macaroni grill for their fresh pasta, I was disappointed going, which was right around prom or homecoming so there was a ton of young kids there. The dinner was decent, nothing to write home about, and I ordered a house table red wine. The kid waiting our table was flustered which was understandable given that they were busy and we just so happen to decide to go on that one night. Oops, who knew? 

He brought me my wine in a HOT mug. Who on earth brings ANY wine in a mug, not to mention a Hot mug? Wine is served in a wine glass. Funniest thing about it was he drew on our table noting a wine glass and a tic mark. My boyfriend asked the waiter if he had a glass like he drew, and he obviously got upset and flustered saying they always serve house wine in a mug. 

I understand its traditional to serve it in a glass, in Italy, but if you know anything about wine, red optimal flavors are represented in 60-65F degrees, white a bit colder 50-55F degrees. If in the least they should give the option to customers of traditional customs or in a stem glass which they have, instead of serving in a hot glass ruining the flavor and raising the temperature to 80+F degrees.  

Hard for us to want to come back here unless it's 1/2 off.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The food was cold, we waited an hour, and it tasted like the food was out of a can. This is not the Macaroni Grill it was a year ago. I used to love this place but I am not going back any time soon. $20 per person is too much for bad food.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We first encountered the Mac Grill in Carolwood, Florida. (The one that burned down about 10 years ago.) We really loved the food and could always find something for everyone. The service was good, the food was good and served hot and we could get in and out before the kids got cranky. We were delighted to find there was one in Reno when we moved here and we have probably eaten there more than all other Italian places in Reno combined. Up to our last visit, it was great.

Unfortunately our last trip was something else. As we entered we found a white board with the special of the evening listed. Only to be told they only had one more left. Then we went to the table and got the menus. My wife's favorite, veal Parmesan was no longer on the menu. She had to settle for something else. I ordered spaghetti with meatballs. Next we were informed they had no fresh bread and had to wait until they made some more. Then I was informed they were out of meatballs so I settled for meat sauce. Then the food came and my wife found that her's was not very warm.

There were just too many "ran out of" issues and add that to the menu changes and that was it for us. We shall now be searching for another Italian place.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Yes, the hot fresh rosemary bread is DELICIOUS!!!  I had the "Choose Your Own Pasta", you pick all your ingredients, sauce, meat if you want and then they deliver it HOT and YUMMO!!  Tonight there was a bit of a delay due to some kitchen problems, but Management, Teresa, took care of things in a most professional way -- so KUDOS to you Teresa!!!  You did a GREAT JOB... as did our waitress, Amanda.  They all kept cool under the pressure and took care of things!  THANKS EVERYONE!!!  Definitely will be back to try some other dishes -- YUMMO!!!

Eve & Paris
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I'm very sad to give a poor review, as Macaroni Grill has long been one of my very favorite places to eat.  

Sadly, though, after years of being a loyal customer I don't think I'll ever go back.  

I'm not sure if they changed from wonderful, amazing, delightful, delicious rosemary bread to dry, white, hamburger buns permanently, but the last time I was there that's what we were served.  Very dry, white bread buns that were barely edible.  I'm a bread person.  I'll choose a restaurant just for the bread.  Gah!  I'm so sad.

The server on our visit was barely available to us, took FOREVER to provide drink refills, never brought condiments we requested or refills for my two kids and wasn't ever at our table long enough for me to ask her what the deal was with the bread. 

They've also changed my favorite menu item that has been unchanged for many years, so that was just the straw that broke the camel's back.  I will not return.

Very disappointing.  Used to be my favorite.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We celebrated my mother's 78th birthday here tonight. Had not been back for at least eight years, although none of us could remember why. The food was amazing! The service was phenomenal! The manager was absolutely delightful and they treated my mother like the queen she is. It will not be eight years before we return again. Will be lucky if any of us can go eight days, it was that good! Thank you for treating our mother like a queen and making her birthday so happy
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Nothing special. Received cold/hard bread. The restaurant was nearly empty and my boyfriend and I waited almost an hour for our food. He ordered chicken and they gave him it burnt and wayyyy over cooked. Knowing this, they offered to give him a meal to go with the chicken cooked properly. We took it because we were tired, hungry, and rather annoyed. Why not make it right the first time and bring out the good plate? Won't be returning.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Don't waste your time!! We used to love going to this restaurant when we lived in Cali so we thought we would give it a try.  That will be our last one. The oil on the table to use for dipping your bread was sour and spoiled.  The entrees are overpriced and the quality was sub par. I believe they are using frozen ingredients.  Won't be back, ever.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My family went out for an affordable meal (the $25-for-two deal), but it was hardly a deal given the quality of the food.  The organization of the waitstaff/kitchen was horrid.  To be fair, our server was exceedingly friendly and apologetic (and the wine was free - accidentally or intentionally), but everything came out in the wrong order.  Entree before apps before bread?  Ugh.  I honestly can't remember what I ate, but the entrees were lackluster.  The red sauce-eggplant pasta was exceedingly bland, only somewhat helped by the shave-at-your-table parmesan (a nice touch, for sure).  The apps were tasty but minuscule.  We won't be back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
It's true, we drove 45 minutes from North Lake Tahoe to get to the Macaroni Grill in Reno.  I guess when you have a large group and you're in a relatively rural area...there aren't that many places to go.  

We were a large group (11 people), and they were able to take our reservation relatively late in the day (just a few hours before dinner).  Always so convenient for a large party.  Even though Macaroni Grill is a chain, it's actually relatively nice - the open kitchen and stone decor on the interior make it seem much higher end.  

Unfortunately, the food was definitely below average.  My friend and I ordered the portobello mushroom chicken and the lobster ravioli and split the two dishes; it was probably the worst lobster ravioli I've ever had.  I'm not actually sure there was any lobster in my ravioli.  The portobello mushroom chicken was pretty decent, but the side (spinach orzo) was very blah.  We started the appetizer sampler which really is just a taste of a bunch of different appetizers (calamari, fried mozzarella, bruschetta, etc.).  We also ordered desserts which were huge - I'm not a dessert person, and I didn't even try a bite, but people seemed generally satisfied.

The service was actually great.  The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't available, and they provided a few other options and allowed us to try them.  Also, our server was really attentive and nice.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I always stop in for the thin crust pizza. Basil, tomatoes, mozzarella spread generously. The Quattro cannoli from the tapas menu is another favorite. Since they redid the menu with the "tapas" dishes, I've enjoyed this place much more than in the past. My girlfriend always likes to build her own pasta dish. I usually prefer the meat based dishes over the pasta based.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Normally I like Macaroni Grill, but I don't know what in the hell has been up with them lately. Lack of concern? Lack of giving a crap about their patrons? Who knows. So I went there with my wife this past Monday night and our waitress was definitely not on point. Right out of the gate she asks us about our time constraints, and it was about 5:30 P.M. Now I can understand this logic if it were lunch time or earlier in the day, but that is literally the first time any waiter or waitress has ever asked me this at this time of the day. I hardly get asked this to begin with.

Not that it mattered, even if we were on a time constraint, we sure as hell weren't going anywhere fast, because "prompt service" was clearly not in her vocabulary. My wife ordered a glass of Pinot Noir and I got a Soda and Salad to start off with. I get my drink and Salad within 5 minutes... Still no wine for my wife. She's going around attending to some of the other folks, then mentions that "the wine is on the way." It's one glass of wine - what the hell? I didn't ask for a bottle of vintage wine from the Manager's personal stock at his house. 10 minutes later the wine gets there. My wife doesn't want to spoil the mood so I don't say anything, but I'm very visibly irritated and it's obvious at this point.

We had ordered around the time I got my salad, and come to find out now also, what my wife ordered she is just now finding out that they are "out of" for the night. Wonderful. So my food is almost ready at this point and my wife is having to re-order now. No offer to comp, no offer for complimentary dessert, nothing but pure apathy. Some of these waitresses and waiters wonder why people get crappy? Interesting.

We end up getting our food - I got the Chicken Marsala and my wife did a build your own spaghetti. My food went from pretty "meh" to kicking my ass afterward - it wasn't spicy at all yet it felt like fire coming out.

I won't go on and on beyond this because I don't have much else nice to say. I'm very disappointed with Macaroni Grill and their staff. I usually get better than this and they really flopped hard this time. I might give them one more chance... we'll see.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I have always loved going to Macroni Grille but this time was really disappointing. They had removed my favorite dish the salad didn't have the great creamy Italian dressing and the bread wasn't warm. The service was so so  I think I will have to find another go to restaurant when I go to Reno.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went to Macaroni Grill because I was craving this specific pasta dish I always get in Cali ... so we go there... it took FOREVER for our waiter to come to greet us.  Then we finally got our food and it was cold and tasted dirty.   We told the manager, he quickly got us another dish.  Still did not taste great.  Overall the management staff was great, took care of us but the food was not.  But I will give a lot of credit to the management because even though I won't go back because of the food the management made a bad experience tolerable.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Food was okay. Had a gift card, so figured we would try it, most likely will not return. Service was NOT good!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This place has gone downhill fast. 

Everytime I visit my grandma, we try to go here, but I think yesterday was our last visit. (The previous time we visited, we walked out because our food took over an hour and my 4 year old was freaking out.)

My grandma had some coupons for their new "$7 meal in 7 minutes or it's free" so we each ordered two lunches at the counter. After about 15 minutes, we are still waiting for our food. All the employees keep looking at us nervously because they know it's been longer than 7 minutes. 

The lady who rang us up briefly says something to the head honcho chef looking man and then brings our food to us. I tell her she knows it's been twice the amount of time promised and that we want our food for free as advertised. Now, if it had only been a few minutes longer, I wouldn't have made a big deal. But it took TWICE as long. She immediately says, "you only get it free if you are dining it. It doesn't count for to go orders." No. I can tell right off the bat that's a load of crap so we ask to speak to the chef boss man. 

Here is a whole new problem. This man walks up to me and my 70 year old grandmother and says, "Hi girls, what's going on?" GIRLS? Really? What a patronizing prick. Don't you dare address my 70 year old grandmother as "girl." UGH. Anyways, he claims that corporate told them it doesn't count on carry out orders. I tell him to show me that on any one of their numerous advertisements. He can't because obviously he's lying. He just doesn't want to get dinged for being so slow. He says, "Alright girls, I'll take care of it for you this time, but those are the rules." Great, take care of it asshole. 

So while we are waiting for a refund, I look up this 7 minute express lunch deal on my phone and find that it is indeed for dine in OR carry out. I show it to him and he is immediately red faced claiming he had no idea. 

To top it all off, the lady who rang us up realizes that one of our sandwiches is wrong because the right one just came out. 20 minutes later.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Wonderful service and delicious food. However, really dislike how it is per management to drop the check off during lunch time when you receive your meal. Even though the server told us, "No rush, we are supposed to leave the check early at lunch time, it's per management. " I still felt really rushed and just really dislike that they do this. Can't customer's just ask for their check if they are in a rush? Anyways, my husband' and my meal was delicious and absolutely exceptional. Definitely recommend.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
What is the hype all about?  I tried their shrimp portifino.  It was tasty. But was it worth $13.99?  No, not really.  It was a small portion loaded with pasta with few shrimps.  

Love their bread!

Parking sucks!

Service was okay. Friendly servers but not too attentive.  I always have to call my server to get refills.

At this point, three stars for mediocre experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I'm a big fan of Italian food and this place is awesome! Sure sometimes there service can be long, but in the end it's all worth it. The only reason there slow is because they're packed. That must be a very good sign. I've had Carmela's Chicken Rigatoni and it's delectable. I've also had their fish dish. Aka sole. now I'm not a big fan of fish but this dish was very well done, it didn't even taste like fish it was so good. The place is clean and well put together. One time it took a while for my food to get there but the waiter felt so bad that he got me an apron. Kinda weird but helps with cooking food. I love it!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Amanda was very attentive. Amanda knew her stuff, my boyfriend saw food being delivered and we asked what it was and it was the mama's trio, thumbs up. Service was fast and efficient, everyone helped to serve.
Prosecco la marca: very good. Eggplant parmesan was good, of course I had a to go box. Chocolate cake for dessert, yum!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: So my boyfriend took me here to eat tonight for our date night. I ordered the Seabass. In my opinion it was lacking some flavor. I liked the orzo spinach side better than I liked the main part of the dish. The server was friendly and our food was brought out promptly. The place was clean and decorated to look semi fancy. For dessert I ordered the vanilla gelato. It was tasty! Overall I enjoyed my experience and I would go back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This is a to be the worst place for food. The food was dry no flavor and they take for ever to get your order placed not worth the wait i would have rather not have eaten dinner..
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Brought the family here Saturday night for dinner and we were dissapointed.  Three of us ordered Mama's Trio and the food was totally lacking marinara sauce. When we asked for more the server brought us the tiniest cup full.  In addition, the servings of Chicken Parmesan were ridiculously small.  I find it amazing that the server even brought it to us.  It's too bad, but we won't be back.  I can think of better ways to spend +$100 for dinner.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The food was really delicious, and at a decent price. However, I felt kinda ignored by my server. She never brought us bread, and kept forgetting to check on us. It wasn't very busy at all, and we were still forgotten multiple times. 

I had the eggplant parmesan and it was absolutely amazing. My fiance had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and he really enjoyed it. The only complaint we had was the service. And we were really disappointed about the bread.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
You always know what to expect when you go there; a long wait, decent food, and poor service.  

Normally on a Friday or Saturday the wait can be up to 45 minutes...and the food is definitely not worth the wait.  The food is decent; stuff I could cook at home if I felt like cooking.  However, since it is a chain, the food is pretty consistent and bland.  The service pretty much sucks!  Our server spilled two glasses of water over me and two other people in our party.  All we got was a simple, "Oops", not even a "Sorry!"  I will only go there again if I am out of options.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Ate there last night with a group of about 50(with reservations). Room was so crowded servers were unable to get around tables. Everything had to be passed from one end of the table to the other. Entrees were prepared by type. That is all of one item was prepared and then so on. So in our case my wife's entree came out first and mine came out last. We were offered 3 dessert choices. After waiting approx. 45 mins for the chocolate cake they finally brought out the lemon dessert,with no explanation, for those that didn't get their chocolate cake. Finally after the lemon dessert was delivered it was apparent why it took so long, it was still partially frozen! Food was nothing to get excited about and a glass (actually 1/2 glass) was definitely overpriced at $8.50. Won't be in any hurry to go back or make a recommendation that anyone else does either!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I and my wife's first reno attempt at a restaurant and we stood at the host station waiting to be seated or greeted for nearly 5 min a waitress eventually walked by and asked us if we needed anything she attempted to ask the hostess about seating us she shrugged her shoulders and walked away so the waitress sat us no one smiling or friendly it was not packed decor was nice with out door seating avaliable but after being seated in the middle of the room no one around us I liked the separation with the wife but no service employees standing around joking with each other while we sat hungry I read my menu 7 times so we walked out I have never felt so insulted by a restaurant
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I am not big on going to chain restaurants to begin with, however I received a gift card card and decided to give it another shot this last week. It has been over a year since the last time I went here, and unfortunately nothing has changed. The food is bland and EXTREMELY overly priced. The bar has the cheapest wine you could ask for and they charge crazy prices for a glass. The only positive thing I could say about this place is that the service is friendly. I will not  EVER be going to this place again, despite if I have a gift card or not.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We partook in the express dinner tonight for the first time. The hostess was nice enough to explain how it worked! It was a great option forbus because the price point was good, and we weren't  wanting to spend a lot of time out at dinner, we were just avoiding cooking at home.  Our server was Aubrie, it was her first time doing the express dining but she was great. Her cheerful  attitude made our experience excellent! I would come back again for the service alone, although the food was also wonderful! If you are coming in and wanted a faster dining experience the express dining is the way to go! The food comes in 9 mins or it's  free (I  timed ours for curiosities sake, and it came in less than 3 mins). Overall a great experience!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We came here on a Monday around 5:15 in the evening, and found the place to be very empty, which was a nice change from previous visits.  We were seated right away.  There was something on one of the benches at our booth, so we decided to switch sides.  I then pointed out the puddle of liquid on the floor to the young man that seated me, but he didn't offer to clear the puddles on the floor, he did clean the bench, or move us to another location.  Thankfully the liquid was just far enough out of range to where it wouldn't get on our feet.
We had an offer for a BOGO Pasta Milano dish, and we planned on taking advantage of it.  Our server, Saul?, was very friendly and attentive.  He was sure to bring more bread and water as we needed it and offered fresh crushed black pepper or cheese with each dish that he brought out.  However, he did fail to tell us that we would be charged for ordering soup with our offer, even though we read (we could have misread) that soup and salad was included, but you could upgrade to a better salad for an extra cost.  In any event, the tomato soup was quite good, but the minestrone left something to be desired.  There was plenty of "content" in the soup, but the broth was lacking flavor.
The pasta dish portions were very nice, we both brought home left overs, and it was also very tasty!  If we had one "issue" with it, it was the lack of sauce.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Being seated and waiting 30 minutes before anyone checks on us. Drinks, bread. A date night gone bad due this fine establishment.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had a birthday dinner at The Macaroni Grill last night. I have to say that I received wonderful service. Amanda, our server, was friendly, helpful and did everything she could to make sure we had a great experience. We had the manager come over and check on our party, making sure we had a great evening. We even met the head chef, who wanted to check and see if our meal was to our liking, come over and talk with us. Our party had various items from the menu and we all walked away full, happy and so willing to come back again. It may be a chain restaurant, but it really felt like a small, family run business, making sure we felt special the entire time we were there. Thank you for making this birthday party a special one!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had a GREAT dining experience at this location thanks to Tina!!!!  I didn't feel rushed, the food was hot and Tina was super helpful!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Food was OK not very good. Would not go back. Server Jamie was very nice! The bread that they give you to start was overpowering with rosemary and salt. Way too much salt. And the pasta was something that an average Joe person can make at home. Save your money and go to Sardinas or Johnny's for good Italian food.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Ok. Nothing really to rave about. I have not eaten at Romano's in over six years and wanted to try it out. They took off two of my favorite dishes, which was the cannelloni and the prosciutto and peas penne. The rosemary bread was bitter and the balsamic vinegar they serve with the bread is really low quality because of the acidity of it. Ok place if there isn't any other better Italian places in your city to eat; however, in Reno, plenty of other places I would recommend.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The service is fine, I have no complaints there, nor anything negative to say about the facilities themselves. 

The food is bad though. I once ordered a chicken "salad", which was a very thin, chewy, greasy bit of (I am assuming) chicken meat, pounded out to the size of a manhole cover, and served on top of some spinach. It was difficult to cut through, using a very large and sharp knife; eating it made me feel sad. I think there were tomatoes? The soggy, yet somehow hard, chicken-blanket overwhelmed everything else. 

I've tried the food here several times. The only good thing I have had is the bread. If I were Romano, I would be molto triste, but I am pretty sure he isn't real.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Ordering from this place is a nightmare. I work for ubereats and they "missed" my order. I lost 30 min of work time. They look very unorganized and don't seem to have a lot of communication between the chefs and the servers. Also the manager did nothing to help. An employee asked her a question and she responded rudely to her own employee.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Half Price Wine... say what?  
Are you kidding me, $2.75 for a glass of their house wine?  #SOLD

Keeping in mind that I had never dined at a Macaroni Grill before..
I ate at this Macaroni Grill last week and sat at the bar.  The service was stellar, met two nice employees and enjoyed my Chicken Parmesan.  The food came out  quick, was a big portion and had a nice atmosphere.

I enjoyed it - and am taking my staff here next Friday for our holiday dinner.

Give them a shot - a nice in-between considering Olive Garden or Carraba's.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My rating is based upon the fact that it is a chain owned resteraunt. I always get the eggplant parmigiana. It's made with handmade pasta noodles and it's delicious. Everytime I come here it's always good, hot, fresh, and welcoming.

My little thing that annoys me about this place is that they put like 2 cups for every customers plate setting and then on top
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My meal was very good. My waitress was excellent. The price was a little higher than other restaurants with a similar dish.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Top notch! My girlfriend and I have been here a few times and every time we have been there the service and food has been fantastic! We are always treated with so much respect. The staff is always so quick and caring about our service. The food has always been amazing. We love the portobello fries and the sauce that comes with it. I haven't ordered everything off the menu but I can vouch for it because what we have ordered has been so good. I highly recommend the Macaroni grill to anyone looking for delicious Italian cuisines!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I have not been here in about 7 years. What I remember being the best bread and best dipping sauce was certainly disappointing. The bread used to be very soft, and the oil for dipping tasted of a better quality and had seasoning in it. Now the bread had a slight crunch on the top and the oil had no seasoning and didn't taste very good. The food was of decent quality for a chain, meaning average. I had their limoncello martini which was excellent and then tried their Bellini. It was way too sweet, I couldn't drink it. Our waiter was excellent, service all around great, fast, and good ambiance.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Came thanksgiving day because no one else was open. THE BEST service I've ever had. Lindsay was so cute and sooooo prompt and on top of things. Food was yummy and they had a thanksgiving meal and great wine deals.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We don't dine here often because we live in out of town, but each time we've been the service is friendly, helpful and timely. The food is consistent in quality, love the paper table cloths and I really like the atmosphere.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My last visit to this establishment was about 8 years ago and the experience was quite good. We had friends visiting us from Tanzania and we decided to treat them to an Italian evening, bad idea choosing Macaroni grill! 
We were seated promptly, our server was very friendly (1  star), bread was served, balsamic vinegars hit the table midway during the meal. The food was really mediocre, my Salmon was dry, the raviolis were ok to say the least, the chicken was also dry. We pretended to enjoy the food as we did not want our friends to notice our discomfort  I bet they were probably doing the same!!  Not spending my money here again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had a terrible time. First my server was not very nice. Second, made my kids wait for their food while everyone else was served. Third, spoke with manager and then it just got awkward. Server got snotty and tried to show no I'll feelings, but just pushed us aside. Made faces and failed to connect with us. This was my wedding dinner that we did with our closest friends. This has ruined the meal. Dessert, I did not have the stomach to ask had a hard time enjoying my dinner also. More things happened that made the night very uncomfortable. Please stay away from this place if it means anything to you or your family. I will never come back again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Started with bruschetta and it was super bland. The Alfredo sauce was overly salty had to send it back.  The spaghetti was pretty bland as well.  I had the fat bread and it was good, tons of crust!  The marinara for dipping was a little on the sweet side for my taste.  Overall disappointed in our visit.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Our waiter was very attentive and always making sure we were doing okay or offering suggestions. However, the food was "okay." I had the Alfredo, but there was nothing special about it. My first bite of the chicken had a long black hair in it, which definitely disgusted me, but I didn't want to make a fuss so I just kept picking through it carefully. My fiancé had the Truffle Macaroni and it didn't have any distinct flavor to separate it from any other macaroni at a restaurant. The cheese was a little hardened to the macaroni and was just overall, not the best. We ended up sharing my Alfredo. My sister got the salmon and was not impressed with that either. She maybe ate a half of it and then switched to eating the bread. 
Overall, if you are looking for somewhere that has decent service, Macaroni Grill has that! But the food isn't anything special especially for the price!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My spouse and I went to the restaurant on a Tuesday night about 7 pm .They were not very busy. We both ordered dinners.The service was very good, but the food was terrible. My spouses lasagna was burned on the bottom, the spaghetti was luke warm with very little sauce.My meal was an angle hair pasta with shrimp and it was not warm enough for me to eat. When I order meal I at least expect it to come to the table hot. We have given this place 3 times to get it right, we will not be returning gor a 4th try.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Met a friend for dinner last night. She wanted to go here because they were doing a fundraiser for the Humane Society. We were seated right away. Got our iced teas quickly and the bread shortly after. After we finally decided on what we wanted, our waiter informed us they were out of meatballs. Really? That is what we were both wanting. So she went with lasagna and I had the eggplant. Both were good. 

The only low point was we never got any water. This would have been fine except we had to ask for refills on the iced tea.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I've gone to this place many times with family (I never get the urge to eat here they for some reason do.) Every single order has been cold it's like they wait to serve the food together but half the plates come out cold the others hot. The staff is very friendly very calm place but I am not there for the staff or atmosphere I am there to eat and unfortunately every dish I've ordered has been cold. Serve the ******* food before it gets cold!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We have eaten at here on many of occasions although it has been a while since we have been in to the restaurant. Our server Jayme was fabulous. Nice smile and service throughout our visit. 

The food is why only the 2 stars. I ordered  rustica and my husband ordered fettucine alfredo with shrimp. I have ordered the rustica on several of our visits it is one of my favorite dishes. But tonight it was dry and the shrimp were small compared to all the other times I have ordered it. They were dry and tough. Size wise they probably were something you could buy in a 60 count bag. I did ask for extra sauce and Jayme was more than happy to get it for me. However, the sauce had a lot of black pepper in it which made it spicy/hot and not very enjoyable. A few pieces of the chicken were fatty. Just not a pleasant experience.  My husband said his alfredo was bland and needed some help. His shrimp was also the same size that were in my dish  and it didn't have very many in his dish. The bread was awesome. Hot and fresh. 

I probably will go back because this is the first "bad" experience we have had with the food here. I just hope they are not trying to adjust the recipes using less quality products.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Is it possible to give this place a - review?!?!?! Just left the place waiting to get served, literally watched the server help 3 groups that were there after us, drinks and got their orders and all, while my wife and I watch and still they do not acknowledge us!!! I dont post any reviews whatsoever but I feel that future customers may feel this type of service as well! Thanks but no thanks, I'd rather take my business to the Olive Garden down the street since past experiences we've been treated WAY better! BTW, when we first got there, there was no host, and they weren't even busy at all!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My boyfriend and I came to Macaroni Grill for our anniversary and the most awesome waiter! I wish we had gotten his name, but he was so kind and wonderful to us. He asked us questions and talked to us every time he came over. Wonderful human!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town. 

So  just right after the holidays , we decided to try their dinner, the service personnel were equally pleasant and friendly.  The food were served quick and as tasty as I remembered.  Just so happens I have also received a $10 off $30 meal promotion on my meal made it even a better experience.  I think we are going to be regulars.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I had a gift card, so went with high hopes & we experienced nice service with ok happy hour drinks. I was hoping for good food but it fell short of the mark. The Alfredo sauce was runny & bland. The chicken parm was thin & served with spaghetti, why? If it wasn't for the free bread I might have left hungry. Nothing to brag about, but dont take my word for it, the 2 1/2 stars is fitting.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Fun story.  Last week Macaroni Grill was running a special for 2 for one express lunches.  Normal cost is $7.00, but with the deal order one entree, get the second one for free.
I work in a large office.  A number of people at the office decided this would be a great day to order lunch at Macaroni Grill and take advantage of the 2 for 1 price.  12-16 people placed orders online.  If you are in the restaurant the express lunch is $7.00 ready in 7 minutes or the order is free.  This is not true of the online ordering.  We were fine with this.  We were told by the online order the time our last order would be ready was about 20 minutes.  We arrived in 25 minutes in hopes our orders would be ready.  Long story short, they were not ready and we ended being at the restaurant 35 minutes waiting.  Lots of the food was cold, some people didn't get what they ordered and overall the initial experience was not good.  I called and asked to speak to the manager on duty.  It was Troy but he was behind the counter cooking to help get orders out.  This I could be believe because the restaurant was really really busy.
I left my name and number and asked for him to call me back.  After the lunch rush he called me back.  He was extremely sincere and apologetic.  He asked where we worked and offered to make things right.  He gave us two choices.  He would provide a family style meal or we could do a "do over".  I choice the "do over" since the whole office didn't order didn't think it would be fair to bring in a family style meal and not share with everyone. Troy give me the direct number to him and told me when he would be in the restaurant.  

Today was "Do Over" day.  I called about 45 minutes before we wanted to pick up the order.
Troy remembered speaking to me ( it was 6 days ago), he asked for the orders no questions asked.  I gave him a list of orders and included each person's name. He asked when I wanted to pick up the order.  I said 11:30.  One of the items we ordered were cookies.  He explained they don't always have cookies but he would see what he could do for us. We got to the restaurant and could see things were much calmer.  Our order was being put together and we were asked to have a seat for a few minutes.  At most we waited 5 minutes and we were handed three bags of food, extra dressings, cheese and utensils.  I asked the two people who presented our food to thank Troy for us.  As we were walking out, he called to us and asked us to wait a minute.  He came up to us with freshly baked chocolate chip cookies still hot and gooey.  You could tell they had just come out of the oven. I thanked him again for making this right and going above and beyond.

Thank you again Troy for turning this around.  We will definitely be back.
Grateful,
Lisa
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This was always a favorite casual restaurant of mine, but the last few times we've been here have not been so good.  Today was no exception to this new rule.  I ordered the chicken with roasted vegetables and he had a pizza.  After waiting quite awhile for the food, the chicken on my plate was so over-salted it was not edible and had to be sent back.  By the time my new plate came out, he was already finished eating.  So, we each ate alone even though we were at the same table, they offered nothing to him while he waited for me to eat, and not one bit of the check was reduced.  This left such a bad (and salty) taste in my mouth  that I will not spend another penny here.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: How's this place still in business? Service was decent but it could not save itself from a one star review. Where do I even start? I guess appetizers... the calamari was the worst I have ever eaten. It's worst than getting it from the frozen section of a dollar store bad! Seriously. My father and brother's steak were so tough, they couldn't cut it. It wasn't just the steaks fault but their steak knifes were dull af. Our seafood pasta dish was over cooked and description was bad. Maybe it's my fault but usually dishes that has the word white wine in it, we assume it was a white sauce dish. Nope. At this point. We were ready to leave. Heck, I'm ready to leave this review because there was so many bad things, I don't feel like talking about it all. My advice, anywhere is better than here and I mean it.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Ok, so I'm normally not a fan of chain resturants.  To me it is much more fun to find a local place with ambiance that is unique to where you are.  This way you can support local buisness and try something new.  As far as chain places go though, this one is my favorite.  Here's why...

1.  The cheese raviolis with pesto sauce and grilled mushrooms, basil and broccoli.  YUM!
2.  All the food is pretty good here, and I like that the meat-free options have lots of add on veggie options
3.  They will bring it out to your car when you order to-go
4.  When dining in the ambiance is great...fireplace, nice music, nice lighting

yeah, i gotta go, I am craving Italian now ;-)
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The 3 stars are for the new Ginger Spritzer, which I could never get enough of, & the Italian lessons you get in the ladies room, lol!

I've had a couple of dishes here. 

The eggplant in the eggplant parmigiana was sliced really thick. I'm used to thin slices, so I can't say I loved it. 

The crusted sole was my least favorite dish here. I'm not sure if it was simply a fluke, but it was SOAKED in grease (butter or oil, not sure & don't care). There were maybe 5 little capers on top & I did ask for more, hoping to salvage the taste of the least greasy portions.   

The orzo with the sun dried tomatoes was YUMMY.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
April 2, 2011 Saturday - Dinner 5:45 PM
2 people (1 kid and me)

Atmosphere - 5 stars
Food - 4 stars
Service - 3 stars

Background - Been here many times in the past but do not remember how long it has been since the last visit, more than a year easily.

Atmosphere - Dimly lit restaurant chain with a rustic "Italian" feel.  The restaurant was full and half of the customers were prom goers.  While waiting to be seated I just my daughter the cart of logs being hauled in, which led to the conversation about the wood oven they have in the corner of the kitchen.

Food
Appetizer - The free bread they provide before the meal was piping hot, the steamed poured out after pulling it apart with my hands.  The second loft served during the meal was the same way.

Dinner - I had order the Roasted Chicken Cannelloni.  The cheese filling was excellent.  The sauce was not too sweet, just right, but there could have been more.  I would have loved to dip my bread into the sauce.  The chicken had little to no flavor; it could have been very firm tofu.  I would have preferred that the cannelloni be served on a plate instead of a flat wide bowl; it just made the use of a fork a little challenging, as the bowl served no purpose to hold anything in.

Dessert - We skipped this as I had planned on another location for this treat.

Service - The hostess indicated that was a small wait as they were cleaning and prepping the table, not an issue as I was expecting a wait.  A minute later she indicated that she was ready.  While walking to the table half way there we had to turn around as the table was not ready.  When we did get there the table was set up for four people, strange.  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  My daughter received an adult sized beverage, I figured she was getting older, so I was comfortable and did not send it back even though she order from the kids menu.  So the bill arrived and her drink was on the tab, as it should not be as it is part of the kid's meal.  They charge $2.20 for a glass of Sprite, really?  I brought this up to the waitress, she looked at the bill and then the class quickly, and instantly she knew what happened.  She indicated that I was correct, and in less than a minute it was corrected with a new bill.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Romano's is usually very consistent and that's a good thing when traveling.. Trying new places in Reno hasn't really been good experiences so we decided to go with what we know. 

Our server (Sinead) was very pleasant, friendly and seemed like she was enjoying her job.. It was a Friday evening a little slow so we had time to talk with her as we were her only table. 

The food was spot on with our favorite dishes. 

One of the hostesses (Megan) stood on a chair and sang a beautiful Italian opera song which was very nice. We've never had experienced this before. 

The place was spotless. I don't know the managers name (mid age white female) and she didn't stop.. She was on the go the whole time doing whatever needed to be done. She stopped by to ask if everything was ok.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Several of us had lunch there, the pasta was so under cooked you could use it for tires.  The Alfredo and Pomodoro sauces and the pasta were all but cold, lukewarm would be a stretch.  Very unpleasant, we won't be back.  Not much has changed over the years.  When they first opened years ago they were good, not so much now.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We were seated right away and the food was great as well as the service we received from our server "Tina", we will definitely be back again!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Very disappointed with my experience. I could go into details but I'm too upset to sit here and write about it since it was just a few minutes ago. Would not recommend
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I met a friend for dinner tonight at 6 pm and was greeted by several friendly staff members. We were quickly seated by our server named James who was a delight. I had the Mushroom Ravioli which was perfectly prepared and served within 20 minutes of ordering and my friend ordered the Chicken Marsala and said it too was delicious. Due to last minute Christmas shoppers it wasn't as crowded as most Friday nights.  Perhaps the low ratings were given by people who want to keep the crowds down, but we were very satsfied.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I honestly have never been so impressed by a restaurant in my whole life. We arrived at about 7pm and were quickly seated. We then had to wait over 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. When our waitress arrived she was frazzled,(not fault of her own). We asked for a manger and quickly Troy, the kitchen manager, arrived. He instantly stated our wait was unacceptable and took our order immediately. He made us laugh and made us feel important. He instantly went and put in our order and consistently came back with our food to ensure our service was prompt and delivered with a smile and friendly attitude. Troy is the definition of what a great manger is. He made sure that the guest was completely satisfied and that the staff was supported. I'd come back for no other reason then Troy. You are doing something right here in Reno and have made a lifetime customer.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Service was excellent. Bailey killed it, great attitude, awesome food but service was what will keep people coming back. Been a server for 12 years, I know good service, and she really made it a good experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had dinner last night last night.  I had wanted to try Macaroni Grill for dinner,  after having enjoyed lunch  in Roseville. I don't know if my expectations were too high. But we both ordered the lasagna, and that should of been served warmer than it was, almost cold and lack any seasoning or something. That combined with less than attentive service. Left us both a little surprised and disappointed, simply put, can't recommend this place at all.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The food was good and the appetizers where good also the problems we had were that the hostess was very rude and not polite at all this was on 6 28 19 the service was good but we were told some things on the menu not available on a Friday at 730 pm over all this was just a fair dinner will try one more time but only one more devon.was a good waiter.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I love this restaurant.  Though I no longer drink, when I did drink I enjoyed the big jug of wine.  This is a funny story about the Restaurant in Denver CO. My client and I, through my bosses urgings I took her out to lunch.  We must have gotten a bit loud, and the waiter came over and nicely told us "we were cut off".  I laughed and said "take it away, you scared me as I was afraid this great Restaurant was out of my all time favorite dish Shrimp Portofino.  I love the bread, dipped in olive oil and fresh vinegar. 
The desert tray.  I better stop as I'm getting hungry.  
It's late so I'll go tomorrow and get my fix.  
I highly recommend this place.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Our Friday night dinner was unforgettable. 

I look my friend our for his first Italian dinner, It was such a great experience, Our waiter was really nice and helpful. 

We ordered the Shrimp Portofino - Angel Hair Pasta with Sauteed Shrimp, Mushrooms, Pine Nuts, and Spinach with a Citrus Butter Sauce and the Pasta Milano- Juicy Grilled Chicken with Mushrooms, Sun-Dried Tomatoes in a Garlic Cream Sauce with Bow Tie Pasta. 

The Shrimp Portofino could have been a larger portion seemed a bit small but was very delicious. The right out of the oven fresh baked bread dipped in Olive Oil & Balsamic was to die for. 

Wonderful experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I love the Macaroni Grill, but I had the WORDT service at this location! The server was actually really nice! BUT we NEVER checked on us, gave us water or anything. It talked to a couple, in assuming regulars, at the bar the entire time. When we went the restaurant was dead, there were only 3 tables, and that couple at the bar. But the server just focused and talked to the people at the bar. It was annoying. I just wanted some water. But couldn't get any.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Went in for my wifes birthday and had the worst service. Our server alfredo hardly checked on us. When asked for drinks I asked for a couple of samples of wine and he looked a bit irritated since I wanted to know what bottle I wanted to get for dinner. After he brought the samples with attitude I decided to get a beer. When our food arrived we were offered nothing with our meals and only brought 2 set ups when there was 4 of us. Mid meal one of us asked for cheese and alfredo brought it with a little bit of anger. I would understand if it was busy that he was frustrated and slammed but it was a slow night. The party of 4 behind us sounded like they had great service and even offered us their bread since it took forever for our server to approach us. I don't think we will ever come back since the service was horrid.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Ate here with my family in March 2018, and we all enjoyed our experience.  This was one of the better Macaroni Grills we have visited.

The Restaurant has a great traditional classy Italian decor.  The staff and servers were all very nice and attentive.  Really nice and comfortable ambiance.

The food was delicious.  Everyone loved their meal.  The portion size was above average the the quality was great.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food and quality.

We would eat here again, and would encourage our family and friends to do the same.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Great experience, delicious food. Bailey delivered us the best service imaginable and because of her excellence, we will be back very soon.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My husband and I went in today for dinner. Server was nice but spoke about how busy and short handed they were. Food was good and so was the wine. But why I give this place a 1 star is because of the bald man with the white jacket. I kid you not, he greeted every single table but ours. Could it be because we are brown??!! If your going to go around and greet your customers, great them all! Not that feelings were hurt, but I observe and Bald Man...YOU were very unprofessional.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had never been to the one on Reno.  Went with a friend one evening for dinner.  Service was poor and food wasn't anything spectacular.  I probably won't go back again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The service tonight was super slow. Server didn't come back and offer us second bar drinks until our food had arrived so the wine came after dinner was over. Chicken parm was rubbery. New York Style cheesecake was hard and dry.  I seriously thought at first with the fork it was frozen. Nope. Just dry. The bread was good tho but took a while to come to us. And it was expensive even with a discount coupon. We won't be back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Meal was good. We came for dinner.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs. I like the way it used to be with two large meatballs. They were hand packed here and made fresh. Now they are small and give you more like 8 little ones. They are frozen and processed. Not even close. I don't like when chains try to cut corners and go cheap. They sacrifice quality. Some damn bean counter came up with this.  I will never order this again.  Not worth it. I can do better at home. When I go out for dinner, I want something I can't get at home.
Everything else was good.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I would give 0 stars if I could, took togo person 10 minutes to even acknowledge my existence, 45 minutes to get my order, restaurant was totally dead, customer service is terrible here, always is and always will be
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This place is where my family celebrates. We come here because we know the staff is friendly, the restaurant is warm and inviting, and the food is delicious. 

I do wish there were a few more vegetarian items, but what they do offer is prepared well.

If you're looking for a place to host a party or a large family gathering, this is the restaurant to go!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Cristina (TINA) made my evening. The food was awesome and the service was outstanding.  This was a great visit.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We went to Macaroni Grill last weekend, and really enjoyed it. 
The bread and peppered oil here is  - 5 stars YUM. 
We started with fried cheese - delish 
I had a Caesar salad - it was awesome 
I had the honey grilled salmon with rice - it was amazing REALLY amazing! The fish was PERFECT.. 

Our server kept our glasses full - love Cate!!! She even wrote her name down on the paper table cloth so we would know her name.
