My friend had the chicken Parmesan - it was SO good, he couldnt stop saying "ummm this is SO good" which takes a lot to get him all excited about his food - I really thought he was gonna go make love to the chef! 

We shared a slice of New York cheese cake at this point my gut was about to bust but I managed to scarf down a bite or two - WOW it was yummy too! 

$65.00 for 2 to eat like a couple of pigs on really good food, with great service ***clapping clapping**** 

I LOVE YOU ROMANOOOOOOOOOO 
*blowing kisses* 

p.s. parking is a bit sucky - but you will need a little walk after you stuff your face so stop complaining just walk the 20 extra steps!!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We've been here a few times in the past. It l had always been been enjoyable but things seemed to have moved in a downward direction.  
I ordered the calamari appetizer and a spaghetti with meatballs main.  The calamari was served warm at best, definately not hot right out of the fryer and was a little more chewy than properly prepared squid. It came with two dipping sauces but one was so dense as to be useless.  The pasta dish was just OK, nothing to write home about.  
Wait service was pleasant.
I don' think I'll be returning.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Missed this place since they closed down my local spot. You still get crayons and a paper table cloth, bread and olive oil and self pour wine by the glass. Food was all good. Service decent.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We were told there would be a 30-minute wait, even thought more than half the tables were available.  Once seated, the service was slow, with a disinterested waitress, but I can live with that if the food is really good. Far from it: the minimally-boiled sausage in my pasta was cool to slightly chilled; the overall pasta dish was served barely warm.  This, plus my wife's dish and a couple bottles of water, came to almost $50.  Mediocre, low value food and indifferent service risks your going back into bankruptcy--my wife and I certainly won't be returning anytime soon.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Saul did a marvelous job very kind and attentive and patient and recommended dishes and drinks  that were very delicious the food was excellent as well as our drinks this is our first time coming and we will certainly be back!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I love this place in different location, but this one on South Virginia has to be the nastiest I have ever ate at. The chef over cooked the food, the waiter never came back to check on us or ask for more water. The food took almost an hour to get to us, the bread was cold and the waiter said they are fresh and coming out the oven, but how is it cold? When it came out the oven The cruton in the salad was so overwhelming with burnt taste. My little brother order the mama trio, and that lasagna with wine, was so overwhelming with the bitterness of the wine, to the point he couldn't eat it, because they did not reduce the wine down.i will never ever go back to this place. Maybe you should hire a real Italian chef who knows the culture food, instead of a sloppy Mexican chef who doesn't care how the food comes out
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This place was awful. We were waiting 1 and a half waiting for our food. The waitress would ignore what we were saying and we would then have to ask a different waiter or we would have to repeat what we were saying. She claimed that the"computers weren't working and lots of other excuses. But there was another waiter who served his customers before us when we arrived before them. In conclusion I would not recommend this place one bit, we were so mad that we just walked out of there.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: So sad I used to love this place sadly on my last visit I ordered my favorite  eggplant parmesan which is usually a pretty big platter, instead I got 3 golf ball sized pieces of eggplant. I was disappointed in the size and when I took my first bite I tasted a charcoal flaver ALL of them had been burnt to a crisp!!! then flipped over and served!!!!!!! We alerted the waiter who just brought us more eggplant 30mins later by the time I got it everyone in my party had eaten! and it was under cooked this time raw eggplant is not delicious, then they expected me to PAY for that!!! This branch has gone down the drain
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Let me tell you, if you are over 65 years of age on a Monday Night, this is the place for you. They've got the old man that only came for dessert and has probably been here for 3 hours. They've got the two older men watching sports and talking too loud because one of them cannot hear and the other has all the things to say. All the things. And last, but not least, we've got the older lady in the bathroom shoving paper towels in her purse.

All and all, it was okay.

I thought they were closing soon because the waiter came back in minute and a half intervals to if we were ready to order. Come to find out she was just super attentive because it is after all a slow Monday night. She was actually really nice. She's the reason this review is a 3 star instead of a two. 

I'm one of those people who look over the menu searching for something new to try and inevitably get what I always get: in this case, chicken fettuccine Alfredo. I give this dish effort for trying. I wasn't creamy, just oily, but it was still flavorful, so that was cool. 

My significant other got the truffle mac n cheese, which he was all about. I wasn't that into it, but as you can see, I'm kind of a turd. 

They had Coca Cola, which made me happy because I dislike Pepsi very much. They also give you a free square loaf of fresh bread... but no butter knife, which pretty much sums up the experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Food was good. No wow factor about it. This place doesn't really set itself apart from Applebee's or Chili's etc.. but like I said, no complaints about the food.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Good, not great.  Service a bit slow, bread served in one large hunk so everyone at the table has to put their hands all over it to cut it.  Salad mainly romaine ribs, not leaves and too big for bite size. Now I remember why I haven't been there in years.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The service was decent here for lunch and the food is just alright.  I probably would only come back if I was super hungry and nothing else was close by.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Good chain gone bad!
We'll never eat here again!
Poor service and bad food
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went to eat lunch at this restaurant two days ago. Knowing  that i forgot my sun glasses after we ate. Then I called and ask if they found my sunglasses they said they don't find any and they cleaned up after we done eating. I have it with me I know for sure because after eating I am planning to go to Meadow Wood  for the maintenance of my sunglasses then My Bf came so we decided to go home instead. Then I remember my sunglasses that I have and it's not in my purse so I called up the restaurant and ask if they find any sunglasses on the bench seat they said they didn't find any  - They are sure that they clean the table and that place where we sat and never find any sunglasses I know I have it with me I never gone anywhere else before and after we ate so somebody had taken my sunglasses and never bring it to the lost and found. It sucks because I don't feel comfortable and and knowing that if you left Something in that place it's all gone. Are you going to tell me that it's all my faultBecause it's my responsibility but sometimes things happens and somebody will take advantage of it.You guys suck
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Shrimp portofino. If you come to MacGrill, order this and only this. 

Otherwise, you may find yourself disappointed. Notice I didn't say that you WILL find yourself disappointed, it's not sure thing. Which is why, for now, I can only give MG 3 stars. I've given this restaurant more chances than I really should have. And consistency is really the only factor that is just not quite where i'd like it to be. 

Some days the meal is delicious. Some days my entree was somehow never placed with the rest of my table's order. Some days my meal is a disaster. 

As far as chain restaurants go, I'd still pick MG over almost anything else. 

And really, for a server to have to learn how to spell his/her name upside down and in crayon at every table without screwing up? That deserves some props. Not ever server at every restaurant has THAT as a prerequisite. ("heh, well, so uh, actually my name is Antoinette. But f*ck you if you think i'm going to write that on your table cloth. You may call me A. Can I get you all something to drink?"

Shrimp portofino. End.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Tried this for a mid week dinner with the family. Place was dead but service was very slow, bread was very stale. Bathrooms were disgusting, as were the floors and tables. This place was dirty and all furniture could use a good wipe down. Our waiter sucked. We waited nearly 20 minutes for our salad, entrees came much later and 1 was cold...neyver again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Been here many times in the past, had forgotten why it had been so long since our last visit. Love the ambiance, the smells of Italy as you open the door. We ordered our entree and a dinner salad each. We waited and waited and waited. Finally had to ask for the salads, it's a salad, not too time consuming. We look presentable, had showered and are great tippers, however, seems our waitress felt others far more deserving of her time and attention. So disappointing and suddenly I recalled what had kept us away for so long. Their poor customer service.  I always want to have a great dining experience and go in with a positive attitude but will be some time before I forget.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The portions were tiny....everything is extra and the service is weak.
Lobster ravioli was cold. Shrimp on the verge of spoiled.  Diet coke and water were wonderful that is why I give it star. 
Have not been here in awhile....used to be good now it is weak compared to even Olive Garden.
Step it up Romano or call yourself history
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Food okay, Service lousy.

We went on a Thursday night (12/27/18).  Not really busy, but the service was terrible.  We will never go there again.  There are too many other choices that will give good service.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Generally speaking, my experience at Macaroni Grill has rarely been a disappointment however this time it was all about recovery and genuine great service which prompted this review and hats off to our server (Lura) who did an amazing job!

To elaborate a bit on what I mean with my introduction, it started when I ordered the pollo caprese. According to the menu, this dish is grilled chicken breast, imported buffalo mozzarella, imported pomodorina, capellini but I've been on carb restricted diet so I opted out the capellini pasta and subbed the sautéed spinach. So what arrived from the kitchen was a grilled, tough and dry chicken breast, uncooked (basically raw) spinach and a few clumps of mozzarella (which had a unusual taste I find hard to describe, but not as it should). There was no imported pomodorina nor did the dish look at all appetizing!

I thought to myself after the runner left it on the table that I would never order this dish again even before I tasted it, so when our server Lura stopped shortly there after to check on the meal she could see immediately that I was not pleased and glanced at my plate and understood why. She politely asked me if she could make the matter right and took my plate back to the kitchen.

She returned a short while later with my dinner and brought the pomodorina which really helped the dish and a complete new order of the spinach (but again - was not really any better than the first version I was served). 

My recommendation is with all the other menu options to choose from at Macaroni Grill, keep clear of this particular dish, but do ask for Lura because she is a delight and really tried her best to make this so-so meal a more pleasurable experience!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
SHOUTS OUT BOBBY 

2nd time out here in Reno, extremely hungry, only thing that sounded appetizing at the time was pasta. Contacted my friend who is a local. He recommended Macaroni Grille and a few others but macaroni grille was the closest and said F it. So I made the 5 minute drive from the Peppermill. It was around 9 pm when I arrived. Parking was accessible. Got inside, unfortunately was not greeted promptly. After asking a bartender if it was open sitting or if someone would seat us she helped us right away and sat us. No biggie. Inside was clean. Host sat us down next to the fire place where we would be warm! Very nice. Our waiter, by the name of Robert, introduced himself and instantly offered us a wine. We had the sausage rigatoni and spaghetti with meatballs. I ordered the sausage rigatoni spicy. Robert offered to bring out a few things to spice up our dish- nice touch! While waiting for our food we were brought the free bread with oil. To be honest, wasn't a big fan of the bread but no big deal! We didn't come here for the bread. While waiting for our pasta we had Sauvignon Blanc. As someone who does not drink wine, the Sauvignon black was the niceyest that I've ever had, (again, I don't drink wine). Our pasta arrived and Robert brought us Parmesan cheese and red pepper flake. To wrap it up, Robert was great because of his personal recommendations and his professionalism as a server, he made the experience really great, he's the man. I'll ask for him whenever I come back one day.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: AWFUL SERVICE! I don't think I have ever had such bad service in my life. The waitress who only had three tables, yes I counted, kept vanishing for long periods of time. I could tell the other tables that were hers were getting upset as well. And when she was in sight she would be next to the manger laughing it up instead of doing her job. The only reason we came to this place was because we had a gift card but we definitely won't be coming back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Can't recommend this restaurant.  I ordered the salmon.  Was dry and on the plate with it is only a few greens.; no rice, no veggies, nothing.  You get a Ceasars salad so you are eating two salads.  20 for a dry piece of salmon is excessive.  I wouldn't even give one star but had to.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My daughter wanted to go to Corino's for her birthday dinner out and we were bummed to find that they had closed the only one in town. She mentioned this as an alternative so we went for it. I was hesitant as the last time we went the service was so terrible, I actually used the crayons they furnish you to create a tip meter. My girls were like "Dad, that's not nice." LOL

I am afraid to say we were disappointed once again. I even got up to refill our water decanter that they furnish you during your meal. Once we finally did get our food it was pretty good, but you could tell it was franchise food if you know what I mean.

So, I guess if you don't mind waiting around for you food all night and enjoy helping yourself, this might not be a bad place for you... :)
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went there with my 2-year-old daughter for lunch. The waiter was very friendly and helpful. What a great customer service! And freshly baked bread and choose-your-own pasta were delicious!! We're vegan so it's so nice to be able to choose what we like in the pasta. I chose seasonal veggies with fresh mushrooms and sun-dried tomatoes. Yum!! I ordered grilled asparagus as a side. I'll try roasted brussels sprouts next time. Food also came out so fast! It was a wonderful experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My boyfriend and I went here last night for a last minute date night. We were immediately greeted when we walked in and got served right away. Our hosts were Christina and Jason and they were fantastic! The food was absolutely amazing. It was a lovely experience and I am glad we decided to go here. We give this place a full 5 stars!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The spaghetti and meatball dish has been changed since our last visit.  The quantity of meatballs was reduced from eight to three with a dollop of ricotta cheese on each meatball possibly to make up for the lack of protein. The meatballs were dry, crumbly and appeared to have been pre-made and thrown into the spaghetti as a decoration. They were not integrated into the dish. The small side salad had a bitter taste. Won't return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Never coming back. Walk in, no host, waiting for a few mins for anyone to even acknowledge us. It is not busy AT ALL. As we were about to leave someone finally came to seat us. Ok fine. Got bread quick but our server never came back. We were SO thirsty. A few other groups who sat AFTER us got their drink & food orders. We just walked out.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Terrible service, this place is just trash.
Probably 10 mistakes, mistake after mistake.
Took too long and made mistakes with the soup and salad. Like shit. Some Mother's Day dinner, no wonder why there is no one here. Probably at cheese cake.. 

Where is the manager when you need him?
Haha soup was delayed and salad looked like some McDonald salad. 

Some unlimited soup when there isn't any.. akward

Not happy.


Food is okay 


The best server was the African American lady and a lady with glasses. Knew service was lacking and tried to fix it
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Great place for a romantic date.

Was able to get some one-on-one time with my girl. The woman singing opera was amazing. I was really not expecting the dimmed lighting but was very impressed with everything. Outdoor seating would have also been great since they have heaters.

The bread was so good. I really enjoyed the Pasta Milano but saw some other great choices on the menu.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The worst food we have ever had.  Feel sorry for our server, not her fault the food was not edible.  Too bad because we used to live going there. Never again
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This place is good for people that are having a party they give you a cake for good deeds!! The food is overall REALLY DAMN GOOD the pizza cruft is really soft and cool! We really liked it here but it was my first time going here I thought it was like a really bad place but I was wrong! This is amazing the people are really nice and I hope the get some good luck for 2019-2020! You good customer Jorge I'm from the north east side ok bye! Ok
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Note: don't forget your Costco card, $100 value for $79.99.

My wife decided to bring me here for Father's Day. It was a good choice, I really enjoyed it. It is been over 10 years since I've been here. Couldn't really remember why we didn't return, 

The service was great, the manager sat us and was very friendly. For Father's Day, it was not that busy. However the server did tell us that it was really busy earlier, before we arrived, and they are shortstaffed. We saw none of this.

What we ordered:

Drinks
Top shelf margarita, on the rocks, no salt.
Peach sangria
Lemonade for kids

Dinner
Father's Day menu
Steak & potatoes, medium rare, 
Garden salad
Shrimp Portofino
Kids meatballs with spaghetti
Kids chicken with broccoli

Dessert
Decadent Chocolate cake

The garden salad is a $2.50 ad on, however if it is unlimited refills. It arrived and was very tasty, made with bib/butter leaf lettuce. It was missing tomatoes. I asked her for another salad as it is unlimited, but I asked her to add tomatoes. She came back and said it was a very busy day and there was no tomatoes. So she took it off the bill. The dinner also came with a small loaf of bread, that was tasty. It was topped with fresh butter and Parmesan. A little on the salty side.

The steak was cooked perfectly. It was also very tender. Probably one of the best steaks I've had in the restaurant the last few years. The potatoes were baby red potatoes, roasted with a Parmesan cheese. It was powdered cheese, kind a like the Parmesan shaker you get a pizza joint. They had a nice caramelization, tender, yet a little crunch. Can't ask for better. The broccoli that came with it, had a nice rich flavor, but was a little too al dente for me. I think that's just a matter of preference though. 

My wife's shrimp was also cooked perfectly, it came with angel hair pasta and mushrooms. The flavor was a little bland. I think it was a garlic butter, but just not enough flavor for me. But she didn't complain lol. She did like the pinenuts in it and the green leaf vegetable in it.

The kids dishes had good flavor. I think the chicken was about 2 ounces, as well as two small meatballs for the kids meals at six dollars. Lots of pasta in it and marinara sauce. I do feel the kids were a little bit short changed. Not very much protein at all, tons of pasta for six dollars. I was able to share my steak with them so they were happy. 

The decadent chocolate cake was perfect. It was included in the Father's Day menu, and very large. We were able to share it and still not finish it.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had a Mother's Day dinner of 8. We had reservations but there was no need since there was no one really in there.  2 of us got our food 10 minutes after everyone else. It took another 5 minutes for the last person to get there food.  The manager or the server never even apologized or offer any type of discount. Horrible customer service.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Absolutely not! Walk away from this overpriced, disgusting place! The poor service set the tone for a lack luster lunch service. There are reasons this restaurant was nearly empty. Issues:

-Server brought three dinner rolls for all ten people to share, then dripped balsamic vinegar from the broken container all over the table and menus.
-Kitchen was extremely slow  with over a half hour wait
-Server informed me my meal was not available, just a minute or two before bring the remainder of the meals to the table. One person finished their meal before mine arrived.
-Others noticed their plates of pasta were not hot, just lukewarm
-Spaghetti noodles mixed into a plate of fettuccini
-One of the mussels in my meal was so undercooked the shell had not even opened - SERIOUS HEALTH HAZZARD
-The restroom had a dirty diaper and a religious brochure in the stall; from the horrid smell, it's clear the diaper had been in the bathroom many, many hours. Possibly overnight

There are far too many disappointing facets of this restaurant to consider returning.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Christina is absolutely amazing. I go here all the time, but this was definitely my favorite visit. She is so sweet and on top of it.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Visited this place with my 2 nieces to catch up and buy them lunch since they drove all the way up from Fernley to visit and were excited to check this place out and were pleasantly surprised to not only see how empty it was but also how the decor seemed to be on the "fancier" side for a chain restaurant and we actually felt underdressed. Our waiters name was Alfredo, I believe it was. His demeanor was pretty strange whenever he would come up to the table he would interrupt the conversation, make a strange joke and then before leaving he would take my nieces empty specialty drink glasses and bring refills without asking so throughout the entire meal we assumed that the refills were free. They both ordered the Alfredo with chicken added and I was told they were pretty underwhelmed by the under salted Alfredo and the dry chicken; for $14-17 per plate Its safe to say I expect a proper Alfredo. I ordered their "signature" truffle Mac and cheese and I didn't find it to be good at all; too much truffle oil, not enough salt, pepper or cheese.  When i was given the bill i was unpleasantly surprised to see we were charged for SIX specialty kid drinks for each time our waiter so kindly refilled their glasses without asking or informing that refills were full price or else I would have verbally declined. For 1 appetizer, 3 entrees, 6 specialty kid drinks and a water for myself was just under $95 after tax not including a tip....Woulda spent less if we went to Texas Roadhouse and all got 2lb steaks. Keep your options open when suggesting this place to take your friends or family
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This used to be my favorite restaurant for Italian food. Unfortunately though, over the past few years, the price has gone up and the food quality and service has gone down. Way down. 

The last two times I've been there the waiters have been absolutely terrible. The first guy was on speed or something and made it obvious that he was annoyed when we asked for bread and other simple requests. During this same trip we waited there for over an hour for two simple salads. 

During our next visit, it was clear that the waiter was hung over. In fact I think he may have been still drunk from the night before. He even knocked over a couple of glasses at different tables. He would constantly repeat his introduction even though he had already been by to take our order. Finally after 30 minutes our salads and soup came. The soup was ok, but the salad was old and the croutons were so disgusting that my girl friend spit them out. They were beyond stale. Our eggplant Parmesan took over 1 hour and 45 minutes to make. We literally were getting up to walk out when it arrived. To make matters worse, the red sauce was so cold that parts of it were still frozen. The eggplant was disgusting as well, we needed a steak knife to cut it. Then the manager came by as she could tell we weren't happy. Her attitude from the very beginning was very defensive. We explained our frustration with the salad, wait time, staff, and entree. She immediately tried to justify the wait time by saying eggplant takes at least an hour to cook. She then claimed that the croutons were made about an hour ago - clearly a bunch of BS. She concluded with "I'm not supposed to tell you this but our eggplant is very earthy". Whatever that means. I've had eggplant at other fine restaurants and it never takes longer than 30 minutes to cook nor does it take much effort to cut. Bottom line is the manager needs to go and maybe Mac grill can be saved. Otherwise this business will not survive with her at the helm. She simply isn't manager material, has little to no people skills, and really is a disgrace to the reputation of Mac grill.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We used to come quite often. The kids menu has changed.  They don't give the kids ice cream anymore after their meal.They used to have the best honey mustard. They don't have that anymore either. The portions have gotten smaller.  The servers wear jeans now instead of black pants. Service is not as good.  Alfredo is a good server. Hopefully you get him. If not, good luck! Food is good. I recommend the Parmesan crusted sole.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Been here a few times now. Every single experience has been wonderful!

The food and service has been exceptional each time. This last visit we enjoyed live Italian style opera singing. It was very unexpected and fun, definitely not something you typically see at a restaurant chain. 

Every time we've come we couldn't leave less than a 20% tip, these waiters and waitresses are not just nice they are truly genuine. They aren't over the top, with a cheesy "hello and how may I help you's" only to scurry from the table as quickly as possible. They genuinely smile and make conversation, have impeccable timing and attentiveness even on a busy Friday night, and know how to make recommendations from the menu. Really wish we could note all their names individually to give them props. 

The food is fully flavorful, not just salty. The bread is warm a loaded with rosemary flavor, I always request balsamic with my dipping Olive oil. Each dish has a unique flavor profile not just your typical Italian style chain where the only options are salty cheesy or salty tomato. People have complained about portion size/cost ratio on other reviews but honestly, I have never left here anything less than STUFFED with left overs for lunch the next day. We typically spend $55-$60 on two specialty drinks, two appetizers, and two entrees (my choice usually being a seafood/lobster dish) at dinner, not shabby at all when you consider the customer service, atmosphere, quality, AND quantity at that price. 

If you suffered a bad experience here, I am strongly advising you give it a second/third shot and even mention your last experience to your waiter when you come in, I'm positive a place like this will make it up to you. This is probably my favorite restaurant of the moment. Totally worth the five star review I'm giving it.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Food took forever soup was cold. Manager was touching people's food bare handed. Food receipts on top of salad while waiting to be served. Waited forever for food that was cold
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This was by far the worst dinner we have had in a long time. The portion of Lasagna was not worth the price, just a small piece on a plate with nothing else with it...no salad, had to ask for a slice of bread. The bread tasted like old stale over seasoned shoe leather. The bread came with a small plate of seasoned oil...awful...not olive oil! It was rancid I'm sure of that! Also ordered a bowl to tomato soup. I had one spoonful as well as my husband. Both of us said no way! I told the waiter we can't eat this and sent it back. It looked and tasted like you opened a jar of Spaghetti sauce and poured it in a soup bowl. Just awful! My husband managed to eat the Lasagna. I drank my soda, which was all I had for dinner. I can't even tell you how filthy the restrooms were, especially since everything is to be sanitized these days. The floor under our table was sticky, hadn't been washed after a soda that had been spilled who knows when????  We would  never go back even if it was free.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I'm about giving establishments a second chance so that's what I did recently.  Overpriced mistake.  Rubbery eggplant parmigiana, garbage spaghetti and if you want a salad, oh that's extra.  Save your time and money and go elsewhere.  I just can't figure out how this place is still in business with the garbage they put out.  I hate to be negative but I've tasted better frozen "Italian" food than the pathetic plates this place puts out!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I ordered food through Uber eats and it was inedible. The salt content was soooo high, we literally could not eat the food. $60 later and there was no response from the restaurant. Poor customer service and crappy food. It used to be amazing. I guess they've joined the others in microwaving because this was not fresh at all. The Bolognese had no sauce and the big tortellinis were filled with salt like the topping. They've definitely gone downhill, and the fact that they wouldn't credit anything? Unacceptable. I was starving but would not touch it. So I paid for crappy food I couldn't eat but I will NEVER do that again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Fail. Went in for my girls birthday.  I've never been before.  Service was ok I guess lots of going back and forth for food. My place setting had old food stuck on it and when I got my salad it came with the wrong dressing I asked for balsamic I'm pretty sure it was rasberry or something definitely not balsamic.  I think our server  was amie. I got the osso buco. Was hesitant because it was 28 dollars.  It was cold. Not appetizing at all to eat cold mush potatoes and beef.  Portion was small and looked like cafeteria food kind of slopped on the plate. Held my tongue so my girl could enjoy her  piping hot steaming chicken parmesan. Went to use the restroom.  I'm serious it was like 50 degrees in there. Sitting on the toilet was cold and uncomfortable and the lock was broken. And the topper was as we were walking out one of the cooks was standing right in the open kitchen eating food of the line with his bare hands.  How disgusting. Just knowing he probably made my "food" made me feel sick. I cook for a living almost 16 years. I'm not a fan of bad Yelp reviews being in the industry my self but I will never go there again. This is the first bad Yelp I've written in a looooong time. I do get the fact it is macaroni grill but come on. Fail...
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My hubby took me out for my birthday and I couldn't be more impressed with everything. The portions of food for the price. The ambiance, the Italian singers in the background. I ordered the butternut pasta dish soooooo good! My husband order shrimp scampi and was very shocked to count 8 jumbo prawns in his dish. Normally he get 5-6 at other restaurants we have been to for that same order. When it was time for dessert, the waiter had been told it was my birthday so he came by with a plate of goodies and had me pick one. I chose the tiramisu. On point! A man sung me happy birthday in italian and my tiramisu had a candle in it. Overall experience was awesome, staff was extremely friendly!!!! Way better than my experiences in the past at olive garden. A++++ I am one happy customer.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This place has gone so downhill it is awful.
We went there for a birthday dinner last evening and the service was horrible  we waited for our order to be taken at least a half hour!  We never got our water refilled and were not asked if we wanted dessert but all we wanted was to get out of there!  The food was also horrible !
We remembered this as being a good place for quick Italian !  Never will we go there again! 
Should of known by all the empty tables !
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Love love love this place! Staff is super friendly and food is delicious every time we go here. So many favorites but everyone has to try the mushroom ravioli
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portion sizing.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I work at a restaurant and would never treat my costumers the way I was treated here.  There were multiple issues, but most notably my food was undercooked.  Rather then believing me, the waiter had another worker taste it... unacceptable.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: It shouldn't take an hour to get a check, especially when you have two waitresses assigned to your table.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had made arrangements for a birthday celebration at another restaurant (The Cheesecake Factory) but when we arrived at that restaurant this afternoon we were told that there was no record of the arrangement, which had been confirmed with the manager several days ago, and that we had to suffer through a two and one half hour wait.  Fed up with that restaurant, we contacted The Macaroni Grill.  On very short notice they agreed to immediately seat our group of more than a dozen persons.  In addition, we were seated in a private room for our birthday celebration.  The servers were very pleasant, our meals were served promptly, and the food was outstanding.  The birthday celebrant was even treated to the happy birthday song in Italian and a free dessert. The kind of treatment provided by The Macaroni Grill is how a restaurant gains and retains customers.  The Cheesecake Factory lost many customers this afternoon and forever.   The Macaroni Grill gained a loyal following.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Warning stay away from this establishment, average service mediocre food and unresponsive management. Attempted contact nervous times and NO reponse.!!! Enter at your own risk!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I filled out the form like you asked and no response or credit for my missing food. Great customer service!!! Everyone should see how low your restaurant scores and hopefully they don't make the mistake I did and order from you. I'm going to tell all my friends, family, and social media followers about my experience and how you handled it afterwards.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
"Because you had a bad day" will be the theme of this review. It all started on a Wednesday, I was craving my usual, chicken Parmesan sub fettuccine Alfredo, extra sauce, extra dressing. I know what I want and what makes the fat kid inside of me go "weeee!" 
I'd placed the order via grub hub, the driver was a delinquent to say the least and made my seemless delivery seem endless as the driver couldn't read a standard GPS, but that's neither here nor there. After a mere 1 hour 45 minutes my food landed, but there was an issue...the order was incorrect...AFTER the long wait, the numbers didn't add up, I was hangry and on one,...so I called macaroni grill, I was greeted by a sweet young voice who then transferred me to a sweeter baritone, the GM. Troy Crisco, who said he would make it right and personally drop it off..., in which he did, and WOW. Thank you Troy! For not only ensuring the satisfaction of your customer base but for also doubling the Alfredo and throwing in a chocolate cake, my inner fatty lept for joy. 
That's the type of service you that'll stop you dead in your tracks, and makes your heart melt. #worldclass
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: 40 plus min wait still no food wasn't even that busy... server was great but kitchen was super slow
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This is my second time at this location and it was really good.  I had Megan and she rocked.  So happy to see service to such a high level.  She was awesome and I will be back because of her.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We have enjoyed every meal we've had at Macaroni Grill. Our servers are always great! Our most recent waiter Travis was wonderful.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We went there yesterday at 1pm. There was 4 of us. Bailey was our server. The place was quiet. There was one large table that had been served. Our waters came fast. It took 30 minutes to place an appetizer order. Our salads came quick. The soup, I ordered tomato basil. It was bland. Our food took an hour to get. The pasta sat under the heat lamp so long it was dry and crispy. We asked for more sauce. Our waitress never came back. My sister got upset and found the manager. The final straw was when we decided we were going to just take our order to go and Bailey came over with our containers, dropped them on the table, with attitude and said, "Here you go." And walked off. She never refilled our waters or asked how we were. The manager, Troy apologized. He told us he gave her a big table before us and she was overwhelmed. She could've communicated that. He could've also stepped up and helped her, but he didn't, based on his odor, he was out back smoking cigarettes. He comped our meals and told us to smile. My mom looked like she was going to cry. I felt like I wanted to cry. We have always loved this place. We will never be back. If Bailey would've been apologetic it would have been better. But, she finished off our loyalty.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Server was nice however they have a chunky bald chef  that walks around to talk to each of the guest and the two to three times we have came here he has never once stopped at our table? First time it happened my husband suggested it might have something to do with race but I disagreed but now I'm in total agreement. It's not a coincidence that this has happened to us each time
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Was very disappointed in our dinner tonight.   Chopped salad way too spicy and not very good.   I wish the waitress had removed the charge from our bill after she asked why I didn't eat much.   Took a very long time to get our meal with no apology.   Will not be going back    Plenty of other choices in town.   We are sad this one has gone downhill so much as it used to be one of our go to places.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I almost let the bad reviews keep me away from this place, but I had a craving for mushroom ravioli and decided to try it anyway. Most of these bad reviews revolve around poor service, and I was feeling exceptionally patient yesterday so my husband and I gave it a go. 
When we arrived (Wednesday night 8:45 p.m.) it was very slow, I counted two other tables inside the restaurant when we entered but several people dining at the bar area. 
The guy who sat us (Zack) was also our server, so we were able to order drinks right away. This place makes a fantastic Shirley temple. I'm normally not a soda drinker and I finished my glass. 
Zach was courteous and competent. He brought us bread and even came back by with balsamic vinegar per our request. We ordered the mac and cheese bites appetizer with truffle sauce. So delicious (you can't go wrong with fried macaroni and cheese!) We also ordered mushroom ravioli. This has always been my favorite dish from Romanos, and it did not disappoint. In fact my husband mentioned he thought they added more mushrooms than usual and we love mushrooms. 
Our entrees came with Caesar salad. This is new or newer, in the past you always had to add a salad if you wanted salad with your entree. We were surprised when it came to the table since we had not ordered them, but Zack let us know they come with our entree. I'm not a huge fan of Caesar dressing but this salad was so delicious, the lettuce was crisp and cold, the dressing was creamy and it had the perfect amount of Parmesan cheese on top. We really enjoyed our meal here. Zack came by to check on us, offereing us dessert before bringing the check. We were so full after the bread, appetizer, salad and entree we had to decline on the dessert but based on how wonderful the rest of the meal was, next time I will save room! 

Don't let the bad reviews keep you from eating here! It is a chain restaurant but if you've eaten at Romanos before you know what to expect and they definitely meet the expectations at this location. 

I give this restaurant 4 stars because it is a little on the pricy side, dinner for two with tip cost us around $56 but it was delicious and our service was great!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I went in this restaurant with my family of five I was in back of a party of two that was sat down immediately and then the host turned me and my family away and said we don't have any room for you he was very unprofessional and rude it's no wonder I never eat at this place do yourself and favor and skip that place to eat go to Cheesecake Factory or Olive Garden  they treated me and my family disgusting very unacceptable

I have went to the link that u asked me to go to
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We haven't ate at this restaurant in a while and thought we would give it a try. It was a very disappointing pick up order for sure. We were giving a meal with an oil cup that leaked all over the place because the lid wasn't secured properly. The Mushroom ravioli was over cooked and difficult to cut, not standard for sure. My wife's soup came in a child's to go cup and not near the portion you would get at the restaurant. The Mac and cheese balls were over cooked and burnt on some areas. I'm so disappointed in what I wanted to be a nice Italian meal.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Don't waste your money here! Take it to Olive Garden where their food is actually worth the money! About 20 bucks for the most bland pasta I've ever had and absolutely like 3 pieces of chicken, also bland and My fries were cold and soggy. I was super excited to try this place and I should've just burned my money instead. $28 down the drain for the worst "Italian food" I've honestly ever had. Olive Garden is slightly cheaper and taste delicious.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The food was great and fast service. Jayme was my server, she was very funny and a attentive.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Amanda was fantastic! I'm from the restraint industry and can find flaws pretty quickly but this visit was great. Part of the atmosphere is an Italian song performed a capella by one the three hostesses. And I was told they come sing at your table if you ask.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We usually love this place. Sunday night, not so much. Not many people in to eat but plenty of staff. 
Several things on the menu were either not available or the wait person came much later to tell me they ran out of something. They put Italian dressing on my husband's salad along with a side of Ranch (which is what he asked for.) My daughter's order was wrong so they comp'd us on that. The food was not as good as we are used to. Keep trying guys, we'll see you in a few months.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This is only my second time here. The food service took an hour and 10 minutes. When my food did get here my girlfriend didn't get hers so by the time I ate my food it was cold. Service manager Teresa took care of everything and apologized for their service tonight. Andrew at the bar was great and took good care of us. Due to the customer service by Andrew and Teresa, we will be return customers.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Terrible service and food was bad.  They sat us in the lounge and table was far from booth seats. Ordered the prosciutto grilled cheese. The prosciutto was hard and crunchy and barely one bite of cheese
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The menu offers a variety of dishes, as well as the wine menu. Our dinners were delicious (I ordered the shrimp scampi.), very flavorful.  The entire meal from the appetizer to dessert was delizioso. Staff was friendly.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We ordered on uber eats and it was awful. They didn't send us our entire order, it was overpriced, and the food was terrible. 10/10 recommend finding somewhere else to eat.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Always a disappointment. Keep coming here because my dad used to like to eat here. But I've been coming in sporadically for the last year, trying something different each time and every time I'm more disappointed. This was the last straw. Ordered a steak cooked medium (in the hopes it might come med rare)  with veggies and potatoes. The steak is charged in one side, soggy on the under side and rare in the middle. Veggies are beyond over cooked and soggy. Potatoes were hit with a hot pan for color and undercooked. I have not eaten more than one bite of each. 20 min into dinner and I had to flag the waitress down for a refill on my iced tea. Does she ask why my dinner is in touched? Nope! My kid finishes her ravioli and I'm asked if I want a to-go box. No thank you. Then she notices. Service lacking and food to match. Manager comped the meal and offered to be our server and cook next time. Sorry, my time is Lee joys to me and I do t think I'm willing to give it another go. But I will spend it writing this review to save you all the disappointment.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I've always loved the Macaroni Grill and their food. My most recent experience there was extremely sub-par. I was grabbing food togo and the manager came up to me saying that because they were short staffed, "they were not really concerned with those things."  (Meaning to-go orders)
I understand Takeout orders might not be as important as guests dining in, but all customers should be treated the same if we are expected to return. 
Didn't enjoy my experience here and I felt I was a burden because I was picking up rather than dining in.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
***avoid this place 0 stars*****

Ate here today ordered pasta salad and an appetizer. Our waitress was amazing her name is Katie she is very attentive kind and helpful.

Ordered pasta to go with Italian sausage the cook forgot the sausage then we asked for it to be added and the cook added the sausage on cold almost a frozen cold we complained and the manager was extremely rude explained they're busy. Busy and slow is one thing throwing cold sausages on a warm to go dish is unforgivable.

Manager needs to go she can't manage and has a very bad attitude. People behind us were complaining because of slow service etc.


The vibe in the place from workers was no one wanted to work there we watched the cook grab her stuff and run out.

Avoid this place not worth it!

The manager comped our entire meal and still I don't feel that was even good enough it was such a disappointment in so many ways.

Katie is the best thing at that place and I hooe they appreciate her! 

Do not waste your tome or money going here unless they get better help and an new manger
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We were with a party of 11, five people got there food within 20 minutes the other people had to wait 30 additional minutes for the food to arrive and then 2 dinners had to go back as they were cold. After dinner was over we asked why there was such a delay, the waitress said sorry the tickets got mixed up and that happens sometimes, ok. We paid our bill including dessert for 6 of the people, when the manager asked how everything was we explained what happened her response was well you have already paid so I can't refund anything now, but I can give you dessert. Everyone that was eating dessert had already paid for their dessert. Horrible service horrible managers, would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Fine for what it is. A chain. Had very limited time, so chose this because we were already in the parking lot. Seated immediately. Kind and engaged waitress, Jennifer. Bread warm, a little overcooked, but rosemary flavor was nice.  Took longer than expected for a lunch order which was too bad. Thank goodness for the bread. Half order of butternut squash pasta with quite good if too rich. The calzone substitute was something I will not order again, not offensive though. My partner's soup and salad were definitely adequate. And bottomless.  No IPA. Overall a decent mass market American restaurant experience. Under $30
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: The Brussels sprout sautéed perfectly, with the surprised sweet and salty twist. The amount of the vinegar fulfilled the taste buds, will definitely recommends.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: What has happen to this place? I should have opened a jar of spaghetti sauce at home and bought Trader Joe's meatballs. It was awful. My lobster bisque soup tasted like it was cheese soup. Our waitress forgot our ice tea, forgot I wanted more olive oil for the bread, and never offered parm cheese for my husbands spaghetti. I was so disappointed in the food, I use to really like this place
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Calamari burned, Bibb salad contained rancid walnuts. Spaghetti not tasty. Terrible food. Won't return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This is one of our favorite places to go in Reno for lunch when we're there. Our last experience there was lacking though. Service was pretty slow and the waiter never asked whether we wanted the soup or salad with our meal so we go neither. If James is working make sure you sit in his section because our experience at this Macaroni Grill has always been awesome when he's waited on us.

I've never eaten anything here I didn't love. The food is fantastic.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: If you like bland tasting & looking food with terrible service this is the place for you. We had a group of 13 adults with a week or 2 reservation at 3 PM on a Sat. (we were basically the only people there) so it wasn't like they were swamped, & they only had one server there to do everything. John our waiter tried his best, but with no staff to help him at all, our meal was served in different shifts, so everyone was eating at different times. I had the lamb shank & was the 1st to be served & it was Luke warm at best, & instead of mashed potato's, I got potato soup. No salt\pepper on our table because at one time supposedly some kid threw & broke 8 salt shakers, so I guess everyone must be punished. We had to wait for desert because they said they had to wash our dishes for our desert (which by the way was very good) for the 1 star. This is all because of bad management. When I tried to talk to them, they seamed very uncaring, but they did give me a 25% discount coupon for 1 entree lunch, WOW how generous of them. Now I know why they only get a over rated 2.5 star rating. I will never go back there.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Not a great experience. The food is mediocre, the service is maybe a 3 star but on a  night with only 7 table of people in a large restaurant the service should have been great. When waiters come to the table ask a question and star walking away before you have time to get the answer out it may be an indication that they know the food is not great and have no answers. Bread set RVers in an Italian restaurant with olive oii l and no Balsamic vinegar unless you walk down waiter and ask for it is different. Overall it just felt like an Italian food experience at a mall or airport Food court. Macaroni Grill used to be so much better.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Great food. Awful service. 
I came in at 6ish December 18th and sat in the bar area with Jayme. The host and food runner were polite but the server never checked in on us besides when she got our drinks and gave us the check. She forgot an order and our bread and never came back for a refill. Good food however not worth going to with the inadequate service and price.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
What a great break from eating at home! I stopped here this afternoon in between (annoying & surprisingly crowded!) errands. I think there was only one server for the whole restaurant so the poor guy was running all afternoon, but I think everyone understands that most restaurants cannot afford to keep a full staff for a small customer base.  Food, as always, was wonderful! James was a great server. Thank you James.
If you are looking for yummy comfort food in a great location, I highly recommend Macaroni Grill!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Slowest service ever, two hour to get diner half a hour to get water with only half the restaurant full. Manager was not helpful food was below average and orders were forgotten.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: After getting a less than desirable meal last week I was sent a message from a Google review.......when I went to macaroni grill website and submitted a survey ........I have not heard a thing and will not EVER give them any of my business again!!  Can't respond to a complaint and I won't frequent this establishment???
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Staff was nice, but the food was overpriced for what you get, the serving sizes were great but the presentation was pretty bad and all the food was soggy covered in what tasted like stewed tomatoes in can. Couldn't cut through my Eggplant Parmesan and the bottom was soaked in juice... appetizers were yummy though. I just feel like for the price it was a let down. Very nice and classy atmosphere though. They just need to step up the food a little bit. Even Olive Garden tastes way better.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Took over 45 minutes to bring our food out. My boyfriend's pasta looked like it was under the heat lamp for a while it wasn't even that hot when it arrived. Asked for the steak to be well done and still had pink in the middle after a bite. They could have just brought my boyfriend's food when it was done and notified us that the steak was going to take a little longer. When we got our food my boyfriend and I had lost appetite from waiting so long. Plus not to mention there was no more than 6 tables being used with three serves and 2-3 cooks.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Today I finally get to experience Romano's Macaroni Grill! And it was yummy-good! Our server was super sweet and nice; she made us feel very welcomed (Sam).
Usually when I feel like having pasta, Olive Garden was quickly my go-to, but this place is pretty different so I'll definitely come try this place again!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We just had lunch for 3 and it came to $78! My kid had lobster bisque and french fries. I had the mom's ricotta meatballs with spaghetti bolognese and a salad. And my husband had pasta milano with broccolini. And we ordered bruschetta for the whole family. My spaghetti was oily and had basically no meat sauce and the meatballs just tasted like oregano and nothing else. It was disgusting and inedible. My husband's pasta was flavorless. You could not taste garlic, cream, mushrooms or tomatoes. Again all you could taste was oregano! The pasta was very al dente and overall it was just Bland and disappointing. The broccolini were raw and had no seasoning on them whatsoever not even salt or butter or anyting! The only thing I actually liked was the bruschetta which I added a balsamic glaze to. The fries were fine nothing special, the lobster bisque was okay. Save your money there's way better food elsewhere! I've never had spaghetti that was inedible before.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Best dinner we had since we have been intown this week . From The rosemary bread and olive oil, to the best chicken parmigiana I have had in a really long time and we ended with chocolate chip cannolis. Kudos to Travis our food server that tied it all together and made it a great evening!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I normally wouldn't review a chain, but after returning to this concept after years it's wild to me that there's enough of a following to keep this place going. We came in on Memorial Day to a dead restaurant, which was surprising. 

Our service was exceptional, but the food was forgettable and overpriced. I ordered the spaghetti and house-made meatballs and the better half got some rigatoni dish with a cream sauce and chicken. The fresh bread that used to be good absolutely sucked, and the calamari was whatever. Had it not been for the gift card I'd have had no reason to come in, and I certainly have no reason to come back. Butternut squash ravioli for $21?! That's hilarious.

For the prices they're charging, you can get far better quality food from local establishments.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This was the worst dinner I've ever gotten from a restaurant. It was like all they did was pour tomato juice over some vegetables and spaghetti. Never going back here.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Meh experience and food. Something has changed about Romano's in the past couple of years and the food made me regret the visit.  

The spicy meatball appetizer arrived about 5 minutes after ordering and was in a bowl with some bland meatballs hiding under crushed tomatoes.  It was not spicy by any standard.  The entrees arrived 5 minutes after the appetizer.  The penne rustica was ok but the prosciutto was without flavor besides a little saltiness, a gray color like anchovies, and dry and chewy like beef jerky.  My wife gave her mama's trio a 5 of 10 with the chicken the best of the 3 choices.

The waitress visited 4 times: at the beginning to take the appetizer order, to take the entree and drink order, to ask about boxes at the end, and to leave the card receipt.

When the itemized bill left the table, it didn't come back.

No bread ever came.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Miss these restaurants on the east coast! Had a great meal and enjoyed the food again! Thanks!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My 1st time coming here. Not great. Don't think I'll be back. Slow service, food was just ok.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: To the manager or owner whoever reads this I love your restaurant it's absolutely fabulous but when there are customers in the restaurant trying to eat do not paint inside it was so nauseating I threw up my food and had to leave please be considerate towards customers and don't do this again thank you so much
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Avoid this place......no customer service. Will not respond toy concerns. If they cared they would be responding to my correspondence. Food was mediocre at best and service was average at visit. But the the lack of response to my feedback is disconcerting!!!?
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We've had good meals here in the past. Tonight doing curbside was a disaster, which is a shame because so many other restaurants have gone out of their way to do a good job and be thankful to those who are keeping them open. Tonight, our calamari appetizer for which we were definitely charged was not included. When called about it the response was "oh we don't have any calamari". Ok, but why is it still on your menu? Why did you charge me for it? Why was there no explanation that it was not included? And why did I have to call back and ask what happened? Then my wife's vegetables were not included and she was given a caesar salad instead, which she can't eat because she is lactose intolerant. And then my build your own pasta did not have the bolognese sauce it was supposed to have nor any sauce for that matter. The explanation when I called back was that I could drive back 15 minutes to the restaurant to get sauce if I wanted. No thanks! I won't be back! You lost a good customer that you've had for 15 years. Poor product, poor service, poor handling of a disastrous experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I've ordered takeout twice from here in the past few months. The first time I called, I placed my order with a woman. After I read my order, she asked if there'd be anything else, I said it would be all, then she hung up on me. Hmm.. weird, I thought. So I go in to pick up my order, which (my fault) I didn't double check, and come home to find multiple items missing. I call back to make sure I wasn't charged, since I didn't receive an itemized receipt, and the same lady answers. "Okay well I didn't hear you," she says after I explained the situation, and hangs up on me...AGAIN. Thankfully I wasn't charged. So, I figure, she had a bad night, whatever. 

So then last night, I decide to order takeout again. I recognize the woman's voice immediately, so I go ahead and place my order, once again she gives me the total, I say okay, she hangs up on me without reading back the order or telling me how long it'll be. So I call back asking how long it'll be, "I don't know, 20 minutes?" HANGS UP. At this point I'm wondering if I even go pick up the food, but I think to myself whatever, the Mac is good. So I go down to pick up my food, and a woman brings it out to me. Low and behold, it's the same woman that on the phone, AND she's the manager! I felt less crazy after reading the other reviews, it seems her attitude and knack for being unprofessional is a normal thing. Good pasta, doesn't make up for the bad service.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We booked our company Christmas party here last Saturday, December 8th. Huge mistake. Our party was for 20 people. They had our table set up in a separate room with another group which was fine, plenty of room. The first mistake they made was allowing us to order direct from the menu. In our past experience at other restaurants, we have been given a limited menu which allows the kitchen a better opportunity to get everyone's food out in a timely manner. When we arrived our table was set up but had no menus on the table and no waters. Our waiter came over to take drink orders and everything seemed like it might start to be normal. He left with our drink orders and drinks slowly made their way to our table, still no waters or menus. Everyone immediately ordered a second drink because the first drink took so long. Finally, menus arrived...still no water and no one asked if we wanted water. I noticed that our waiter was basically by himself to handle our entire table. Again, at other restaurants, we are used to having 2 or 3 servers handle our large group. We ordered appetizers, again they slowly made their way to the table. We ordered our main courses. Entrees started to make their way to the table and it quickly became apparent that only half the table received their main course. The waiter came over and stated he messed up and lost half our orders, he took the orders a second time for those of us that did not receive any food. Again, these orders slowly made their way to the table and they were still missing 5 people. We sat down at 6pm it is now 8pm, two hours in a 5 people didn't have their food. The waiter and manager came over this time to ask once again what we were missing. 3 of the 5 ordered again, myself and one other guest decided not to re-order. I have worked in the food & beverage industry and have had many group gatherings at restaurants over the years and I have to say that Macaroni Grill was the least prepared to handle a group I have ever seen. When companies like ours plan these parties it is usually once a year and it is an important event to show our appreciation to our employees, to have it go so painfully wrong is not only upsetting but unacceptable for a restaurant like Macaroni Grill. One server assigned to our table, no menus on the table, no waters on the table, our guests having to go to the bar to get their own water and drinks, missing food orders, 2 hours into the party and guests still without food. This says to me very clearly that Macaroni Grill is improperly managed and they do not have a clue as to how to handle a group party. The manager ultimately took 25% off the bill and the waiter removed a couple of wines and coffee, none of which made the evening any less intolerable. As poorly as our group was handled they should be embarrassed that they charged us at all.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had not been out to a restaurant in some time, and decided to try Macaroni Grill. we were nervous, but our server, John, was the best. He told us what they were doing for our safety and was patient with us. I so appreciate that he was this attentive to us and made our first experience out a very enjoyable one. John is a true asset, an on-point, professional waiter. Bravo.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Tyla and Teresa were so awesome tonight, so nice and the food was super yummy! Will be returning!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My daughter and son stopped by for dinner and loved their waitress and dessert! They say that Tina, their waitress tried to fix the problems and very nice! My daughter's soup wasn't even hot and my son's pizza wasn't cooked or made correctly!  I guess they will go to Olive garden! They might go back for Tina!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My husband and I had to provide a family dinner for 18 people yesterday.  We are between houses and staying in an AirB&B, so we decided to have the meal catered.  This was an amazing and wonderful experience!  I ordered the catering online (https://macaronigrillcatering.olo.com/) but then was able to call and speak to the manager a few hours later to confirm everything.  The food was ready when we arrived to pick it up, all packed in a sturdy box for transport.  The salads were cold as they should be, and the entrees were hot!  The food was delicious and got rave reviews from everyone.  The staff at this Macaroni Grill are exceptional.  Thank you!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We went to Macaroni Grill in Seattle and we had an unpleasant experience. We figured we would give the one in Reno a shot and it was just as awful. Seems like it's Macaroni lost their customer service values. When I called to make the reservation the man who answered the phone was unenthusiastic you could tell he did not want to be there and did not want to help. When we got to the restaurant we were seated. Our server got to our table and nothing special she asked what we wanted to drink and if we were ready to order. We asked for some bread and she said that it wasn't ready. She then came back 10 minutes left and said someone beat her to the bread so she had to wait for more. We finally got out bread about 5 minutes after that. We ordered Fettuccine Alfredo with Shrimp and Buffalo Chicken Parmesan. It took quite some time to get our food. It wasn't busy or anything either. The food was okay. Definitely not a $20 plate, you can get similar options at Olive Garden that taste better and cost less. When we were done we gave the server our form of payment and she took and came back with it 10 minutes later. Which is a long time when someone has something as sensitive as a card. She came and said sorry for the wait and said that she forgot our boxes  because she ran into a friend who was giving her a hard time. We received our boxes and left. Honestly, I wouldn't go back. Menu isn't the same, taste is okay, and most importantly the service is terrible there.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had eaten here years ago when it first opened and in a moment of weakness thought it would be a safe quick choice . It was a Tuesday night and maybe a 1/4 full if that . We waited a few minutes to be seated , that was ok . The hostess seated us , presented the menus mentioned some specials , all fine and normal . After a awhile a waiter showed up , not sure if it was his first night or he just sucked as a waiter . He fumbled through trying to sell us wine then needed to collect the glasses on the table and take them away all before taking our drink order . Later he came back took our drink and food order . After awhile he brought the drinks , super watery weak ice tea , said he'd be back with the bread . Later he brought the bread . Much later the bread was gone the weak tea was gone , no sign of the waiter or the food . I was fumbling in my wallet to leave some cash for the tea so we could go find some food somewhere else when the food came . The food was hot but unremarkable . Eventually, the waiter came by again , we had stacked all our dishes on the table and were ready to see if the hostess could get our check . He took the dishes and asked if we wanted dessert - we aren't young and don't want to waste the time we have left waiting,  we said no and asked for the check . He left and didn't bring the check but started serving the booth behind us . I heard a raised voice and turned to see an attractive young woman reading him the riot act "......to go box , unacceptable service , manager " . We started walking to the front to see if the hostess could help , he quickly brought our check . We stood while he ran our card . Another waiter asked if everything was ok , my husband said no the service sucked . That waiter wanted to get us a manager but we just wanted it to be over . We won't be back and I have such buyers remorse , wish we had just gone to Del Taco across the street.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I have been here before and it was good. Great experience.


Last night my family & I went out to eat, 
First we got served bread that tasted/ felt like it had been sitting out for 3 days.. next we ordered the spinach artichoke dip that was served cold..
We had the mushroom arancini crispy on the outside frozen in the middle...
I had ordered for my main meal mashed potatoes asparagus and broccolini, the only thing not cold was the asparagus... I'm extremely disappointed with this experience.  
The cheesecake even had a weird taste to it, somewhat of a  metal flavor... 
never going to this place again...
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Survey and review has been filled out at your website.  We will see what happens from here. Hopefully it gets better there.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This place has become mediocre at best. I cannot comment on the restaurant as we did delivery but the food did arrive hot. The chicken Alfredo had almost no sauce and the chicken was so dry we couldn't even eat half of it. The grilled pork chop had good flavor but the sauce was flavorless and the risotto was dry and over cooked. This used to be a great place on a Saturday night but now it just feels and taste like Italian "fast food." Sad really.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I am giving this restaurant an excellent rating: because of our exceptional  meal service.  Solely: in our opinion because of our waiter:  Colyn, who
was attentive, in his close attention to details.  Gave us information about the menu, that in all these years, was our best dinner at RM Grill.  He made it very clear.  Our food was excellent!  He was so impressive and is one of they're main assets. Very sharp.....   {We did miss the fire roaring in the fireplace and the pizza oven burning away, which truly adds to the atmosphere of the whole dynamic.}  However, truly understand the possible financial overhead dilemma for restaurants going through all in the past couple of years.   We were looking for the G. Manager Torre'. Anyone know what happened to him?
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My favorite Italian restaurant so far. Big portions, delicious(for my taste) food. Even My picky son enjoyed it. Very friendly ambient. Service was spot on.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Greats to go food. Even made sure the packaging was secure with special labels and individual utensil and napkin packs. Thanks for keeping me safe! Just a hint, chicken Alfredo but with the Parmesan chicken instead of the roasted chicken... DELICIOUS!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Terrible service. Ordered artichokes and calamari which was very hard a bunched together a fried. Our Server waited on us and served others that came later, theirs first! First time and the last
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I got take out here the other day and was helped by Jaclynn who was really busy and still managed to help me in good time. The food was great and I appreciated Jaclynn's hospitality. Will be back for sure
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
A chain Italian... yes 4 stars. I pretty much only get the Shrimp Portofino here, and its like $16 with tax. I like it, I crave it, I normally get it to-go. But the set up of ordering can be a PITA. They give you a time for when it is ready, you don't have a choice. I called at lunch one day, it was going to be over an hour before it was ready, umm no thanks. 

I will take this over Olive Garden any day though. 

Pro Tip: you can watch your order being made if you order it to-go at the restaurant, which is kind of fun.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: A friend and myself decided to have an early dinner here about a week ago. The place was fairly empty on a Monday afternoon so we thought perfect, quick and easy service but no. Service was slow and the meal itself just wasn't good. Personally I ordered a create your own pasta with Alfredo sauce chicken and sausage while my friend had something very similar with chicken as well. Later on that same night we both had excruciating stomach pain which lasted another day. We called and told them this and they said sorry and that they'd do something special the next time we came in. Why would we return to a place that gave us possible food poisoning and all they could say is sorry?
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My girlfriend and I used to love going to this Macaroni Grill. We hadn't been there in a year and it has definitely gone downhill. Last Sunday I decided to order the dish pictured (the mushroom ravioli) via Doordash. Ordering went fin, but when it arrived, it seemed a little light for a dish that might resemble the dish featured on their menu, especially one costing $21. I opened it up and I saw this monstrosity. Only a few pieces of ravioli, burnt to the point of being inedible with a dash of (also burnt) mushroom gravy. I immediately called up the restaurant and demanded an explanation. I was told that the General Manager cooked this particular dish and that I would be getting a refund in a week. 
Well, it's been a week. I called and was told it might be another couple of weeks before I get my refund because the folks in the corporate office are only occasionally in the main office anymore. I did get an offer for them to remake my order. No thanks. Fool me once . . . 
I will never be eating here again and I don't recommend anyone else do until they either hire new management or, at least, banish the GM from the kitchen. They clearly don't know how to cook or about appropriate portions

Update: even though they told me to contact them on their website, I did and have yet to get any sort of response whatsoever. I even called the restaurant again. No call back. Two weeks from the original incident. Still no refund.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
4.5 stars for this chain Italian restaurant. Sign up to be on their email list and they have many generous take-out and dine-in offers.

Large, clean restaurant making Covid standards easy to adhere to. The servers, though, need to walk far for their drinks and plate pick ups.

Large square rosemary bread given with EVOO. 

Got the chicken parmesan and it was thick and huge. Mild on the sauce, good on the melty cheese! All the tables took home leftovers!

This location does a lot of curb-side and to-go orders.

Super friendly and generous service.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We liked this place because it is comfortable, decent service, consistent dishes and great ice tea. We also like the salads because they have lots of goodies in them. Except today, both our chicken salads arrived with no chicken, the chicken was brought out later  for us to mix in. The other ingredients were in such scant portions that we couldn't taste them and had to hunt to even see traces of them. Very boring salads, very disappointing. We complained to the  waitress who was apologetic and  went into great detail about training a new person in the kitchen. Not the customer's problem.
