Did not offer to take anything off the bill either. We left feeling cheated.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Food was good but there were greasy  finger prints on everything,  including my plate and my martini glasses.  Nice waitress,  but it's disgusting to have greasy finger prints on the glass I drink from and on my plate of food. 
Don't think we will be back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Not the Romano's Macaroni Grill that we used to come to?  It has changed over or the chef left.  We got seated and waited....Finally, another waiter noticed us and came over and asked if we had been helped?  Of course we hadn't!!  A waiter came over and asked if we were ready to order we said yes since we had been waiting quite some time!  We ordered an appetizer and our meals and drinks all at once.  No bread came, waiting for our appetizer, I finally asked our waiter if our appetizer was coming out?  He left and came back and said it would come out with our meal, if that was ok????  NO, it's called an appetizer.  Food comes out, meatballs are missing from the create your own pasta, we pointed it out, asked again for bread.  He brought the check and we weren't even done with our meals, he was quick for that!  I told him, please get our meatballs, reluctantly he brought back 4 meatballs in a side dish???  The food was not as I remembered and not as tasty.  The service was awful!  Unless you feel like asking for everything twice, don't bother going here.  I don't know what the problem was with this place???  Won't be going back for awhile.  Oh, the manager said I'll take care of the appetizer for you, no he didn't, the full price was on our bill.  For the money we paid it wasn't worth it.  REALLY DISAPPOINTED at the whole thing.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Good chain food and giant portions.  Thats what makes it great for a birthday party and a large group.

Its pretty much like all the other Macaroni Grills I've been to across the country, but this one is in Reno.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Sup Everybody..,Soooo Yeah...Today's Experience at macaroni grill was...Meh! First we waited 15 mins to be seated when there was 3 tables open and no one else was waiting ok no biggie it happens..we get seated our waitress comes takes our drink order brings us bread so far all good right..she comes backs to takes our order all good once again everything is good....THEN....15 mins past..all we get is our refills..then our waitress comes back and asked me what I ordered? ...she said I just wanted to make sure..so I said Chicken paramsan..so at this point am think A she forgot what I ordered B she didn't take down my order considering she took my order first..what ever I let that go as well it happens they were busy..now 25 mins have gone no food yet...the table behind us party of 6 got sat after us a good 10 mins after us..got their food before us..now am starting to get irritated not cool..so a good 35-40 mins later we get our food and it's luke warm..at this point am done I don't even want to eat nor did my niece and sister in law..I took a few bites and I was done same with my niece and sister in law..now we are home and having Actual dinner...That's all folks
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We stopped in for dinner at around 5:40 pm on a Thursday night. We were relieved to see that most of the tables were empty so we assumed there'd be no wait.
NOPE!
The un-enthusiastic host stated the wait would be forty-five (!!) minutes because they were expecting two large parties.
I said, "oh. So they have reservations?"
Him: "no."
Okay so we went into the "bar" to regroup, and apparently said bar is not open despite two employees behind the bar doing SOMETHING all while desperately if not frenetically trying to avoid making eye contact with us.
What a miserable experience at a restaurant I USED TO enjoy a lot.
We took our business to an adorable little Italian spot called Pasta Fresca (6135 Lakeside Drive) where we were treated like valued guests, not annoying inconveniences. And the food is INCREDIBLE! (Review to follow!)
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I took my 14 year old daughter there the other day, Bailey was our server and she was awesome !!!! The child is picky and Bailey was super patient even though they were busy allowing her to ask questions and get answers. We definitely will be back!!!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: It has been a year since i went back to this place because of poor service. Tonight was beyond words. Our waitress Christina (tina) was one of the best i have had in a long time. From the minute she came over to our table she had us laughing, talking and just having a great time. She took her time with us snd treated us as though we had been friends for a long time. So refreshing, I will come back again and ask for her. Keep up the great service. You deserve a raise.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Last night me and my wife ate there and the food was very bland, no taste. Wife ate the mama trio and I had the chicken parmesan . Sorry that's the second time we been there over a 10 year period. The only good thing about our experience was we had 2 mai tai's and they were great. Our waiters were great also. For $80.00 we can get way better food.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I have always liked Macaroni Grill. I know COVID has taken a toll on the staffing, but the excuse is getting old. It took 10 minutes to get a hostess to take our name.  She told us it would be 10 minutes. Well, after 30 minutes we were seated. Our server was pleasant and quick to take our order. She was attentive.  She was good, especially since it was only her 2nd day working here. As you can see from the picture, the edge of the table was damaged. I wouldn't have mentioned it, but I  kept catching my sleeve on the jagged edge.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Very disappointed last night. We ordered the mama's trio. The chicken parmigiana was Burt through and through. It was a charcoal brick with some sauce on it.  They weren't that busy to not check before it went out of the kitchen
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My family and I had Macaroni Grill yesterday for lunch. I highly recommend the chicken parmigiana. I substituted angel hair pasta with Alfredo instead of the spaghetti that normally comes with it, and it was fantastic. The calamari appetizer was cooked perfectly. The customer service was excellent, even though we got our food for carry out, there was no shortage of bread and dipping sauce. The manager on duty personally delivered the food to us and she herself made sure that we got everything we ordered before we left. I recommend macaroni grill on south Virginia to everyone. 7 out of 5 stars. We will be back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Nothing serious, just a super rude attitude infested wrist-tattooed manager with no regard for customers.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I ordered Christmas dinner to be delivered at 4:00.  Order was over 30 minutes late and half the order was missing. Called the restaurant only to have a very rude lady tell me she could remake what was missing but I would have to pick it up. Nice customer service. I understand she is away from her family, but I have to leave mine during Christmas dinner to pickup what they forgot. Never again will I order from them. ZERO stars!!!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We've been a month away but the crew remembered us (haha we are hard to forget). I asked our waitress why the crowds were small with pandemic lifted. The food is great, prices in line, staff is exceptional (that crack got me a free bowl of soup!!!). She didn't know. She was thinking the same thing. Within minutes 20 people walked in the place. 

It's obviously not a secret. We all know it's huddled in with barnes and noble but I never see them jammed to capacity. Thank you. I hate to wait and this has been our best experience in Italian since coming to north Nevada!
06/01
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Reno location-- poor ...It's not the food, it's the service and management.  Last time I went there on July 10, 2021, I walked in at 3:30pm -there was no hostess, just one female waiter. The place had two customers. The rest of the place empty like 50 open tables--yet she informed me it would be a 45 minute wait!! What? She said "we are understaffed and one of the chefs just quit!"   Ok I said then put a closed sign on the door and reopen when you get your S... together!  For a well known chain, this is just horrible management!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My complaint drew a wonderful, gracious response from the general manager.  A good apology and a willingness to correct the problem means a lot. Everyone has a bad night. Thanks for being attentive to this customer.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Having never been here before, my family decided to check this place out. We walked in at 7:15pm on a Thursday night and there were maybe 5 full tables in the whole place. After ordering we didn't get our food until 8:30. 
And between that the guy dropped off salads, and went away again. No words, no drink refills, nothing. 
After an hour and fifteen minutes of waiting for our food we finally got it. It was decent, but definitely not worth the wait. We then waited for him to come back and take our dessert order, which took another 30 minutes for "eh" dessert. But since it was my step grandma's b-day. her dessert was free, which was nice. 
During this 2 hour meal we were sitting on the worlds most uncomfortable chairs. Everyone's body ached after sitting in them for so long. 
Long story short, the wait is long. It's nice to linger when you're having dinner with family, but AFTER I eat! I was so hungry, and the wait was just terrible. There's no reason it should have taken so long on a quiet night. I'd hate to see it on the weekend!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: While in town on Thanksgiving, we had underestimated the wait times at the casino buffets.  Around 6 PM on Thanksgiving Day driving down S. Virginia, we saw Macaroni Grill was open for business.  No wait and the restaurant was about 50% full.  Scored a table and ordered fried calamari, pizza, chicken marsala and several pastas.  Food was great but we did not receive the calamari appetizer.  Our waiter heard us mention this to another server and he jumped into action!  He found out another table was delivered the appetizer and they ate it!  By then, we were not as interested in the appetizer.  Our waiter took the appetizer off of our bill and then scored us two free desserts.  It was a cool gesture and really ended our dinner on an up note.   I had some hesitation in the past about going to a chain restaurant, but this really turned me around.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Me and my girlfriend came here for a romantic dinner and it was an okay experience.

Firstly, the server forgot to bring the soups out. I only got to ask where the soups were after she had placed the entrees down. She had mentioned to us that she was serving many tables. Maybe our server was in a bad mood or she was being overworked. However, my seating area was near the kitchen and I watched as servers either stood around or complained to each other. I got the vibe that no one working there wanted to be there or be bothered to give a good eating experience. 

Another example of the service was when I had asked the server if she could put my gift card code into the check. She said she would ask. After desert, when the check was given, she completely forgot to ask about the gift card. The matter was resolved but it does make me question if anyone working is paying attention. 

For the food, it was pretty tasty. The bread was good and I appreciated the olive oil and balsamic vinegar mix. For an appetizer, we ordered the caprese salad which was the nice ratio of tomato to mozzarella. For my entrée I ordered the Cafe Milano which was also yummy. The ingredients such as the mushrooms tasted fresh and the chicken was well seasoned. The tiramisu was really good  and I'd come back here only to eat that. 

I want to mention that you are paying for the ambience of the establishment. The food is marked up by a lot which I would not mind if it weren't for the sub par service and atmosphere as mentioned earlier. I do not recommend this place unless you are really craving an expensive tiramisu. If so, get it to-go.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: First off let me say , thank you for being open ! The night was perfect from the warm bread to our great service. Alex our server greeted us the minute we walked in and made us feel welcome the whole time. This 5 star review is for the service , don't  get me wrong the food is very good but Alex went above and beyond . Thank you and we will be back .
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Wonderful atmosphere, social distancing in use. Great food. Had the cheese stuffed raviolis with butternut squash topping. Friends loved there cheesecake deserts. Our waitress Tina was fabulous!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I'm a fan of Macaroni Grill.  I frequented it more in my pre-Yelp days, mainly because I once had a credit card that would give me points and I would trade all of my points in on restaurant gift cards.  Conveniently located on South McCarran and South Virginia, there is plenty of parking.

My "go to" dish is Shrimp Portofino: sautéed jumbo shrimp, capellini, spinach, mushrooms, garlic, pine nuts, lemon butter  It is actually quite good and the bread that they serve is really good.  The service here is great - people are very friendly and they will keep loaves and loaves of bread coming if you ask.

I usually eat during the "off hours".  I eat dinner pretty early if it's going to be a large meal, so I have encountered the restaurant when there were a few patrons, but not when it was overly crowded.

Tip:  Regarding the Steak & Greens salad: 5 oz. sliced sirloin, baby kale, spinach, radicchio, arugula, crispy prosciutto, gorgonzola, crispy onions, balsamic herb dressing.  The balsamic herb dressing can be overbearing, I usually order it on the side.

Good chain type restaurant that modernizes and brings up the economy in Reno!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I wish I would've read the overall rating before deciding to get take out. 
Just to get to the point. I ordered curbside and my calamari was cold, rubbery and most prices were BRICK hard. So I threw it away. I also order shrimp Alfredo.. and they didn't give me any utensils. 
I also REALLY like how a tip is included in the total price, unless you opt out. A TIP FOR WHAT? COVID has mad customer service even worse. What am I tipping for?! I paid $34 dollars for an entree and appetizer and it was BS! You also aren't serving me. I will not go back!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Went for a late lunch. Husband ordered a salad. He didn't like the dressing that came with it but the portion was huge. I ordered the lobster bisque. The portion for this was small but tasted good. Their bread today was so good. We had 2. Their appetizers of Brussels sprouts is my favorite. Our waitress Katie was amazing!! Drinks never went empty and she checked on us often. One of the best service we've had.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I have had several experiences with this spot and none of them were this horrible but I don't think I will ever return. I had dinner there with friends and family to celebrate a birthday. We had a reservation at 7 for ten people and we were not sat until 7:30. They didn't seem super busy but I have worked in the industry before and I know that sometimes parties take longer than usual and things come up. Not a huge problem. HOWEVER, when we were seated we got our menus ordered a bottle of wine (that came out very promptly, thank goodness) and two appetizers: bruschetta and artichoke dip. We didn't get our appetizers until 8:19pm. After waiting forty minutes for our appetizers we were finally able to order our entrees which also took forever. I don't remember when we ended up leaving but it was way too late and after 9:15pm and several of us were not satisfied with our meals and didn't even eat them but at that point we just wanted to get out of the restaurant and never return. 
Throughout our meal there was a lot of apologizing and blaming the kitchen and the chefs but with all of that blame I was surprised that a manager didn't come check to see if everyone was okay. That wouldn't have helped the experience because I won't go back but usually if there is that much wrong with the kitchen someone will come out and apologize or comp an appetizer or SOMETHING. 

Anyway, long story short, the whole thing was really weird and way too long. The food is way too expensive and mediocre to justify the price and wait when you can just get some pasta roni for $1 at the grocery store.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
My first time visiting the location but Not my first time at Macaroni Grill, I think Macaroni Grill use to be great but I understand now why so many of there locations have closed now. 

Wine...
I had a glass of the house red and it was not very good, there are many inexpensive wines that taste decent but this was definitely not it. I ordered the Italian Chianti for my second glass.  

Food...
Ordered the Pollo Caprice and was disappointed. First it was salty, the mozzarella was salty, the arugula salad (was very very small portion, about 1/4) was salty & the grilled chicken breast was not only salty but rubbery, it was obviously cooked from frozen and had fake grill marks. Definitely not worth $17, go through any drive through for a better piece of chicken for 25% the price!

Service...
Was quick and friendly, I only have positive comments for the service. 

My wife and I use to love Macaroni Grill and I wondered why I've seen so many locations shutting down, I was in Reno and saw this location was open and decided to stop in for a nice meal but was disappointed and feel like I was ripped-off in the process, so now I understand why there're going out of business, and why I'll no longer be a patron. 
I recommend going to Carrabba's Italian Grill instead!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This was my first time coming, the food was well prepared and nice and fresh. I was surprised at how good this restaurant is.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I was given a Gift Certificate to Romano's Macaroni Grill and decided to do take out. The whole experience was sort of a let down.... While the online ordering process was easy enough, when I arrived there was no marking or indication of where I needed to go to do my pickup and the whole process of waiting and paying for my pickup took over 10 minutes (I showed up a few minutes after their website said my order would of been ready). 

The food was also disappointing. I had ordered a pasta with creamy Alfredo Sauce and there was NO sauce on my dish at all - just oily noodles; which was a shame because the noddles and veggies were cooked well and I was thrilled with their create your own pasta idea! Moreover, the Caesar Salad was suppose to come with crotons and there was no crotons - a small thing, but the salad I got was a pile of lettuce with a weird tasting - super thick cream sauce, it was rather off-putting.  

I think that they need to work on their customer service and perfecting fine details e.g. getting orders correct - I would of been far less disappointed if my pasta would of had sauce on it!

With the other options in town for Italian Food, I most likely will not return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Macaroni Grill lost our business because of the poor customer service from the manager on staff, which is sad because this restaurant was our go to for our date night.  Got an order to go and when I got home the alfredo sauce was completely dried up.  I called and asked to speak to the manager and when I spoke to her and told her how our order was she said well I spoke to the server and all I can do is give you a discount next time you are here because she said your order was good when you picked it up.  She told me don't you know that the sauce soaks in to the noodles, which for a to go order they should add extra then for their customer to have a good meal.  At that point I was really upset because I literally had to throw away the food that I just spent over $50 on and when I asked to speak to her manager she said I am the only manager.  I asked to have the regional manager call me and then proceeded to hang up on me.  Such poor customer service telling your customer they are lying not only once but twice.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This has been one of our favorite restaurants for years. We have always sat in the bar area and enjoyed food and staff. We stopped by to try a meal after this horrible pandemic. The first disappointment was to see the entire bar area and outside seating is not available. The second disappointment was at the hostess stand. After standing there and being ignored for several minutes I believe it was a busser who came up to help. Being as we did not have reservations, he shook his head and tried to survey the restaurant. When asked what he was doing he replied trying to space tables and account for being short staffed, and then announced a 45 minute wait. No thanks. We all know how hard it is to run a restaurant in normal times and now it's harder. This ship needs a captain to run it efficiently or it will sink. Why would you not have the bar and the outside tables open? Obviously you needed space and to run efficiently.  Why book all available tables, you need to satisfy all customers. We have always just walked in, unless we book for a birthday party. The pandemic can't be blamed for poor planning. Get management on the floor running things.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had a lovely anniversary dinner here with my fiancé Saturday night. Perfect atmosphere, amazing food and great service! The chicken Marsala and grilled salmon was delicious! The manager Jaclynn was wonderful and so attentive. She made us feel so special on a special day for us. We will most definitely be back!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My family has been eating at this Restaurant for at least 8 yrs and loved it up til the last time we ate there in January 2012. The portions were smaller, more expensive, and not satisfying like we are accustom to. We felt like we had gone to a different restaurant under new management. Service was ok and the food was luke warm to cold when served after 40 minutes. The focus here was lite and not service. This Restaurant will not be on our list of Lunch or Dinner in the future.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My kids and I love to have date night at macaroni grill, friendly staff and management always makes our visit top notch! Peppadew peppers and chicken parmigiana are a must have for me!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Granted that it's Thanksgiving, I understand that today's a pretty busy day for restaurants that are open. My family and I were missing mashed potatoes for our dinner so we decided to just pick some up. We googled what restaurants were open and decided to order from here. Since we were already on it, we were able to order through google but apparently that's not the preferred way to order considering the attitudes of the staff helping us when picking up. They demanded a name and when we said that our order only had a number and showed them the order, they said "who orders on google? nobody does that." and continued to ask for a name. After continued rude comments and cold attitudes (almost as if they thought we made up the order when we showed them our mobile orders), they finally gave us our order. We wanted to ask for some bread and butter but were so turned off by the staff that we just wanted to immediately leave. For first time customers, we could have definitely done without the rude service and will not expect to come back.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went here for a late lunch with a friend there was one other table when we arrived. Our waitress was slow with everything from the condiments to responding to our questions. I worked in food service when I was younger and I get that its not the most glamorous job and requies long hours on your feet. However she was just abrupt and dismissive from the start. If you are out of a menu item fine make a suggestion or move on. Please do not go here it's not okay to pay for that kind of service. The food was fine but we did not finish it and packed up the meal after we were given all the materials and a bag this bothered my friend  because I guess they usually pack up your orders for you for me not a big deal. This place was her suggestion a favorite for her but I think she was upset by the experience we did not ask for the manger because we did want to argue  or complain we just wanted to enjoy a meal and catch up and she technically did her job just poorly. I give it two stars because the food was pretty good the service no thank you!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Wish there was a no star option. This "establishment" has the worst service in town.. it was maybe 1/3rd occupied and we had to wait 10 minutes for the hostess to show up just to tell us there is a waiting list. With only 2 names ahead of us on the list, we were assured we'd be seated in 10 minutes. Of course that became 25 minutes. The server couldn't have cared  less whether we were there or not. Our beverages arrived AFTER the entree. How this place stays open is a true mystery ..
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I shall now make a list of things that the Macaroni Grill is not:
Little Italy
Worth the Money
Fine Dining
Enjoyable

I shall now make a list of things that the Macaroni Grill is:
A good place to wait too long to be seated
A place with friendly wait staff once seated
A place that offers good food albeit overpriced 
Boring and a prime example of what happens when a restaurant stops trying

We went to the Macaroni Grill about two weeks ago for lunch.  I hadn't been there for the better part of a decade.  The place was vacant.  Maybe 4 other tables were full.  We stood at the podium for a good three for four minutes before we were even greeted.  

Once greeted we were sat quickly and orders were taken.  The food was very good (especially the deep fried macaroni balls and the fry appetizer).  Drinks were never empty and our waiter never let us get to low on bread.  

They really are way too expensive now for what they are and that's the deal breaker.  When the Macaroni Grill first opened they offered something that Reno didn't have.  Reno has grown and new restaurants have far surpassed this chain.  They really need to either lower prices or close up shop.

I won't go back.  It was my last visit.  If I'm craving expensive Italian, I will go to a multitude of places that now call Reno home.  If I'm craving less than expensive Italian, I will go to The Olive Garden and bring my own crayons and paper for the table.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
You don't deserve any stars!

I ordered the mamas trio, chicken parmesan, lasagna bolognese, fettuccine alfredo.

It came in one container all smashed up and since it was smashed in together, the alfredo sauce was mixed in with the red sauce from the parmesan chicken and lasagna. No alfredo sauce at all!!! Nor did I get any bread or utensils to eat with. Wtf do you think I would eat with my fingers???? Just because you're taking an order to be delivered don't assume that the place has a table etc, especially if you ask on your menu if we needed utensils, and bread to be included with the order. We also asked for extra alfredo sauce and red sauce. Who made this order??? 
For $35 plus delivery fee and tip. Reallyyy and all smashed together, your cooks and you don't care obviously about people who are not dinning in. Did it ever occur to you maybe someone just got out of the hospital and wanted, what they thought would be a good meal after eating hardly nothing in the hospital and we picked you out of many many restaurants to order from!! We were very wrong. Your cook and food preparer just put the food in like it was a trash can and mixed everything together to save you plastic containerd & to go ware. What kind of restaurant are you? None. Was the food good? NOOOOO, not even by taste. How could it be. It was shoved all smashed up in one container. 

Zero
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: While I can't complain about service. As we had very good service, and being Thanksgiving evening,  I felt a little badly for the people working. Food was ok, chicken scallopine was a little dry. But flavorful. Moms rigatoni tasted really sweet which didn't settle well for her. Calamari was forgotten and nephews pizza was late due to overcooking. When you really look at it,  this was the best alternative to not having reservations on Thanksgiving and coming from out of town with a large group. For that we're grateful. We left with full stomachs and happy that we were together for the holiday.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Tyla is amazing! Made our first time such a great experience.the food was delicious! The lobster bisque. With a hit of Tabasco and salt n pepper. You have to try it! Tyla service is phenomenal. Recommend great wine! Her service as a whole was above and beyond. I'll be definitely be having her as my waitress next time.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: If I could give it zero stars I would give them zero stars. Walked in waited for about 10-15 minutes to just be told that they don't have enough people to serve us, so we were refused service.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
What happened?  

It's been at least 5 years since I've eaten here, and while it was never my favorite it was decent to occasionally very good.  I only went back because it was a lunch date with my little sister and she picked it out (even though I suggested other places, she likes "italian" food and wanted to try this)

I realize everyone is cutting back these days, so I wasn't surprised to see they no longer had fresh cut flowers but other than that the interior was as I remembered it.  Still cozy and lovely with the dim lighting and spacious seating.  

The menu looked different from what I remembered, and they were featuring a promotional tapas for 2 menu.  1 tapa (appetizer) and 1 entree pp.  These were generally the cheaper menu items, but still a savings of $2-$6 pp if you were to order an app and entree each.  I think there was a selection of about 6 different items on each section.  They were out of the only entree that appealed to me and would not make a comparable substitution.  I wanted the chicken and mushroom cannelloni but ended up with a grilled chicken breast with angel hair pasta caprese.  My sister chose a creamy rigatoni dish with chicken.  We shared the goat cheese stuffed peppers and the zucchini fritto.  

The portions were large but the food was disgusting.  The zucchini fritto was paperthin slices of zucchini breaded and fried.  There were burned bits and other bits that were doughy and clumped together.  It lacked flavor and was greasy.  The peppers were interesting, tangy pickled peppers stuffed with cream cheese and heated then topped with fried bread crumbs and balsamic glaze drizzle.  I think they would have been much better served cold.  My sisters pasta was a giant bowl of rigatoni in a watery sauce and slices of chicken breast that look like the type of pressed chicken you get in school lunches.  Even with a lot of added parmesean cheese it was very bland.  My dish was a tough black charred chicken breast (again, tasted like formed chicken)  a glob of solidified angel hair pasta with a few cubes of mozzerella all melted together with wilted basil (I'm guessing my dish sat under a heater for a while).  The arugula salad it was served with was mostly spinach, again wilted with a dab of garlicky pesto.  I had literally two bites of food before I pushed my plate away. The chicken was dry and tough and tasted of salt and char, the pasta tasted of salt and old tomatoes.  I did enjoy the warm bread.  

Aside from terrible food, my final gripe is a petty one.  My sister ordered a peach lemonade and I ordered an "italian soda" which was soda water plus the same peach syrup in my sister's lemonade.  These beverages were listed together on the menu (no price listed so I assumed they were overpriced).  They were $3 each, but what annoyed me was that I asked for a refill and was told the soda did not have refills, but the lemonade did.  My soda came in a tall narrow glass packed with ice and could not have held more than 4 oz of liquid in all.  My sister's lemonade was a 20oz glass with about 1/4 full of ice.  I could understand if they opened a fresh bottle of pellegrino per soda, but this was just soda water from a soda gun so I don't see why it would cost more for refills?  Or why it wasn't listed separate from the free refill drinks like tea and lemonade?
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I'm not a big fan on chain restaurants but I have to say their 5 for $25 is an amazing deal. It really should be called $25 for 2 fat guys or 5 teen age girls for $25 .. Although the later is probably not appropriate for obvious reasons.

Two small loaves of bread, a heaping serving of Caesar (which was actually invented in Tijuana, but that's another story) and a big thing of pasta.. For $25? How can you go wrong?

My location in Reno uses Doordash and was here in less than 40 min. 

It's filling and enough for a leftover lunch the next day. 

Is the food 'authentic' Italian? No. Is it delicious? I thought so.

The deal is only valid Mon-Thur but your lazy butts should be cooking on the weekend during the pandemic anyway so no excuse.

And for you Karen idiots that reviewed this place during lock down I say.. 'Idiots have a way of getting what they deserve'.. I'm pretty sure Buddha would have said that had he known a Karen.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I love this place, the food was great we came in for lunch and Troy is awesome as ever. Every time we dine In they treat us like family.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We love it soo much here the food is always  delicious and the food never disappoints. the manager Troy is always delightful and keeps us laughing we feel like we're at home. When my family and I come in they know the food/ drinks that we like. Also when you sign up you get a coupon every week so that also keeps us coming back
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I just drove across town to eat here and the restaurant is almost empty at 6:14 on this Monday evening.  They said it will be an hour wait because there are only 2 cooks in the kitchen.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: In 2002 when I was in high school I came here with my family and the service and food was the worst experience I had in my short life.  I hadn't been back due to my dad swearing he'd never go back and I followed suit.  Since then I have traveled and eaten all over this earth and experiencing MRE's that were better quality than the food.  Today 07/01/2020 a friend offered to buy me some food from here with some gift cards she had.  The food turned out about as good as it was in 2002 and I would still prefer a pork sausage and gravy MRE to the food at this restaurant if the food was free it would still be over priced.  I have had frozen chicken fries and expired beef jerky that was better than the steak they made.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Teresa and Alfredo were such a joy to be around tonight. Their service was phenomenal and we couldn't be happier with the wonderful conversations and food we shared tonight! I highly recommend coming here for a nice dinner! 
Request Teresa and Alfredo to wait your next meal!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
This place is on a level with Olive Garden or eastern TGIFridays in terms of menu, atmosphere, and quality. The prices are even in line with what you should expect from the Fridays/O.G. Big difference is here they give you crayons so you can doodle on the table while you wait on the next round. I don't doodle. I take colouring very seriously. Don't seat me without a minimum of five colours. Joking of course; I bring my own.

The wait staff is friendly and very efficient. They should crayon their name upside down on your butcher paper. If not, ask them to. It's different and fun.

The wine selection appears to be pretty decent, but I'm not really a wine guy. They see me coming and immediately pull the alcohol glasses from the table. They have a killer ice tea, however!

One disadvantage of aging is limited income. It makes dining out a challenge. The Macaroni Grill folks send us email coupons twice a week. Many times a BOGO. It's a great way to try different dishes and not pay full price. 

Personally, I think they have an exceptional Chicken Parm. The Spaghetti is great, too. The meatballs are a bit spicy so I don't order it very often. I absolutely refuse to come here and not split the Crispy Brussels Sprouts with Mrs. E. I think they add some secret concoction to make you crave them. A-D-D-I-C-T-I-N-G!!!!!! 

It's Italian and that means you're paying more. But they provide a gorgeous atmosphere and very hospitable people. John is one of the best and of course Troy, the big dawg whose name is on the door, is happy to meet you, anytime. 11/19
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My husband and I have decided to have our lunch in this establishment, it's been quite awhile since last visited this restaurant.  The Maitre D welcomed us with swarm smiled and immediately seated us on a nice, cozy window booth.  The restaurant ambiance created a romantic old world feel.  Our friendly server Julian was accommodating and very thoroughly presented us their luncheon specials including their limited time, best flavors of the harvest season menus.  I have tried their Shrimp Portofino and my husband choose their Chicken Alfredo both were very tasty  we accompanied our meal with their raspberry ice tea.  The quick lunch was very refreshing and added more energy for our hectic afternoon errand.  Looking forward to visit them again this coming holiday when families and relatives comes to visit in town.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
After a 6 hour flight from Chicago, Colyn has shown exceptional customer service skills. He was an absolute delight and treat. He was informative about my vegetarian tomato bisque, and everything else the table has ordered. I am blown away by his kindness and care towards his customers. Amazing, recommend this place 10/10. 
If you are lucky enough to get him as a server, then treat him the same way he treats you. 
Thank you so much 
#firsttimeinreno #colynisthebest
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: We had delivery from here and was not really impressed. The negatives were the fact that the dinners did not come with salad or bread. Average pricing for dinner is about $20 per person and just includes main course. We also ordered caprese salad which was good but only came with 3 small sliced tomatoes. Chicken parm was good but nothing really special. Too many other good Italian restaurants in Reno and probably would not eat here again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I love their food here. The indoor service is great and the curbside has thrown me a few curve balls but still has been great. I will say that there were a couple of things that have gone wrong and it wasn't me being a Karen it was actual things that went wrong but both times they apologized profusely. One of the times they actually called me and I hadn't even really complained that they called and apologized like crazy. So this is what I think. We are in 2021 and right now people just prefer to throw each other under the bus and walk away and think as long as they blamed it on somebody else that it's going to be all right. They don't do that here. They fix it. And like I said I wasn't being at Karen and trying to get them to do something that wasn't correct or anything. I actually left and just was accepting things the way they were both times but they made them right without me complaining

THAT is the kind of business that I appreciate and will continue to solicit
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I'm kind of surprised at all the bad reviews here. We went last Friday night, and it was not very crowded. I would guess that has something to do with the bad reviews?  The service that we received was top-notch , warm bread right away to go with the house red wine. I love the fact that they leave the bottle on your table and you drink on the honor system. We ordered an appetizer which came quickly along with more bread. To be fair yes it is a chain restaurant and the food was fair not amazing but everything tasted great and was served hot. We gave Mitch over 20% gratuity because the service was so good and he seemed happy to be at work. The tiramisu for dessert was a huge portion and tasted great.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Awful Service!
Went on a Saturday evening, sat at the bar to have drinks and two apps. Finished our first round of drinks took 15 minutes for the bartenders to ask if we needed another round (there were 5 people at the bar) ordered two appetizers and it took 40 minutes to bring one out and then be told that they were out of the other appetizer...will never go back this was the second chance at the restaurant.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: If you are looking  fir a good place to eat, go somewhere  else. The new manager is very rude and doesn't  know what she is talking  about. She should not even be working.  She tells lies to the customers and her employees.  This place  is heading  for there doors to close with her in it. I work in a preschool  I will tell ALL the family's  to go somewhere  else. You just lost most of Reno.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Had a wonderful dinner here this evening with family. Even though it was a little busy, we were greeted and seated within minutes for a party of 6. Other then plates being dropped on the floor around us and lighting being a little on the dark side; the service was pretty good...thanks Devin (server)! 

The chicken parmesan dish was really good although the angel hair spaghetti had a little spice to it which is due to the onion powder, black pepper and cayenne pepper. If your not in to spice then you may want to substitute this with something else. 

On the drink venue, the pomegranate and rasberry ice tea was really good but I will skip the black berry ice tea next time due to it's lack in flavor. 

And last but not least, the New York cheese was amazing in taste but the slice size was surprisingly a little on the small side in comparison to our dinner portion size but that slice didn't stand a chance :) The tiramisu was also amazing in taste and it's portion size was impressive compared to it's cheesecake neighbor... I've tasted quite a few of these cakes and this one is by far on of the best... Until next time...
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: After weeks of waiting I did get a credit for my meal. Unexpectedly they gave me a FULL refund. I was only expecting half the money for the food that was missing. Thanks. The management stepped up and did a good job. Hopefully this error doesn't happen again.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: My husband and I have eaten here twice. We Love the food!!!! You walk in and it smells amazing. Food and service is great! Both times I'm amazed at the price!! Compared to olive grader this place is a no brainier!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: This place could only be 5 stars with the help of Teresa and Tyla! Yes of course the food was great but Teresa sat us down and made us feel like old friends right away. Made our dining experience top notch! Tyla was the best server I think I've ever encountered in Reno! She was so patient with my questions and gave great imput on her favorite dishes. She was quick and so friendly and even though she had a mask on I could tell she was smiling. My night was made, food was delicious, and I felt as if I made new friends! Definitely definitely will return!!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I went to Macaroni Grill at about one-o'clock. The place was not busy at all. Our waitress  Jayme , helped us with all of our questions. We had a BOGO coupon for the three-course lunch. She gladly accepted our coupon and then we placed our order. I ordered the sausage and pepper rigatoni and my daughter ordered the fettuccini gorgonzola. The bread was delivered promptly and was delicious and warm. The waitress  made us the olive oil and pepper dip which was delicious as well. Our first course was a mozzarella frita with marinara sauce. The cheese was warm and crunchy. The next course was a Caesar salad with croutons and cheese. The salad was very delicious as well. Next came our main course. The rigatoni was better than the fettuccini, but both were delicious. The service was fast, they accepted all our coupons, and the food was delicious and in big servings. I would recommend coming here and trying the three-course lunch!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Made some last-minute reservations to eat here with my wife. We like a Friday night date with the kids off skating. We had Purchased the gift card for Costco so it's like having a 20% discount. Macaroni Grill is a bit expensive, however the food quality has a high standard. 

When we arrived, it was kind of strange because the place was deserted. The waitress/hostess that greeted us was very friendly and sat us immediately. She was friendly and professional. The only concern I have is that she wore an extreme amount of perfume. It made me gag when she came by the table to ask us for drinks. Also, when she brought the bread and olive oil, the bottom of the bread was rockhard. The top was soft however we could not cut through the bottom without a saw. Our server care of this immediately. It was kind of hard to taste the bread with the perfume wafting around us. 

The price has definitely increased as the bottle of wine was quoted at $48. I remember just before Covid being here and the bottle is $32. So I asked for a wine list. She said they did not have one but she knew everything about the wines. Luckily I had an old picture of the wine menu and showed it to her. She went to check the prices and then quoted me $38 for a bottle and apologized. It is somewhat difficult to not have the ability to look at the list of wines and their prices. Especially when you were quoted $16 more than the last time you visited.

What we ordered:

Drinks: went with a bottle of wine. My wife likes sweeter wines so I ordered a bottle of Reisling (Chateau St. Michelle) 

Lamb Shank 
Steak and mash
Grilled asparagus 

The food is extremely good. The lamb shank pulled apart with a fork. The steak was cooked perfectly and had a great flavor. My wife really loved the style of mashed potatoes. For a side of asparagus, it seemed a bit small. But it was definitely cooked nicely.

I do hope the waitress reads this review and adjust her perfume. With a sidenote, if you wear the same perfume over and over, sometimes you get desensitized to the smell and you have to apply more so you can smell it. Overtime this builds up and the result is suffocating for others. 

Other than this, it was a nice visit and we will return.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
We don't eat at a lot of chain restaurants, but we were dropping the truck off at Best Buy for an install, and Romano's is in the same parking lot so...
Seating was plentiful and spaced out well. Our server was really friendly and suggested the current wine special which was a bottle of cab for $10! Okay, it was a deal we couldn't pass up and the wine was actually pretty decent. 
A kind of ciabatta bread with balsamic and olive oil was brought to us and we tore up pieces to enjoy. Soft, tasty and went nice with the dipping oil and vinegar. 
We ordered Mac n cheese balls and bruschetta to share as a starter. We enjoyed both but I particularly enjoyed the bruschetta. A bowl of sauced chopped tomatoes to dump on some really soft delicious slices of baguette. Yum. Mac n cheese bites were good as well with a nice crunchy exterior.
My wife and I shared the shrimp portofino and both the shrimp and pasta was cooked well. My son ordered calamari and it had a nice light crisp and was a good portion for being a starter dish. All in all, we really enjoyed our visit!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Tried going here today. Looked up hours and updated information in multiple areas on the web and all give hours indicating theirs open. Drive from Fernley and there's essentially no cars in the parking lot. Tried calling to no avail. The answering system offers take out or reservations and no one answered that either. Finally went in and it's empty aside from two staff who say they open at 4pm. Would have been nice for a more upper scale restaurant to update their online information or voice recorded message indicating they don't open until 4pm. Brewery next door is popping.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I wanted to take the opportunity to thank Troy Crisco and the good folks at Romano's Macaroni Grill. They did their level best to deliver a quality product this past year of pandemic. 

Quarantine carry out only, reduced seating and delivery shortages are just a few of the many challenges they had to overcome. But they managed and are walking tall as a result. 

A great menu, a beautiful atmosphere and a fabulous support staff that takes care of all our needs! Hell, you can even learn a little Italian speak while you wash up! I just wish we lived closer so we could visit more often. 04/21
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Terrible experience. Do not book a party or make a reservation at this Macaroni Grill. My daughter booked a college graduation  the party for her daughter and they gave the room away to another party that walked in off the street the day of the party.  Several people  had come in from across the country people to attend what was supposed to be a joyous occasion turned out to be sad and disappointing. They put at separate tables by the front door. The servers did their best to make it a good moment but management should be fired!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: 7-22-2021 1:30 pm lunch.  Entrées and desert excellent, portions big, ambiance nice , service was great.  Parking lot was empty, we were not sure they were open.  Had eaten last month back at the Olli G - (you know where) at Legends, and we were very unimpressed.  By comparison,  Macaroni Grill hit it out of the park.  They even offered seconds on salad and focaccia bread, but the initial serving was plenty large enough.  Very pleased.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The restaurant was very slow, 2:00 in the afternoon. Only 3 table was occupied, and  still we, (8 of us) with reservation, had to to wait 18 minutes to be seated.
The food was coming out very late,  by 2 plates,  at the time and long wait in between. Grated cheese wasn't offered at all.
Very disappointing, since I thought they need business but not showing any appreciation.
The food was tasty though.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Thank you for accommodating our party of 12 last minute! Our waitress Tyla was wonderful. Despite being understaffed (and the restaurant was practically empty on a Saturday night, which was eerie), food was mostly served in a timely manner.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
The food was great there are so many great options with the build your own pasta. Also pass me more of that fresh bread with the olive oil.

Don't sleep on the chocolate cake, there is no better way to finish off an amazing dinner.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Absolutely love their mozzarella sticks I go there just for that LOL I went there recently for outdoor dining and it was really nice the server was amazing food was served hot and it was nice to have a little bit of normalcy in our crazy world right now
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: I had the most lovely time at the Macaroni Grill because of our wonderful server he was a tall young gentlemen with blonde hair. However it was obvious to me that the older female manager named Trena was terrible toward her employees and guests, I have never seen such terrible management! Although I thought it was a pleasant time due to our service, the management will never make me come back ever again! The gentlemen in the suit walks around like he owns the place aswell! Terrible!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Had high hope's and hungry for pasta, but alas it disappointed, mediocre dry pasta, weird tasting tomato basil soup but the kicker was this tiny dessert for 7.50
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
I have had pretty good experiences here. I love the bread they bring you at the beginning of the meal. Mmmmm it trumps Olive Gardens breadsticks completely!
Personally I like to do the "Create your own pasta" option. I feel like I am pretty damn good and putting flavors together, and basically I just know what I like. But if I don't get this I go for the pasta milano, which is quite tasty.
My friends and I have used this place for group meals a lot and it works out very well for that. Everyone can munch on bread and sip on a drink while waiting for the others to join.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Denise went out of her way for our Aspie. The food is pipping hot and fresh. I missed this place because I used to go in the Bay Area.

We went on Wednesday and Saturday for a double birthday bash before the rush. There was no wait time and I love the ambiance.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: A group of us came in last night to celebrate my wife's birthday. Our waitress Christina was wounderful. She gave us a great experience. There was a delay in the kitchen, but she was on top of everything. I would recommend her section, she has a welcoming personality. The food was delicious and we enjoyed the happy hour at the bar.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Saul our server - great job - ran us through the specials - was informed on the wine list. Split a Caesar with no complaints ( you know sometimes servers roll their eyes ).
Order a simple Tormaresca Puglia for dinner a fruity white wine - perfect slightly chilled but not served in an ice bucket.
Entree was a shrimp portofino - light sauce, pine nuts with little button mushrooms and shredded Parmesan. Delicious shared by two and a Tiramisu for dessert , sorry it was empty, but our service was fantastic!!
We will return!
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
Came for a 50th birthday party on Saturday evening. This place used to be great!  Had high expectations for this place, how ever those went out the window. 
We came in at 630, they said the bread was not ready yet. How is there no bread ready at 630 on a Saturday night?  The bread came out after my meal arrived. The people bringing the meals out looked less than happy to be working that night. 

It took forever to get salads out to our table. I had to ask for fresh ground pepper and parmesan cheese.  I asked for a second salad it took 20 minutes to get a salad? The waitress said they were behind. 

The cheese was not even fresh grated, she brought a plastic container out with cheese that looked like it was pre packaged.  The waitress said I guess this is how we are doing it.  They used to grate fresh Parmesan cheese for your meal. 

When my spaghetti came out it was lukewarm not even hot.  The meatballs were ok, but lukewarm inside. 
My wife's pasta arrabbiata sauce I could have feed to my 18 month old daughter no flavor or spice whatsoever. 
Then on to the chocolate cake. It used to be so good here! Wrong! It was dry and cold. 

Our waitress was great, but you could tell the place was severely short staffed.  It was hard to get water filled and ask for cheese and pepper on my pasta.  

We will not return again and the 8 people with us agree it was a bad experience.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Went in during a weekday right after the lunch hour (about 2p) The place had about 3 tables occupied by customers. We were told it would be a 15min wait. Puzzled at why the wait if there was barely anyone in the restaurant we started calling around to other restaurants to check their wait time. The hostess heard us and offered us complimentary drinks while we waited (that was nice) We were finally seated and the waiter informed us that they were short staffed and that he had to give his cooks some time to catch up. Fine. We ordered fettuccini with creamy garlic sauce and the butternut squash tortellacci dish. My fettuccine was ok. Sauce was a bit too thick and clumpy, under seasoned, and it was room temperature.  The tortellacci dish and it was not good. As you can tell by the picture, it looked like the dish was cooked in a pound of butter. It was greasy. The butternut was undercooked and it lacked salt. We were starving so we were really looking forward to eating these tasty dishes that we had there a few months back. We were very disappointed this time around. I shared with the waiter our disappointment with the butternut dish and he took it off the tab even though my husband ate half of it (he was very hungry). We appreciated the waiters willingness to listen and try to make things right but we will not be returning to this place.
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text: Called to make a reservation and ended up being kept on hold for so long I eventually just hung up. Decided to just walk in and was able to be seated. Took almost an hour to get our food (three meals). Two of the meals (both pasta Milano) had almost NO chicken, both dishes were about 98% pasta, 1 percent mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, and 1 percent chicken. Almost $80 for three meals and one appetizer. Really disappointing. We are trying to support restaurants during the pandemic but won't be back here anytime soon
name: Romano's Macaroni Grill

text:
What most people call dives whether it be a bar, hotdog stand or cafe, I call home.   This place is actually at 1160 Gallatin Pike S at the intersection of Due West rd and Gallatin Pike and might not come up on your gps if you type in the address listed above.  The owner serves up hot dogs with a variety of toppings in regular and super sizes, don't get the super if you are not up for a 1/4 pound dog!  I noticed a variety of sandwiches, drinks and chips ,You can even have a beer with your meal, this might be hot dog heaven!  I realize the prices are displayed on the board but when I ordered a tea, superdog loaded and chips the owner looked everything over and said "lets call that $5".  I'm pretty sure I made out on that deal!  Some might complain about the decor but it is working class comfortable with odd and funny signs, a pinball machine and what some may say is an "antique" video game.   If you are in Madison and in the mood for a dog, swing on buy and enjoy.  The joint is not in the strip mall but in the lower level of the 5 story office building next to the Nail salon.

Vegwise, I did not see a vegetarian option on the menu!
name: Super Dog

text:
If you're in Madison, and you've just got to have a hot dog, I guess this is all right.  I had the opportunity to visit this place a couple of times, and I found the place to be mediocre and dingy.

Working with this, the place is entertaining, and must be one of the last restaurant-type places left in Nashville to be without a non-smoking section.  It also seems to have regular clientele who always come here to snack, drink, and smoke.

The food is nothing special, and outside of the reasonable prices of the dogs themselves, I was a little surprised at the unreasonably high prices for the mediocre food, 50 year old decor (the pin ball machines look at least a half-century old), and generally crude experience.

If I were still working in Madison, I guess I'd prefer going to the Wendy's nearby more often, but the Super Dog is what it is.
name: Super Dog

text: This place has since moved to Madison Square Shopping Center just down the road from the old location.  They are now located on the left back corner across from The National College of Business and Technology.  Same great food with great prices to match.  I did notice that they now accept credit cards!
name: Super Dog

text: This 30+ year-old purveyor of hot dogs, etc., is located in a shopping center / strip mall next to a nail salon. It has no light box sign, but it does have a nice hand-painted sign on its front window. Inside, it's 70s-era wood paneling is packed with the obligatory humorous signs and curios. The owner serves up a very good classic boiled small ($1.70-1.90) or "Super" (1/4 lb, approx. $2.50) wiener in a variety of styles, including regular, saucy (with mustard, sauerkraut and dog sauce [gravy] on it), cheesy, chili-cheesy, slaw, or "special," which combines mustard, kraut, meat sauce, and onions. Other offerings include bags of chips and, for non-hot-dog-lovers, various sandwiches like hamburgers, BLT, beef & cheese, and hot beef. There are some breakfast items to boot, and a pot of coffee on the burner. I like their extra small fountain drink priced at 60 cents (coke, diet coke, sprite, dr. pepper). They also serve the classic Bud, etc. beer selection for 2.00 (small) or 2.25 (large), or 2.25 for a can. There is a few older arcade games, including an early Arkanoid and a vintage pinball machine.
name: Super Dog

text: Best hot dog shop in Madison, TN! Been here for 30+ years, it's pretty hidden away. You either just stumble up on the shop, or you know where this place is, you have been here before. It's a little ole small hot dog joint, have your choice of regular or super size dogs. Worth coming here!
name: Super Dog

text: Great hot dogs very divey atmosphere.  Good quick simple meal.
name: Super Dog

text: cute ambience that would be great for date night or even girl's night. i went for a small birthday dinner for a girlfriend, we ordered several plates & shared. sadly i don't remember many of the plates but the only thing that stood out in taste was the crab noodles, they were great. everything else didn't really catch my attention on taste besides the broccolini (spelling?) being salty. the cocktails were great & we ordered plenty of hot sake to enjoy our evening. the main reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because the menu is a little pricey (location is downtown nashville off 3rd) & nothing spectacular stood out for it being a new spot in nashville.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: I've been for both lunch and dinner and The Green Pheasant was exceptional both times. The interior decor of the restaurant is really well done with a unique, modern vibe. The food was excellent. Loved the udon noodles with pork and an egg for lunch as well as the mushrooms and the salmon for dinner!
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Positives: Different menu, not southern or american food, great atmosphere, good happy hour special, a few good dishes, great sake

Negatives: Average service, high prices, food is not consistent
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Lets start with the pros : valet parking, cute atmosphere, server very attentive. Perhaps I went on a off day . Lets go, the pheasant dumplings and chicken k ( I forgot the name ) had absolutely no flavor their was no salt on table which made it harder to rehabilitate, ordered the spicy crab noodle first order came out cold ,informed server who was very apologetic, no problem stuff happens. Second order arrived hot but no flavor or spice asked for spicy oil and that made it palatable.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
I work in the neighborhood and have had the opportunity to stop by the Green Pheasant 3x for dinner and 2x for lunch since it opened a few weeks ago.  These guys are hitting on all cylinders right out of the gate.  I had the Tomago (Japanese egg salad, yes the eggs are FedEx'd from Japan) for lunch one day and Hambuga (hamburger) the next.  These would both appeal to someone who has never had Japanese food to the most serious Japanese food fan.  One of my co-workers had the karate (fried chicken) and it too was incredible.

Dinner, the Waloo, A5 Waygu, and King Salmon are my favorites so far. 

I will be back again and again and again.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Great portion size for shared plates. Wonderful atmosphere to go along with it. Flavorful food paired with good service
name: The Green Pheasant

text: We had an amazing holiday dinner for my company here. The food was amazing, but what sets the Green Pheasant apart is the vibe, the service and the cool places to hang throughout the evening. Their bar was great and the private dining rooms accommodate a variety of meeting/dining needs.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Exceeded my expectations. Bring a small group son you can sample the most. I tried so many things it was all great: tebasaki goyza (stuffed chicken wing), sui goyza (steamed dumplings), chahan (fried rice with egg), spice crab noodles (watch out they are spicy), and a pancake thing that I couldn't  find on the online menu to try to remember what it was. The Ambience was trendy and cool. I really enjoyed it.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
We were pretty disappointed in this meal. The staff was friendly but unhelpful in trying to pick dishes to fit our tastes. Though I'm not sure it would have helped. We tried 6 dishes. The first was basically cold potato salad, pretty much the same as I could pick up at Kroger. The dumplings were bland and flavorless, the curry udon was basically a bowl of mush, and while the trout was good, it could have been trout from any southern restaurant and didn't ring of Japanese flavors at all. The only dish that we enjoyed that had the expected flavoring was the Broccolini with rock shrimp, which was pretty good. 1 for 6 isn't great.

The drinks were fine but not particularly special at 14 bucks each. The waitress described the atmosphere as a neighborhood Japanese pub but it's just another upscale dining establishment in a town full of them. The ambience or atmosphere is the same as any other in town.

Overall, it was not a terrible meal, but not really a good meal either. Just kind of a dud (and an expensive dud at that) in a town full of much better restaurants. We probably wont return.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Terrific Japanese cuisine with great service. Lovely ambience in super location. Excellent value too. Will upgrade to 5 upon next visit I'm sure, couldn't stay long this visit.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: We went to The Green Pheasant for the first time on January 5. We knew we were in for a treat when we heard the Two Ten Jack was branching out to a new restaurant concept, and boy, were we not disappointed! I personally think that we were so excited that we ordered too much food, but it was worth it. We ordered a wide variety of foods from their rotating menu and loved every one! In particular, we ordered a selection of raw fish on a bed of sushi rice first. This was the most expensive item we ordered, but it was worth it! Next, we ordered the dandan shishito, the friend rice, the shrimp and asparagus, and the stuffed friend chicken. Everything was phenomenal.  This is definitely a pricey meal - we spent $100 without buying drinks, but it was well worth it for a fancy night out.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: This place is great - a bit pricey- but well worth it. Everything we tried was amazing. We tried fried oysters, tuna tartare, gyoza, shumai, wagyu and toki highball drink. It was all amazing! Great atmosphere, great food.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Devine!  The atmosphere and decor is exceptionally gorgeous. The food we ordered was just as beautiful, interesting, and tasty.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Dinner at Green Pheasant.  Both enjoyed our meal.  I had sui gyoza and shumai (small plates).  My wife had the whole wok fried trout.  The food was well prepared and good presentation.  Liked both of my dishes and the trout was firm but not overcooked.  My wife felt that it needed more flavor and asked for salt which helped.  The trout dish needs some type of side sauce (hate to say tartar but perhaps an Asian version with wasabi/ginger) to dip. Would return.  Menu is a little confusing and does not describe certain dishes as "small plate" but the menu is arranged from low to high price with about $19 being the dividing line.  The server explained this.  

Could not find the $5 parking lot.  Valet parked for $11 and $4 tip.  Call ahead to get directions to the parking lot that the restaurant will pay for part of cost.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Very disappointing.  We went there for our anniversary and left early.  We were not impressed with anything we ordered.  Very mundane:( . We left and went to re-eat dinner for half the price and enjoyed it a lot more.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: We ordered the Chahan fried rice, spicy crab noodles, fried trout, and the chicken wing dumplings. The wings were amazing and must-try if you like wings. Fried rice is a little on the salty side but was very satisfying. Spicy crab noodles had really good noodle texture. Fried trout came with steamed bun but to be honest the fish was a little bland by itself and the combo of bun and cole slaw with fish was a little strange to our tastes. Bill came to 140 after tips so a little pricy, but it's a nice place to try Asian fusion food in SoBro.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: The Green Pheasant came highly recommended by some colleagues, so I made a point to visit. I sat at the large wrap around bar and ordered the Dan Dan Shishitos (spicy!) as well as the Broccolini with shrimp and cornbread. Both dishes were packed with flavor and enough food for a night for me. I was so tempted by the jidori chicken and salmon, so I'll have to go back to try those!
name: The Green Pheasant

text: we were pleasing pleased with the Green Pheasant.  good restaurant design. interesting menu.   its a dining experience. shared plates allow you to navigate the many wonderful plates.  Kinoko-mushrooms,  chahan-fried rice, curry udon-noodles  , chirashi-sushi, pheasant dumpling, tsukemono cucumber and wagyu.   absolutely try as many as you can, because its delicious.  parking next door ..........
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Decided to come to try this newly opened restaurant with friends when saw it on instagram the first time. We came in with reservation on pre-Thanksgiving night and there were many people. They have valet parking, and you can also park at the garage nearby and get validated from the front desk. The inside is cute! Our wine is awesome, I really like the cute glass. We ordered a bunch of food just because we'd love to try everything that sounds delicious. The broccoli appetizer is delicious. Was really surprised to find Japanese A5 wagyu in Nashville the first time. It's quite oily and tasty with medium-rare. 6 oz is a good portion for share. The biggest win I would say is the curry udon, so so amazingly good, simple looking but awesome. Love the sausage in the fried rice! The shishito peppers are great with pork! End up having no room for dessert lol. Overall, there's one thing that's a little bothering, every dish is too salty for us. Our waiter explained that it's their first time cooking Asian meals and they did not know if soy sauce is being used, no more salt is needed, and said they will improve next time. Except for that, everything is awesome.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: A wonderful experience all around. The quality and execution of both food and drink was excellent and the interior is absolutely lovely. The wait staff felt a little green (no pun intended) but were friendly and professional. My table enjoyed sampling the entire cold menu and several of the hot menu items. Everything ranged from good to fantastic, which is a difficult feat to achieve. If you are looking for a contemporary izakaya experience in Nashville, I highly recommend The Green Pheasant above all of the other similar restaurant concepts that have popped up in town.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
I enjoyed my dining experience here. I will say, it's a bit pretentious inside, but the wait staff and bartenders were friendly and our meal was good. I went with 2 other people and we ordered 7 things to split so we were able to get a good sampling of the menu. I'd highly encourage sharing here. I will be back for my favorites (below) for sure. Of note, their bathroom had a bidet and heated toilet seats! #fancy

-ikinari steak - amazing! I would come back here just for this
-Dan Dan shishitos 
-Okonomiyaki - very tasty
-sunomono - for the fish lovers (very fresh)
-mochi - not nearly as chewy as others I have had; I could tell they were much better quality and the flavors were pronounced
-The Japanese-Japanese drink was so good! I would definitely recommend that as well. 

Whatever you do, do not order the ohitashi. It was a veggie dish that tasted fishy. Non of us liked it. Also, the sui gyoza are very bland and not worth it.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
My husband and I went to The Green Pheasant for dinner before attending the symphony this past Saturday, and we were both impressed! 

We had a reservation and were seated in the upstairs area of the restaurant after we walked in. Our waitress was LOVELY. She walked us through pretty much the whole menu as well as explaining some of the drink options as well. 

I started with a sake that the restaurant had on tap, which was wonderful. my husband tried one of their cocktails and then stuck with his favorite Manhattan after that. 

We started with the okonomiyaki (a Japanese pancake, at Green Pheasant made with ham, bacon, scallops, potatoes, and various traditional okonomi toppings). It was good, but not my favorite thing we ate. Next we tried the shumai (at Green Pheasant, made with lobster and spot prawn - and served with clover ponzu) - these were okay, but definitely my least favorite thing we ordered (they had a slightly strange flavor to me, but that may be because I'm so used to shumai made with shrimp only). 

Next we had the spicy crab noodles (with crab butter, sweet red crab, and tobanjan), which were very good. Lots of crab on the dish, and it was just the right amount of heat! 

But the Ikinari steak was my favorite of the appetizers or entrees we ordered! The steak was American skirt steak with corn and onion and miso brown butter and j sauce, served in a hot hot hot sizzle plate like is traditional at the Japanese steak restaurant chain Ikinari (picture a fajita platter at a Tex Mex restaurant). The steak was great (perfectly cooked); the corn and onions were charred where they had touched the hot sizzle plate; and the miso brown butter was just the right richness for the steak. I'd come back to Green Pheasant just to eat this again. A great dish.

But we didn't stop there. We ordered two of the desserts as well. I ordered the ginger creme brulee which was SENSATIONAL (I might be back at Green Pheasant again soon - I want to sit at the bar, order some sake or shochu, and eat the Ikinari steak and the ginger creme brulee. Quite simply one of the best desserts I've had recently. The ginger flavor was amazing, and the creme brulee was so smooth. I LOVED IT. My husband has about 10x the sweet tooth I do and he ordered the tempura fried slice of chocolate cake. I tried a teeny tiny bite, and it's just WAAAAAAY too rich and sweet for me, but he enjoyed it (definitely for people who love sweet, rich desserts only). 

We had a couple more drinks (including a shochu cocktail that was DELICIOUS). The service was excellent, and the restaurant pretty nice (I do think sitting downstairs is probably nicer, because upstairs is pretty sparse compared to the decor on the main level). We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. I think we'll be back.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
This is a great place for a date night or group dinner. 

The concept is Japanese small plates that should be shared. We got to sit in this awesome red believer half booth and people watch everyone going by outside. Our waiter gave great recommendations for both food and drinks. 

We started with chilled sake and pheasant dumplings. They were perfectly crispy and floral and had a little spice to them. Next was lobster and corn dumplings which were very much my favorite dish. Next was mushrooms with miso, which I also recommend getting. We got the spicy crab noodles as our main dish. These were great and very rich. For dessert we got the mochi. I love mochi and I've had better mochi at other places. I'd try something else. 

The atmosphere was cool, the service was amazing, I'd definitely go back.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: We ate upstairs and it was a serene and lovely respite from the wild honky tonk of Broadway. The food was very good. I had swordfish and ate every bite. The creamed spinach was the star of the show. The wedge salad was fresh and good. I would recommend this if you are needing a delicious meal and some quiet time.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
I eat out in nashville restaurants 4-5 week for lunch and dinner. The GP is new on the scene and as i understand it also own TwoTenJack. The food is really good especially the American Waygu and sashimi platter. Tough to get really good sushi and they did it. But what I cannot stand is for a restaurant to be so pretentious that is ruins a meal. 1)Sitting all the older couples in one section of the restaurant 2) pretending its very busy when half the tables are full. 3) saying that we should preorder when they haven't taken out drink order 4) the server not know what a gin martini is 5) server telling us that the meal will be served at a leisurely pace and everything come out with 15 minutes of each other. 6) charging 12 dollars for valet parking. 

The server was nice enough but obviously the staff was at the direction of Managment to turn over tables on a Saturday night when it was slow. 

You got the impression they want to be the hip version of two ten jack from the east side in a downtown environment. 

Not sure that attitude will work very long.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Beyond words. 

Awesome venue close to the sky bridge. 

We came for happy hour and stayed for an amazing meal--and called our friends to join!

The wedge salad is fresh, light and crunchy, the seaweed salad is highly recommended for those who like REAL seaweed plucked fresh from the ocean with a light dressing. 

We then had the shrimp stuffed chicken wings and spicy homemade crab pasta, ramen and it was delish. Our friends got sushi and loved it. 

The staff here are amazing--our bartender was so sweet when she heard that the concert we wanted to go to was sold out she tried to make some calls to see if she could get us extra tickets!

You will not regret coming here :) 

Also they have quite a Japanese whisky selection
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Excellent staff here!! Everyone from the valet staff, the host, the restaurant manager, the servers were all nice! Our waiter had a great knowledge of the menu! The restaurant is beautiful with modern decor! We were lucky to be seated in a private room. The staff helped us get set up and I can't thank them enough. We all loved the stuffed chicken wings. The drinks were delish!!

The entrees are really not shareable because most items are bite sizes like the 4 dumplings you can eat in 2 bites.
