text: A bit of a miss. It started prior to visit with excessive text reminders of my reservation to then arrive and find the restaurant nearly empty, only 4 tables occupied. Greeting felt a little pretentious. Fortunately, the waiter was friendly and had good recommendations for sake and food. The walu dish was incredible, served sashimi style with bergamot ponzu and radish oroshi. Light and fresh! I followed that with a fan favorite, spicy crab noodles. This dish was also delicious. Surprisingly, the kinoko mushroom dish was a big disappointment. The broth gave the dish a dirty taste. I only took a few bites. The server that cleared my table saw the full dish and didn't show any concern that it wasn't eaten. I've had better dining experiences in Nashville.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: This place is a little further from all the action of broadway but well worth the extra blocks. Small plates allow for multiple types of delicious food. Everything we ate was fantastic (Japanese waygu, pheasant gyoza, crab noodles, chicken wings, etc). And they have. Nice selection of alcoholic choices as well.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Amazing flavors!! We love unique places and we weren't disappointed. Service was great, he coursed everything out perfectly, yummy cocktails and delicious food made our last night in Nashville even more memorable. Highly recommend the spicy crab noodles, kinoko and the salmon.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: A pretty space in the heart of downtown.  Food was interesting but did not blow me away. Service was excellent, and the Japanese whiskey drinks were great. Even with plentiful ordering of shared entrees and dessert, I found myself hungry soon after dinner. A return visit unlikely.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
So I had the kushiyaki for lunch (pictured).  It was amazing.  The grilled mushroom, eggplant and avocado was very tasty, cooked just enough and was the perfect proportion.  

As for the sides, the miso soup was good as expected.  The kimchi was perfect.  Some spice and proportioned perfectly.  

The ambience and this place is really special. It is quite relaxing.  There is something artistic about the entire place, including the preparation.  I will visit this restaurant again.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: It's nice to have the option to eat at an Asian restaurant in SoBro however the menu is limited. You can order from the Cold and Hot menu but there aren't a lot of choices on either one. The food is expensive and our dishes were bland. The food and drinks are expensive. The food arrived at our table without thought, so we received a hot dish at the same time that we received a cold dish. We stood at the bar another day and the hostess kept badgering our group to move even though the restaurant was empty at that time. She was fairly obnoxious. If a bar doesn't want patrons to stand it can provide more seats or extend the bar seating into the restaurant area. The restaurant makes more profit from its drinks than its food in any case. On the bright side, the commodes are wonderful and are like the commodes one finds in Japan. Perhaps patrons can imbibe there....
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Amazing. The service was great. The food was spectacular. We tried about 5 plates and the brownie dessert. Everything was delicious.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Eating here was by far one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I knew that the minds behind Two Ten Jack next creation would be even more incredible. The food was truly magical. It was really hard to keep from ordering more and more food.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
I want to make sure everyone knows just how good and accommodating the service was here first and foremost and not to take attention away from how great the food was.  We made reservations for 8:30 and our table was a little behind so we headed to the bar for a pre dinner cocktail.  Sake on tap is pretty cool and in my opinion a great drink to order before and with dinner here.  My date had forgotten her id....on her bday...and after she returned the bartender bought her a drink.  Didn't have to just did it out of kindness and made sure to get it to our table.  Thank you Mike!  The hostesses at the door kept us informed and were very polite when our table became ready.  Our seat was in one of the crushed velvet booths and was comfortable and could easily sit 4 just as comfortably to share all of our dishes with.  The food is served tapas style and arrives quickly to your table.  Our server was well informed about the menu and all employees were eager to share personal menu favorites as well as popular patron choices.  The okonomiyaki, spicy crab noodle and ikinari steak was our favorites out of the 4 plates we ordered and plenty for 2 people.  The fourth dish was the tebasaki gyoza not my style but was still very flavorful and with a crispy outer crunch.  I was surprised at the check expecting it to be more for a night out but was very affordable for a beginning of a fun date night!  We are excited to go back and try everything on the menu and I would love to come back for the lunch menu.  

A few tips:
1. Don't eat all day before you go,  you will want the extra room!
2. Everything is unique and delicious don't be afraid to explore!
3. The miso butter on the steak is very good,  we mixed it into the hot      plate with everything but next time might try it on the side for dipping.  It wasn't bad but I think we overpowered the other flavors with all the butter.
4. Repeat, don't eat before you go!
5. Bonus Ascend is right across the street.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: It's rare to have a perfect experience at even the best restaurants but that exactly what we had last night.  Service was effective. The restaurant was comfortable and interesting.  The food was outstanding.  Lobster shomai was so memorable.  The wagyu beef was perfectly cooked and presented and the spicy crab noodles were equally great.  We are from Atlanta so can't get back anytime soon but we will be there again at some point.  It's worth the trip!
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
More like 3.5 stars but because of good service I'm upgrading. Went in for dinner and ordered the Japanese pickles and Chirashi.
While the pickles were ok, I was disappointed with the quality of fish. Some small and bigger cut pieces to start off, but the moon fish was really chewy and I had to tell them about it.
They offered to redo the entire dish only to come back with the same issues. Sounds like the chef doesn't care that some fish cuts shouldn't be served like this.
Anyways, for dessert I had their tempura chocolate cake: rich, sweet and not too oily, so it was quite good.
Overall not impressed.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
This place was excellent. I'm not usually a huge fan of small plates, but the portions were reasonable for the price and quality. Everything was absolutely scrumptious. The atmosphere and service were top notch. It's a great place to go with a small group. 

I highly recommend the lobster shumai and filet mignon with miso butter. Yum!!!
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Picked this place for my best friends birthday dinner because of its sister restaurant Two Ten Jacks reputation. It's UNBELIEVABLE! The ambiance is, as my friend said, "the absolute cutest" with shiny wallpaper and heated toilet seats. And the food--goodness gracious, the food. We went nuts with the appetizers. Lobster shu Mai, pheasant dumplings, moon fish ceviche, oh my! The entree is one of the best I've had in a while. If you don't try the wagyu beef and spicy crab noodles, you're not really a good fan. Don't worry, I'll be back.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
We had an outstanding meal at the Green Pheasant on Tuesday night this week. I went in with high expectations and they were exceeded. 

We started with the Broccolini (shrimp, crumbled corn bread, and broccolini). The broccolini was bright and crisp-tender. The shrimp were perfectly cooked. It seemed like an unusual combination of flavors and textures but it totally worked. 

We also tried the Shumai starter (dumplings filled with lobster and shrimp and sitting in a ponzu sauce). They may have been my favorite dish of the night. Perfection. 

For our larger plates, my husband and I shared the ora king salmon and the spicy crab noodle. The salmon was outstanding. It had a crispy charred side that tasted like cotton candy (in the best possible way). The salmon was served with bok choy which was perfectly cooked and paired nicely with the salmon. The spicy crab noodles were absurdly delicious as well. We fought over every last bite. 

As a party of two, this ended up being the perfect amount of food for us. We were full when we left, but not stuffed. 

Green Pheasant is great for date night or girls' night out. It's also perfectly positioned if you are headed to Ascend. We were on our way to a concert and could literally see the entrance gate from our table.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: I don't get the hype. We arrived for our reservation right on time and were sat immediately. Waited... and waited. Told the hostess no one had come by after 15 mins. Finally a server arrives and we are all set to order. We get the chicken wing "dumplings", lobster dumplings, edamame, salmon dinner and infamous spicy crab noodles. Chicken wings were certainly creative just not tasty - all it tasted like was fryer. Lobster dumplings were too buttery and we had about one each and left the rest. Edamame was fine, steamed with salt, nothing distinctive. Salmon was very tasty but almost raw. The noodles everyone raves about were good,  not as spicy as I would have loved. All and all a mediocre experience. Too many choices in Nashville to ever go back.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
I applaud you, Green Pheasant. I'm not sure to whom I am applauding--their interior designers, the servers, the chefs, but everyone gets a big high five. This was one of the best dining experiences I've had in Nashville. The meal was exceptional from start to finish. 

The service--
We had made a reservation on Resy through their website and we were seated promptly on-time. When we were seated we were brought warm towels to wipe our hands. Our server greeted us and was very accommodating. She was the best! 

The ambiance--
There was a slight Asian flavor to the decor but everything was very modern. Some of the seating had plush booths and some were tables. There was a center bar for people who just came to get drinks. The restrooms were very clean and to our amusement and delight they had  Japanese toilets which had a seat warming feature. 

The food--
Their menu consists of a cold section and a hot section. There aren't appetizers but the menu is mostly small plates and then towards the bottom of the menu the plates get larger. Our server went into the most detail of the menu of any server that I've ever had. It was great. She highlighted her favorite dishes but gave an explanation of how the dishes were prepared so we knew what to expect. We ordered: 
-Spicy crab noodles: buttered noodles with crab meat. My favorite, but apparently also most people's favorite since our server has said that every table will likely have one order of these. 
-Tebasaki gyoza: This dish blew my mind. Instead of the chicken stuffed into a traditional gyoza dumpling, the gyoza is stuffed into the chicken wing. It is deboned except for the end of the wing so you are getting a crispy chicken with the filling of the gyoza in the center. 
-Kinoko: These were different kinds of mushroom with Parmesan. They had such a great earthy flavor and a light broth.
-Broccolini with corn bread and rock shrimp: This dish seemed like an interesting pairing but everything worked together. The sauce for the broccolini was delicious and the rock shrimp had a different seasoning which worked together
-Wedges: This was the one dish I could have done without, but it was still good. The salad was served on skewers with dressing and shaved carrots. 

The ambiance, the service and the food was all amazing. High marks for all. The dinner was very memorable and enjoyable. I'll be looking forward to my next visit here!
name: The Green Pheasant

text: This place is fairly new so if you want to get in on the weekends make sure to make reservations. The restaurant itself is beautiful!!! More like an intimate romantic setting. My table each ordered something different and all our food was good. It is more of a smaller dish but of you order a couple things to share you will get full. Our server was really attentive and checked on us often and made sure we had everything we needed at all times. Definitely have to come back and try the other dishes.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
4.5 stars. I had dinner last night here for my birthday and it was delicious! I would recommend making a reservation though, especially on the weekend. Our reservation was at 8:30 and our table wasn't quite ready yet when we got there so we got a drink at the bar while we waited. Our table was ready about 15 minutes later at 8:45, but it was worth the wait because they seated us on the first level at a little booth with plush velvet, super comfortable!

Side note: do not forget your ID especially on your birthday! I'm embarrassed to say that I made this mistake (I had switched purses, it's a girl thing) so I had to run home to grab it. So it was fine that our table wasn't ready right away. And the bartender was so nice and felt bad that I had to run home he ended up buying my first drink! I believe his name was Mike, super friendly and great bartender. 

There was just two of us and we ordered 5 dishes which was the right amount of food for us. They are tapas style and made for sharing it seems. Our food also came out pretty quick. We were full by the end but not busting at the seams. They bring each dish out as they are ready instead of bringing it all out at once which I like so you're not waiting for a long time to eat. 

We started off with the wedge salad. It was skewers of lettuce with a ginger dressing on top. Fresh and tasty, although maybe a little pricey. 

Next we had the Okonomiyaki which was delicious. It was a crispy savory hashbrown type pancake with sauces and toppings on top. Highly recommend!

Then we had the Tebasaki Gyoza. Do not be fooled by the name, it is not a gyoza. It is actually a deboned chicken wing stuffed with a mixture of shrimp. There is a chili sauce for dipping. This is probably unusual for most people. The outer crust was super crispy which I loved. It had also come out super fresh and hot. A sign it was made to order and hadn't been sitting for a while. My boyfriend was so so about this dish, but I really liked it. So it depends on the person. 

After came the spicy crab noodles which had come highly recommended. It was very saucy and rich. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be although there was a good amount of crab in there. I would recommend mixing it up before you start as all of our crab and stuff had kind of settled towards the bottom. I didn't end up loving this dish as I had thought I would. The flavors were a bit muddled and maybe a little too rich for me. 

Lastly, we had the ikinari steak. It's American skirt steak on a bed of sweet corn and onions with a generous scoop of the miso butter. It was cooked perfectly medium rare and came out on a sizzling skillet. So for those who don't like their meet too rare, it does continue to cook a bit after it comes out. The steak was super tender and had a sauce on top. For me it could have had a little less sauce so the steak could shine, but still delicious nevertheless. It was a little difficult to eat the corn with chopsticks though haha. I could have asked for other utensils, but I didn't want to be "that person."

Overall it was a great experience. The decor instead was beautiful, with a mix of mid century furniture and more luxurious touches like the velvet booths. Everyone we encountered was friendly and our server was great, very knowledgeable and nice. Would definitely come back to try the other dishes.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Great restaurant with EXCELLENT service. Our girl Lauren V was top notch. Little things make a big difference. They automatically put us in a booth with our Resy reservation. The staff inputs drink orders on iPads so they'll be ready ASAP, before they're even done explaining the menu. I appreciated how our food recommendations were not automatically the most expensive item. The staff was even thoughtful about recommending clean plates and new chopsticks. Food was excellent, but the service was what sealed the deal. Will definitely be back!
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Way too bougie with everything. Spent $200, left hungry and stopped at McDonalds on the way home. I get it's tapas style and to share but these plates were 1 bite per person.

Wedges were just a normal salad just on a tooth pick.
Chicken wings only has 3. Charged $5 for 1 additional so that each person in the party could have a bite.
Gyoza was decent but nothing great

Would not recommend
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
TGP has two stand-out features: Ambience (Read date night!) and rare ingredients. 

Compared to other haute cuisine restaurants, there are few of this grandeur. It is mid-century, dimly lit, with grand emerald green velvet seats and walls of the same color. It's going to give date night spots in town a run for the money. The vibe is upscale with house lounge music (loud and could be toned down). Plus, the serving ware is gorgeous. The dish added to the beauty of the dish. (I dunno how I felt about wooden chopsticks, though. It's definitely more practical, but did take away from the elegance). So just for the ambience TGP deserves more than 5 stars. 

TGP has a well curated menu. There is plenty to choose from, although vegetarian options maybe limited. They use fine quality ingredients like Jidori chicken, and mushrooms too fancy to google (kidding!). Also, there isn't sushi, ramen or yakitori for dinner. The portions are small, sharing size, but given Japanese cuisine is all about clean light and bright flavors, those elements alone will satisfy your appetite. The menu is divided into Cold and Hot; within the hot, light to heavy dishes.

The Sunomono: To dumb it down-fancy poke. To elevate it- fresh, cooling, and edible flowers. The moonfish is gorgeous and the coolness from the cucumber ironically punches through. 

Tebasaki gyoza: You haven't had chicken wings like this before. The inside is filled with shrimp. I don't know where the croissant is, in the filling or the crumb coat, but either way, stuffed wing like no other. Delicious, light, juicy and crunchy with an element of surprise. The sweet chile sauce seemed like the regular kind, I couldn't tell if it was house-made. 

Ikinari steak: Don't let the size fool you. It is rich and a very heavy dish. Comes out in a sizzling skillet. A huge dollop of miso brown butter, looks like gold and feels as rich, makes the steak outstanding. The skirt steak is cooked to perfection-  medium rare, tender juicy and a delicious char and asian flavor. The caramelized onions and corn really compliment the richness from the butter and sauce. Great fusion. 

Fried Tempura Chocolate Cake: I am not a big fan of the chewiness in mochi, so I went with the extreme opposite: texture bomb! This is a molten chocolate cake fried in tempura batter with dulce de leche sauce, with a side of ice cream, topped with sauteed puffed rice. So you have the ooey goeey, the crispy, crunchy, hot cold, solid and liquid.  Decadent, much? Most definitely. 
In spite of the multiple textures, it felt one note- very sweet. I wish they had some salt or citrus to cut the richness. 

Granted, I have not had enough Japanese food of this kind to compare so I may not be the best judge. I think the food is delicious and of high quality, but I just wasn't wowed by the flavors. It was an elevation of the quality and ingredients of the familiar asian flavors.

They have midday and lunch offerings too which would be great to try out. Prices are comparable, portions depending on the item maybe on the smaller side. 

The service is great. We actually went with the recommendations of our host who told us about the dishes. There is ample seating. 

The reason I was a little annoyed, I picked the wrong premier parking garage downtown (222 parking is the closest to TGP) and by the time I walked over to catch the midday menu, with ten minutes to spare till dinner at 5pm I couldn't order off it. So although the midday is till 5 it isn't. But I agree that's me being pesky. 

Nonetheless, next time. TGP is a great addition to downtown. The upscale Japanese food makes it very unique. And it is a very promising restaurant.
name: The Green Pheasant

text: The start to our experience here was not great. I called ahead to find out if there was valet at the restaurant in which I was told yes there is. This was great bc we didn't have to pay for uber etc. so when we arrive to the valet stand there is no one in sight and a line of cars parked on the street. Essentially no where legally for us to park to wait for the valet. When we see the valet run up I got out to hand him my keys hoping he knows better than I where we can park our car and he can take it from there. He snaps at us he's swamped and that we need to legally park and to pay a $12 fee for the valet before he can help us. I understand he is working alone on a Saturday night but the attitude was unnecessary. We ended up parking in a garage right down the street and The green pheasant validated it, I feel for the guy but he could have been more pleasant and apologetic. Two people working the stand could probably solve the problem. Then when I arrive my friends I'm meeting are waiting at the bar explained we couldn't be seated until everyone arrived. They'd been waiting at least ten minutes bc of the valet situation and we let the hostess know we are all there and she forgot about us. We reminded her promptly but we didn't feel like we got a warm welcome. Everything was exponentially better once we were seated and welcomed by our waitress Lauren, who goes by L2. She was warm and informative. All the food we ordered was delicious. If I were to rate this place based on the food and Lauren's service alone it would be 5+stars! I definitely would recommend this place to friends but I would tell them either uber or skip the valet all together and park in the garage and have the restaurant validate the parking. The crab noodles were amazing, but there wasn't a thing I tasted I didn't like!
name: The Green Pheasant

text: Waaay overhyped. Tapas style (they say). Seems like a poor excuse for TINY dishes. Had several (5) dishes and all mediocre. Stuffed chicken wings with shrimp toast was the best and that was just ok. Spent $100 and left hungry. Poor service. This is a definite no.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Excellent way to spend an hour and a half before a concert in downtown Nashvegas. I'm not ashamed to say that we needed to be schooled on how to read the menu and placing our order. Alex was a pro and recommend the "crowd pleasers" as well as his favorites and reasons why. He also asked us to pick two to three things at a time because as soon as the chef prepares each dish, it is brought to the table immediately. Thus, this was the pattern we created. Order eat, order eat, repeat. 

First up was the wedge salad with ginger dressing, fried oysters and the broccolini with bite sized shrimp. Just as we finished these scrumptious plates, we proceed with our next order of spicy crab noodles (be prepared to have a new addiction) and lobster dumplings. As our fork touched the desert plate on the last bite of a caramelized ginger creme brulee, we had come to realize that we experienced something truly special on a simple Tuesday night. From start to finish, The Green Pheasant impresses. Put it on your foodie bucket list pronto. 

Tip: before ordering, sit back with your wine or cocktail and watch what comes out of the kitchen. This is what we eventually did- telling Alex "we want that" or "that looks amazing, bring us that". The visual presentations were eye catching.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
Everything on the menu is absolutely incredible, I suggest going with a large group so you can try as much as you can. The cauliflower and salmon were both outstanding, both recommended by the waiter who was knowledgeable and professional -- even sharing cultural context and traditions. 

Park in the deck and get it validated, and they have a coat check as well.
name: The Green Pheasant

text:
This place is top notch, with phenomenal service and such fantastic ambiance- how can you go elsewhere? All of the food looked and smelled amazing. I love how creative everything was.
I CANT STOP DAYDREAMING ABOUT THE FOOD. Hands down, best brunch experience of my life. I don't even like french toast usually and theres was by far the most delicious food thats ever entered my mouth. I am literally drooling while writing this.
The chicken and waffles were unreal and standout A++++. 
I love the "flinstones pushup-pop" drink so creative and clever.
Even the deviled eggs were the best I've personally ever had. They do everything right even when it comes to the music. It was super fun and such a great experience! Ignore any review thats not 4 stars because they must be delusional.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch with some friends. Let me just say, my experience was AMAZING. So, where should I begin?.... OH.. Let's start with the Tiramisu french toast. Now, I'm not one to order from the sweeter side of breakfast, but these were basically screaming at me from the menu. These little slices of heaven came out fast (which I always appreciate) and were DELICIOUS. My other friend ordered the CANNOLI PANCAKES. UNREAL - no surprise there. Aside from the incredible food, the staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The overall vibe of this place was just so upbeat and really set a great tone for the rest of my day in Philly. Can't wait to go back!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: This place is INCREDIBLE! It's American food with a twist. Start with a drink. Get the Flintstone one. It's frozenish and I promise you won't regret it. Food rundown: Mussels in a French onion soup broth, 10/10. Tiramisu French toast, 10/10. Marinated fried chicken and waffles 10/10. But one of my faves has got to be the avocado toast, a perfect ten. To die for. My recommendation is to go out for brunch with some friends and split all of this deliciousness. You won't regret it. Oh and also, the staff knows what's up.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Outrageously overpriced for what it is. Insultingly so. It would be one thing if the cocktails warranted $12 but they simply do not. The bartender was very friendly so 2 stars for that but for that area and the subpar cocktails not even close to worth the price. Cannot speak to the food but definitely not a place I would go back to have a few drinks at.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Ekks, how hard is it to serve food that isn't raw. I hate giving out 1 star but anyplace that serves 2 separate items from the menu to the table that are inedible deserves it. Food sucks, drinks are wayyy overpriced, outside still looks as sh*tty as it was when it was the Wishing Well. I'm so confused as to why people think they can just put a new bar top in and expect it to succeed. Get a real chef and price drinks according to demographics and neighborhood. How f*cking hard is it to do that people?!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Food here is AWESOME. Buffalo chicken egg rolls and lamb burger wrapped and prosciutto was unreal. Staff was really friendly. Great live music and hip atmosphere, definitely coming back!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: The best new bar in Philly. Amazing drink menu (and they taste as good as they sound), and delicious apps. The service is incredible and the bar is bustling with an energetic vibe that brings life to the quaint neighborhood. Thank you to Bar One for providing an atmosphere perfect for everyone!!! We can't to become regulars at Bar One!!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: We are obsessed with this place. The bartenders are so friendly and the drinks taste amazing! The happy hour is exceptional. My friends and I have tasted many items on the menu. We love their mussels & flatbread!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Have been here twice with my boyfriend. We had great food and service both times. The menu is a good size and there is an airy atmosphere to the place. Mike was behind the bar during the Italian Festival when we stopped in, and he was quite a fella. He was a great example of what good service looks like. The lamb burger is awesome!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Stop waiting to come here and just eat a meal here already! The food is simple and delicious and once you go it'll be easier to get over Wishing Well closing. 

Pesto deviled eggs OH MY. It's the perfect balance of everything you want in life. Creamy and milld yet somehow still packs a punch. Don't let any pine nuts go to waste on the plate either. 

I had the chicken cutlet sandwich. Perfect amount of spice. I wish they added more spread/sauce but the chicken was thin and breaded so that made up for it. Fries aren't really fries. More like less boring breakfast potatoes. They're whatever. 

The pappardelle with arugula and ragu somehow mastered the perfect balance between filling and light. Flavorful but not overpowering in the way arugula can be. 

Two thumbs up!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Best new bar in Philly! The menu and drinks are incredible and the staff is absolutely amazing - couldn't have had a better experience!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Was really excited to try bar one as I used to live less than a block away from the location. They did a really nice job renovating the bar, but I was not impressed by the food. We ordered four things:

cheesesteak pretzels: were basically pretzel nuggets from the pretzel factory with a cheesesteak sauce to dip in

tomato and mozzarella flatbread:The flatbread was over cooked and did not have much flavor

chicken cutlet sandwich: bread was stale (hint:sarcones is across the street- USE THEM)

buffalo chicken egg rolls:were actually really good and the best part of our meal

I hope these are just small problems for the restaurant to work out because it is a great location with a good concept for their restaurant, but right now the food needs improvement.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: First night.  Am here now.  Advertised free passed apps appetizers.  Corner table.  Ignored by EVERY server.  Other tables already had three apps!  If this is an indication of the future, FORGET IT!  And the music is too  loud!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Have been twice with my boyfriend and both times had great food and service. The menu is a good size and the place has a nice open airy atmosphere. Mike who was behind the bar is an awesome fella who went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time. The lamb burger was really really good. Check it out :)
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: By far, the least attentive service I've ever received at a bar or restaurant in Philadelphia. Don't waste your time or your money.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: If you are ever in the South Philly area be sure to stop by this new bar-restaurant! It is amazing! The staff is incredible & music is great! let's not forget the food an Italian take on bar food that is to die for! cannoli pancakes , tiramisu French toast , lamb burger, scampi mussels were all out of this world! They have a drink that has sorbet in it and tastes like a flint stones push up pop! I think we found our new spot for nights out!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Writing this review before I've even left the restaurant because it's so amazing that I can't wait to do it! This place is a neighborhood gem and south philly is so lucky that it went in! Tonight was the grand opening and they passed around FREE appetizers! Who does that?! Amazing restaurants, that's who. The prosciutto lamb burger is to die for and the buffalo chicken pasta melts in your mouth. BarOne does a fantastic job at Italian bar food and their drinks and atmosphere make me want to come back every week. Bravo, delizioso, mangia!!!!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Great spot to hang with friends! Awesome atmosphere and very friendly staff. Their cocktails are delicious! I would totally recommend Bar One to anyone looking for a new, good spot in S Philly
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: They renovated the space well. The lighting & atmosphere are much more inviting than they were in its previous iteration. The food was decent & plates were 1/2 off for happy hour. The server was attentive but didn't know anything about the beers on tap. And to read the draft list on the chalkboard we had to walk up to it bc it's unreadable from more than 3 ft away. They should consider putting drink prices on the menu. Overall, it's an ok new spot. I'll go back out of convenience but wouldn't seek it out.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: I used to love coming to this bar when it was the wishing well and couldn't wait for Bar One to open. We were skeptical at first, but the drinks on the cocktail menu were fantastic and they had some decent local beers too. My boyfriend tried the old fashioned and the banana Jameson (Jameson soaked in banana and brown sugar!) and I tried the flinstones push pop and the spiked hot chocolate. The flinstones push pop had a scoop of berry sorbet, prosecco, and I believe a lavender liquor. It surprisingly wasn't too sweet and will definitely be a summertime favorite. The spiked hot chocolate was made from belgian chocolate and had a giant toasted marshmallow on top. It was honestly the best hot chocolate I have ever had and I definitely couldn't stop myself from slurping it down too fast! The old fashioned was pretty good too, and we definitely loved the banana Jameson. For the Irish whiskey lover it's a must try! Unfortunately we didn't try the food but we will definitely be back to try soon!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: $6.50 for a Kenzinger and the bartender didn't even know what it was. Probably one of the most highly ordered beers in Philadelphia other then PBR. $7.50 for a shot of Jim Beam. I'm Wishing this place Well, but how did you not learn from the previous businesses downfall. No one in the neighborhood wants to pay center city cocktail bar prices, for  standard corner bar ambience, and a pretty average food menu. Better make some aggressive changes quickly or your gonna have Bar None ;)
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Great neighborhood spot.  Very clean and well-maintained. Excellent pub grub. Fantastic burger. They always have Peroni on tap which works out just fine for me. Nice happy hour too.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Such a nice improvement from the previous bar (even though we loved and miss the old one). Menu is great.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Stop waiting to come here and just eat a meal here already! The food is simple and delicious and once you go it'll be easier to get over Wishing Well closing. 

Pesto deviled eggs OH MY. It's the perfect balance of everything you want in life. Creamy and milld yet somehow still packs a punch. Don't let any pine nuts go to waste on the plate either. 

I had the chicken cutlet sandwich. Perfect amount of spice. I wish they added more spread/sauce but the chicken was thin and breaded so that made up for it. Fries aren't really fries. More like less boring breakfast potatoes. They're whatever. UPDATE: Came back a week later and my cutlet sandwich had bacon in it and I got more than double the serving of fries. So good! But I took a star off bc I'm annoyed at lack of consistency. But damn it's good. 

The pappardelle with arugula and ragu somehow mastered the perfect balance between filling and light. Flavorful but not overpowering in the way arugula can be. 

Two thumbs up!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Stopped in here last night for a nightcap after a fabulous dinner at Market on Ninth . So nice just to be able to walk over .  Can't beat this little spot .  Perfect city night .
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: I went here on Saturday to try the free(!) brunch and LOVED it. The space is cozy without feeling dive-y and the artwork adds a character that is unmatched. We ordered the breakfast sandwich and tiramisu french toast and both were delicious. The nice selection of local draft beer and specialty cocktails will keep me coming back. Very excited to try the dinner menu!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: The dry-rub wings (that isn't the actual name) are the best wings I have ever had. Ever.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Went there with friends for a last minute dinner last night.  Was outstanding!  Service, food, ambiance.  I had the Short Rib pasta - PERFECT!  The only thing that keeps it from being 5 star is that I just wanted a small side salad - (like one I saw on the online menu, but not on the menu that night).  Wasn't possible to 'create' - oh, well.   I'll be back!  It's also a great place to eat alone at the bar.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
My family and I were exploring the Italian market and realized we needed time out of the cold and lots of food. We were a group of 6 and most places had a long wait so we called and bar one could accommodate us right away. 

The brunch menu was definitely unique for a bar but did not disappoint. It seems everyone found something they liked. 

I personally had the kale caesar and tried someone else's avocado toast. They were both tasty although the toast was slightly burnt.

Overall service was okay but a few things were forgotten. Everyone seemed to like their meals but some of the portions were a little small depending on the dish. 

I'd definitely come back if I was in the area!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Update 3: continued inconsistency with my beloved chicken cutlet sandwich. Was missing bacon and the bread was different. Still delicious but why change something that has been perfected?!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Great neighborhood spot with outstanding mussels, great beer selection and excellent service. From the bartenders to the wait staff, everyone was friendly and attentive. We brought 2 kids and they had a blast. Best mussels we've had in a long time. I ordered beer mussels and my wife ordered scampi, both A+. My kids ordered mac & cheese which was prepared with homemade cavatelli, fantastic. Can't wait to go back!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Tonight was one of Bar One's opening nights offering free apps, 10/21. It was crowded but that's expected when a bar is giving out free food. I was able to try their chicken and waffle, buffalo chicken pasta, lamb slider, and pork and Buffalo chicken spring rolls. They were all fabulous. The food is really amazing here. Think Bar food with a classy twist. They had live music (one guy with a guitar playing covers) which had a good vibe setting the mood all night. Their draught beer list comprises mainly of local craft brews. They had 4 big screen TVs showing the sports game. This is a new age neighborhood bar that I will definitely come back to. Definitely glad to see a new bar at this corner.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Ralph's Italian restaurant was totally booked, so we took a chance on Bar One, directly across 9th st. As we walked in, I loved the corner bar atmosphere.. staff was wonderful... then I looked at the menu. OMG my heart sank...... just weird for an Italian market eatery... my friend ordered Bucatini, at $16, they could have added a few more noodles..... it looked like a side dish... hopefully these guys didn't invest their life savings in this place
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
I live a block away and have always wanted a good bar to move into this space. Unfortunately, for one reason or another, they never work out and I won't be surprised if Bar One follows suit. 

The drink menu does not have prices. That should have been the biggest indicator. We ordered Kenzingers and Philly Pale Ales and the prices were absolutely ridiculous. Almost $7 for a single Kenzinger is unheard of, even in the most pretentious Center City bars, and this is South Philly. A shot of Jim Beam- $8. 

I'd rather walk a few blocks and go to literally any other bar then give this place my business again. 

Two stars go towards the half-way decent music and I can't deny that the food smelled pretty good. Can't imagine how overpriced that must be, though...
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: A great quite, dive. Typical south Philly at its finest. Food was on point and drinks were delicious too
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: This bar is an awesome addition to the neighborhood! I came here for the grand opening and I wasn't disappointed. They passed out free delicious food to everyone and the beer selection was awesome (especially if you're a local beer lover like myself). Everyone seemed to be having a fun time and the live music was a great addition. I can definitely see myself coming back here in the future.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: This is a fun bar I enjoy the casual but trendy atmosphere. It has a good energy. The food is very good. I think the beer is pricey some exceed $7 for the typical 14 oz glass. Tuesday night at 8 pm is trivia night. I recently had the pappardelle and it was delicious!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Recently moved into the neighborhood from center city and decided to try out Bar One. My husband and I have been here multiple occasions since we have moved in and have had a great experience every time. Some top notch things:
-Wonderful service! Mike and the other bartenders have been extremely attentive and friendly. 
-Dominic makes one of the best dirty martinis I have ever had...better than capital grille/delfriscos
-Great draft list - always rotating 
-A must go for brunch. We went today and enjoyed a juicy burger and the barones special. Home fries were crispy and the pancake was delicious! That paired with their homemade bloody hit the spot. 

Highly recommend for people to check out, especially if you are as picky as me. I've been to countless spots for brunch / cocktails and this is among the best in philly. A great mix of solid fresh food, tasty cocktails, and draft craft beer... they also have TVs which is must have with the philly sports run. 

Go sixers #ttp
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Cool bar, love the art work, the lamb burger and the inventive drinks. The space is good and I like the playfulness of the food. Hh is 1/2 off everything. Yeah I will be back.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: I have never had such delicious ice cream in my life. All natural with herbs chocolate cookie enhancements. The mint chocolate chip was the best I have ever had. The baklava had bits of sweetened philo, and the lavender enhanced cream brûlée had crunchy caramel throughout.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Stopped by for HH before the Sixers game and I must say they have great HH deals. Certain appetizers are half off and their house wines are $4 a glass. The bar wasn't that busy as most people trickled in as the game began, but its a good space for friends to hang out and watch the game. 

The stuffed long hots were the favorite. They are spicy and stuffed to the max with perfectly cooked sausage. 

The flatbread on the other hand was meh. Its not on your usual flatbread. What i thought was going to be a naan or pita like texture was more like a cracker. It's so thin and the toppings are piled high which made the "cracker" soft and soggy. The taste of the veggies needed salt too. 

Last thing we ordered was the beet salad. Slices of tomato, beets, and mozzarella cheese with a balsamic vinegar drizzle. I didn't think i'd he a huge beet fan, but these were good. 

If you get a chance to stop by for HH definitely hit up their drink specials and get the stuffed long hots!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Live in the neighborhood and it's much better than the bar prior. The staff is always attentive and nice. Food is pretty good, more bar style appetizers than real meals but nonetheless appetizing. They also make a great Moscow mule.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Went in on a Sunday evening and it was very quiet. Nice bar with approximately 15 tables for seating. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly. We ordered spiedini and sausage and pepper spring rolls. Both appetizers arrived hot and both were delicious. 
Next up was the papardelle with short ribs topped with Arugala.  Absolutely outstanding!!  Highly recommend Bar One aka Barone!  Can't wait to try the Brunch menu too.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Expensive and not the money.  Smug service and an overpriced breakfast sandwich with only one egg.  Wouldn't recommend, cute space in a nice neighborhood but better options for food considering the price.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Went back on a Tuesday and were able to get a table for 8 easily. We want Barone to be our neighborhood spot, but they're making it hard to do so. My friend ordered the mussels which were delicious, but when she asked for bread they told her they only give out bread for sandwiches. Bread. Sarcones is right across the street. 
We will come back because we understand that it's new and they may be working out the kinks still. Fingers crossed.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: I recently went to Bar One for  my second time which was as good as the first. The first time I had the short rib potato skins which were to die for and the second time the flat bread. Well I have to say the food is second behind the great bartender Mike. He was working his butt off and still trying to give everyone the attention they deserved. I will be back!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Good spot for a drink to two with some pretty good menu items too. Awesome and friendly staff in a really nice updated and clean space.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Short rib potato skins and eggplant stack are awesome. Playlist of music in the bar thanks to Chris et. al is great. Atmosphere is fun and friendly and loud on week, but quieter on weeknights. Just as friendly and pleasant.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Had really great experience this is my favorite place bartender was so attentive and knowledgeable my favorite drink was cucumber cooler We will be back again
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: There wasn't one dish that was anything short of phenomenal. You'll leave daydreaming of the cheesesteak mussels and lamb prosciutto burger for weeks.  Amazing drinks & atmosphere and friendly staff will make this your new go-to local bar in South Philly. Truly deserves SIX stars.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Greta happy hour; 1/2 priced all drinks except premium liquor. We had the Flintstones push-up and Berry refreshing. I like the push-up pop, but I want it without the liqueur and I broke up the sorbet. I'm not sure how to capture the blood orange taste without the liqueur. Berry refreshing is very sweet and quenches your thirst. Careful you might drink it really fast, but if you go during happy hour you can two for the price of one so go ahead and drink up!
Oh and while you drink for 1/2 off at HH from 4-6 pm you can enjoyed 1/2 priced food and nightly specials too!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
So glad something finally opened on this corner and what did looks so much better inside. The room has a great flow to it and the art on the walls compliments the place well.  The beer list was better than average and the menu was interesting.

Unfortunately there were some things that we really didn't like: the beer list has no prices nor does it specify what is on tap and what isn't. This made the final bill shocking as I didn't expect a PBC bottle to cost $8.99+. The tap list was illegible from the tables and the waiter suggested I go look at it to see what was on it. My flatbread came out over cooked and cold. Our waiter, while he tried and was nice, wasn't very knowledgeable about the food or beer.

2.5 stars overall. Going to give it one more chance since it's so convenient but hope to see some basic changes to tighten up the experience.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Came here with a large group of friends after eating at the Italian market and was fairly underwhelmed. It was jumping with people and they were showing sports on the TV which made my husband happy but I found the atmosphere to be lackluster. Also there are two bathrooms but one was out of use which made for a very long line. One thing to note - - if you forget to bring wine to your BYOB in the Italian Market they sell it here!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Pros: good food. Decent drinks. Nice neighborhood location. 

Cons: the two male bartenders that were on were totally inattentive. They were pretty boys so I am assuming that's the reason they were hired. Seemed like they kept catching their reflection in the mirror and were too busy to help. Had to literally call out to them if you needed anything. I would rather have slightly less attractive people who were good at their jobs than have the pretty boys in there ignore me. Service is everything, it doesn't matter how good the libations, the service is what brings people back or keeps them away.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Best bloody mary that I ever had. Very flavorful and spicy. Got try it
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: This place is hands down my favorite happy hour go-to spot. The staff is super friendly/cool, and the food is delicious! Wide variety of yummy drinks for really good prices during happy hour. Definitely recommend!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Good place for cocktails. Never eaten the food but looks good. The bartenders are friendly and it's usually easy to get a spot at the bar.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
It's was first time with friends.
I had a mezacalito was ok .
Eggplant mozzarella was awesome.
I had a pesto was ok bread was cold and hard.
Wasn't busy.
Bartender she was focused on only front guest.just looking us when we need anything.
Value was ok.
Experience was ok.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Solid corner bar/restaurant in South Philly zone.  Owned by the family that owns Ralph's, across the street.  Beer is fresh and cold and service at the bar is friendly.  I sat at the bar and ate dinner and watched the Phillies on a sorta quiet Tuesday evening.  The food is good - not great - and not quite (but close!) to equal in taste/quality to the price.  I've been there a couple of times now and will definitely be back for a cold draft beer, friendly service and possibly, maybe, if-I'm-feeling-it... the food.  

Thanks!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
I love this bar!  I've been here twice, not during peak bar hours so I'm sure it's even more fun at night, but both times I've been I left wishing it was closer to where I live. 

The first I came here was for a quick drink to kill time before my reservation at Ralph's (which owns this bar).  The bartender was super informative, even giving us tips on what to order at Ralph's since it was my first time there as well, and the drink I had was delish. 

The second I went was this past Sunday for some food after bike riding. It was still brunch hours-I got the eggs benedict, my boyfriend got their special cheesesteak omelette, and we split the sausage and pepper spring rolls.  First off sausage and peppers is one of my very favorite foods so to see them offered in a unique way was really cool and they were really good. My eggs benedict was good too, but my boyfriends cheesesteak omelette, topped with their homemade wiz sauce, was beyond.  Both brunch entrees were served with spicy potatoes on the side which were tasty too. We had a different bartender this time and he was just as friendly and helpful as the one we had the first time. 

I've been here twice and I can't wait to go again.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
Bar One was truly outstanding, I cannot wait to come back!

I came here with some friends on a Saturday afternoon for brunch, and every element of this restaurant was perfect.  The service was impeccable.  The wait staff were so attentive, my glass was never empty.  We all had these delicious "Flintstones push pop" drinks , you must get one!  It is a mimosa with a scoop of sorbet, the ideal brunch drink to wash down all of the great food.  

The food was to die for.  The pickle back wings & waffles dish was my favorite.  The marinade and seasoning of the chicken is one of a kind, combined with the sweetness of the waffles, HELLO flavor explosion!  The avocado toast was also tops. Avocado, egg and Texas toast...perfection.  Another stand out was the Tiramisu French Toast, this is what actual dreams are made of.

I loved the overall ambiance of Bar One.  The art in the restaurant (and in the bathrooms) are really cool.  I wanted to take home one of the pieces hanging in the ladies room!  The music they were playing was awesome, everything from 90s alternative hits to Jay-Z.

Thank you Bar One for an amazing experience!!
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Vaguely remember coming here when the bar went by a different name, but glad to see it now operating as a solid happy hour spot.  Decent discounts on drinks, and a fairly varied food menu for happy hour, too.  Was here on a Tuesday, and was impressed by the solid crowd that came in for trivia, as well.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Nice neighborhood bar with good food and beer. They have sour monkey on tap which is one of my favorites! Huge plus. We got 2 apps and 2 entrees to split: pesto deviled eggs, Italian spring rolls, cavatelli, and the spicy chicken cutlet sandwich. Would skip the spring rolls (they kind of tasted like taquitos) but everything else was delicious! Cavatelli was the favorite for sure
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
My girlfriend & I stopped in here one night before our reservation at Ralph's. We had an hour before dinner and decided to sit and have a drink here. Oddly enough, we checked their reviews and decided to give it a try. We got to talking with the bartender and she informed us that Ralph's owned Bar One. We glanced at the menu while we had our drinks and both agreed that we had to come back here. 

Fast forward a few months and we ended up back at Bar One for brunch. It was around 12:30 when we got there and I believe their brunch is 11-2:30 Then the kitchen closes for an hour and they start dinner at 3:30 PM. My girlfriend got Eggs Benedict that she really enjoyed. I ended up getting the cheesesteak omelette with their special wiz sauce on top. I didn't ask how they made their sauce but I suspect it's a mixture of wiz cheese and heavy cream; it was to die for. The entire meal was phenomenal. Their menu is also very eccentric which, as a foodie, I really enjoy. 

The staff is very friendly and informative. They also have a lot of drink specials. If you love Bloody Mary's you'll love it there. 

They seem to be a new bar so I wanted to make sure I gave them a good review to help spread the word. I definitely recommend Bar One and I'll be back.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
This was my first and definitely last time. I would not recommend. I was being generous to give it 2 stars the only good thing is that it was clean. The waitress was very slow and inpatient. She was unprofessional in sharing her feelings about my disappointment to her co worker!!. I said that my wings were not done. They were hot wings and the skin was soft and wet as if it was not cooked hard enough it was still light no color besides the sauce. In addition, the other 2 orders that were brought out at the same time had the same complaint from 2 other tables. She frowned up her face and said a thermometer was stuck in them and they are done. When she took them back ,it took another hour before the new ones were brought
 The lamb burger was seasoned great but had toooo much salt. To top it off, the pasta had a peice if hair in it. We did not complain or say another word. We just packed up and left
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
I've been on a search for a good, under $20, pasta option for a little while. Bar One isn't it.

     Let's start with what it is, though. Can you go have a beer with your friends, and watch a little of the game? Yes, you definitely can. Do they have a beer list which comparable to other crafty, Philly spots? Yes, definitely. Is it crazy expensive, or crazy crowded? Nope...it's ostensibly a neighborhood bar.

     By no stretch of the imagination is it an Italian restaurant. Frankly, I'm not sure why Bar One even bothers to pretend it is such...perhaps the neighborhood, or proximity to the market...but at any rate, fine Italian cuisine it is not. Excited to try a new spot, stopped in on a brisk Friday in November and, ordered the cavatelli with Gorgonzola sauce and sausage. The most notable issue was that there was no sausage. Strike one. I could not identify the flavor of Gorgonzola in the pale grey sauce either. Let it be know that I love blue cheese, and a little goes a long way with said ingredient; it's a strong flavor. This, however, tasted more like a bland rue. The pasta itself was stuck together in clumps, which made me wonder how it was prepared...pasta doesn't do that in a sauté pan.  It was thoroughly underwhelming. 

    It's also worth mentioning the staff...or at least one bartender.  My gent was fine. He seemed to have a little trouble getting around, but was courteous enough, and managed my order with no issues. There was another, much ruder, gent who spent the evening - or at least the time that I was there - trying to recruit customers into belittling the other bartender (the one serving me). "Can you believe he has a degree in music?!?!...in MUSIC?", he asked me with his absurd Thomas Shelby haircut and manicured beard. "Who does that?!?", he continued in his effort to impress himself. I absolutely did not take the bait; nor did most of the other customers, in what I can only expect was everyone trying to extend common kindness to a man just trying to do his job. 

     Let's have a reality check here. 1. Publicly belittling others lacks both character and professionalism. Full stop. 2. I have a degree in music, and what has been (so far, thanks be to God) a lasting & rewarding career in the Arts. So, what was meant only as unnecessary posturing between staff members, deeply offended your clientele. I chose not to engage the argument, because that is in no way what I'm looking for in a dinning experience...an argument with an arrogant, yet poorly-informed bartender. The phrase "service industry" springs to mind...SERVICE...since we like to repeat ourselves. In conclusion, the food was edible but not good; yet it was the utter pretension of Mr. Shelby which will ensure that I will neither spend another singular dollar, nor recommend Bar One to any of my friends or readers. #Service
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Tonight was one of Bar One's opening night offering free apps, 10/21. It was crowded but that's expected when a bar is giving out free food. I was able to try their chicken and waffle, buffalo chicken pasta, lamb slider, and pork and Buffalo chicken spring rolls. They were all fabulous. The food is really amazing here. Think Bar food with a classy twist. They had live music (one guy with a guitar playing covers) which had a good vibe setting the mood all night. Their draught beer list comprises mainly of local craft brews. They had 4 big screen TVs showing the sports game. This is a new age neighborhood bar that I will definitely come back to. Definitely glad to see a new bar at this corner.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
My mother and I went to the Italian Festival last Saturday, as I work in the area. There was plenty of food, family, music, and vendors. 

I wanted to try a new place with great food and service. As always, I read the reviews and pick my spots. So attempting to visit Bar One was not out of the ordinary. Well, as we walked through the festival, we saw a young lady passing out flyers to everyone. To my surprise, as when we got closer, she looked us in our faces, and turned around...mine you, there was no other individuals close to her to pass out the flyers, then us. At this point, I replied that maybe the business that she was representing had an exclusion policy. At that point, an older gentleman standing near her, heard the remark, apologized, and passed us a flyer. 

To my surprise, the flyer was from Bar One! At that point, we continued to walk to the end of the festival, and I was still interested in visiting Bar One. After reaching the end of the festival, we turned around and began to walk back. As we neared the Bar One vicinity, another gentleman was now passing out the flyers. As we approached closer to go near the front of the Bar One, the gentleman did not look at us to give a flyer to either. It was obvious that this second time within a 45 minute span was NOT an accident. We simply didn't fit the identity of their clientele. Point taken.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text:
I understand Bar One's attempts to change the traditional Italian food into bar food but a lot of it didn't make sense. 

The Good - Let me say that I would RUN back for the french onion soup mussels, they were absolutely delicious and full of flavor. My favorite part were the french fries at the bottom of the bowl that were soaked with the french onion broth. 

The service! Each waiter was extremely attentive and nice, never had to ask for anything as it was already taken care for me.

The drinks were delicious as well! would come to drink rather than eat. 

The bad - the kale calamari salad. The calamari to salad ratio was way off, less calamari, more lettuce. The calamari it self was over salted and heavily coated. 

The Mafaldine pasta - was WAYYY under cooked, I like my pasta al dente but this was still raw. Also the pasta is way too large to have small pieces of shrimp and asparagus with. Again, this dish was over salted. 

In all, I would come back if improvements were made. I want to see this restaurant do well! Great location, and the place is cool.
name: Bar One
categories: Cocktail Bars, Bars, Italian, Nightlife, Restaurants

text: Undercook and overpaid! Got a pizza and it wasn't even fully cook, pretty gross. We were between Little Caesar and Dominos, thought we'd pay a little more for a "better" pizza WRONG. Should have gone with a $5 pizza that was cooked.
name: Domino's Pizza

text: We always have great service here. Only once in 3 years did they "mess up" an order and I wouldn't even say that it was a negative because they resolved it so effortlessly. They made our pizza on Hand Tossed crust instead of Pan Pizza, but must haverecognized the mistake once it was already been baking. They just baked the correct one, apologized and gave us the "oops" at no charge. Apology for a free pizza? What great service! When we do have delivery its fast and hot. Must have a really great team at this location!
name: Domino's Pizza

text: Dominoes is getting better lately about getting out your order pretty quickly while it's still hot. We order about once a week and they have always gotten our order right. The drivers are Alonso friendly.
name: Domino's Pizza

text: Great pizzas and great service.  Love the order on-line or order by app feature.
name: Domino's Pizza

text: Ordered online, quoted 26-36 min, delivered almost 2 hours after ordering and cold. Usually good service, new mgmt?
name: Domino's Pizza

text: Ordered the 5.99 deals tonight. I was able to feed the family on only $30. Great delivery time & great food! Thank you!
name: Domino's Pizza

text: I hadn't had Dominos for at least 15+ years so when I moved to Whitehouse, we gave them a try.  I'm pretty sure that a frozen pizza would have tasted better!  Even a generic store brand one would have been better.  I ask for extra sauce but what I didn't know is that when I ask for extra sauce they must have misunderstood me and thought I said extra grease.  I had to use paper towels to soak up all that grease before I could even make an attempt to taste it & there was barely any sauce on it & what little bit there was, had no flavor.  The cheese tasted like it was not even real; the imitation stuff.  The pepperoni was dry & curled up around the edges where they were laying in all that grease I suppose.  I got through 1/2 a piece and the entire thing went in the trash, my husband couldn't even eat it.  I just couldn't do it.  I won't even get into the price! OMG!  It was around $26 for an XL pepperoni pizza, nothing else on it.  I went to the WH pizza shop on 31 and got one loaded with toppings and it was about the same price and it was delicious!  Dominos is horrible & I will never go back, skip this place, save your $$.
name: Domino's Pizza

text: So this is the pizza joint my son and I hit up. Here's what  they do right, they make the pizza per instructions listed in all Domino's. They get your order right consistently. They have a drive thru so I don't have to get Covid. I feel like Kevin from Home Alone when I come here because I'm always getting a cheese pizza, but the cheesy bread dipped into some marinara is also dope. If you've seen my other posts, you know that the wife and daughter are GF, don't do this option here they can't comprehend cross contamination, and I don't expect the teenagers here to either, BDP! (If you know you know), save GF option for Molipazzo. Domino's keep being you and I'll keep patronizing your fine establishment.
name: Domino's Pizza

text: Absolutely disgusting. Do yourself a favor and never order from here. Food is terrible
name: DeSandro on Main

text: So I went to this fine establishment yesterday after a night out on the town. Was looking for some quality pizza and possibly some wings. The wait was a little long but not terrible considering the night rush. I got a large pepperoni and a dozen wings with a side of hot sauce. Everything sounds great right? Pizza tastes good, wings taste good. Me being slightly... buzzed thought nothing of the bill... after all my main mission was to get Pizza. It wasn't until I collected myself this morning that I realized how ridiculous it was that I spent 32 bucks on a pep pizza and a dozen wings. I think you guys can do the math. I got fleeced in my moment of drunkin pizza need. Anyway, go next door. These guys can't operate like decent human beings. I'm sure the owner will read this so my message is: yeah we might be drunk when we order but we remember the next day and apparently this isn't an isolated event according to my friends. Deuces. (Drops mic)
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Came here one night back in March after being at mad river with a group of people. Came here and got two slices of their chicken honey mustard pizza and it was amazing. My roommates and I often find ourselves thinking about driving up to get some pizza weekly but the 45 minute drive seems to be a bit much just for pizza. Will stop by every time I'm in the area.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: I placed a delivery order at 6:44 and was told it would arrive through grub hub between 7:30 and 7:40. After they did not get there in the time frame, I called and they said it was out for delivery and would be there momentarily. Grub hub then updated the delivery time two more times delaying it further both times! It arrived at 8:11. The food was gross - nothing was even warm, let alone hot. It was soggy, not crispy and it all tasted bland- like no taste and over cooked. Order from somewhere else.
name: DeSandro on Main

text:
Instead of ordering delivery from this place make a reservation at a nice fancy restaurant in center city.... You'll save money 

Pizza wasn't bad tho
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Stopped here on a late night before catching a movie. We all ordered burgers and fries, the food was OK nothing special. The woman behind the counter wasn't friendly at all. They had a few stools we thought we could eat at ..but the place was so cold inside we opted to eat in the car. Like it's the dead of winter an even the woman behind the counter was wearing a coat which is unsanitary. It was sooooo cold the cheese on my burger was not even melted. I'm sure there are other burger joints on main st. Maybe we should have stuck to the pizza!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: We've tried just about every pizza shop in Manayunk & Roxborough. Wish we wouldve found this gem sooner! Can't beat the price!!! The pizza was good. I like the dusting of cornmeal on the dough. It gives the crust a nice texture instead of filling your mouth with flour like all the other pizza shops. The crust was thin, cooked light but not soggy, and the ingredient portions were spot on so nothing was overpowering.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Ordered a roast pork hoagie with broccoli rabe, arrabiata pasta, and wedding soup from here.  Received a roast pork hoagie with jalapeño peppers, arrabiata pasta with jalapeño peppers (apparently the italian cherry peppers ran out, though I was told jalapeños are basically identical), and my soup was spilled all over the bag.  To their credit, they did replace the soup but the food overall was pretty awful.  I was also told to call back so they can make up the order to me (though I was literally currently on the phone with them regarding the current order).  The pork was incredibly fatty and putting jalapeño peppers in italian pasta is just asinine.  I would not order from here again but maybe by some slim chance the pizza is half decent.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Went for the first time in a while very friendly food was made fresh and fast buffalo cheesesteak wrap is so yummy pizza hot and fresh everything was good!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because my 2-year old liked the pizza.  The chicken cheese steak was overcooked chunks with no flavor....The wings were whole wings without the tips cut off, which just looks unappetizing.....The  cheese steak tasted like a cheap version of Steak-umms.  Oh, and the pizza is lousy!  I really wanted to like this place because they have a big patio and it is byob, but I can't eat there again.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: I love this place! Being from New York I'm very picky about my pizza. This is the only place in the neighborhood that I go to for pizza. The prices are affordable and the variety of pizza is great. The staff are always very friendly, quick, and kind. I would definitely recommend for lunch or a quick dinner. Out of all the pizza places on Main St. in manayunk, this is my favorite by far!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: So this is review is not based on the quality of the food as they never delivered it! On May 26th, I ordered through Grubhub, which turned out to be a lifesaver. Why? Because when I attempted to call them they did not answer. I called back the next day and was told they would not refund me because they tried to deliver it, but no one answered the door. Yet, I never heard the knock, my dog never barked (she goes crazy when someone knocks), and I never got the confirmation that my food is on the way (that Grubhub sends when the restaurant confirms via their app that the food is out for delivery). Simply put, they tried to rip me off, which is something they apparently do to their customers on a fairly consistent basis, based on their other Yelp reviews. Luckily, sine I ordered through GH, they refunded me on their own. I am just pissed that I had included a 20% tip when I ordered. This is my only yelp review, in fact, I signed up just to post this. Customers beware!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Excellent pizza, surprising for the location. It's pretty rundown and watch out for drunk people. I recommend the honey mustard chicken pizza.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Ordered for the first time a few weeks ago.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and how delicious it was.  I ordered a pasta dish and the mozzarella sticks.  Both were hot when they arrived, the delivery driver was friendly and everything was in tact.  The mozzarella sticks did have a thick batter, but it states that on the menu.  I was sad when I found out they were closed on Sunday.  We have been ordering from Mimmo's Pizza for our pasta and while it is "ok" we were pleased to know that now can order for DeSandro on Main and enjoy quality fresh food.  Thanks!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Best pizza in manayunk, but they stopped delivering to my address one day out of nowhere, so now I go to couch tomato.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: We just got delivery from here. Got the tre-p with whole wheat pasta and chicken. The chicken never made it with the dish and the sauce may as well have been milk. We also go penne vodka with sausage... I've had better jarred sauces than this.  I get I paid $30 for the convenience of not having to make a dinner that I was more than capable of making but this was awful. We ended up eating leftovers from yesterday's dinner instead, should have done that in the first place and saved myself the money.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Great quick service! I ordered on grubhub and was happily surprised at how quickly my food arrived- especially compared to other grubhub restaurants. Loved the pasta, very creamy and delicious. Will definitely be ordering again for their pizza and maybe try their milkshakes!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Good quality food at a great price and they deliver late..... Cant get any better. Oh! Did I mention they deliver milkshakes?!
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Honestly would vote them less than a star. Ordered from here at 7pm for takeout. First said it would be delivered 7:50. Checked back at 7:50, delivery ETA changed to 8:20. Called at 8:30. Phone number does not work, saying cannot connect from my line, I have at&t unsure if anyone else has this problem...? Finally got ahold of someone from roommates phone, man sounded very unsure saying there was a lot of traffic, and food should be there "in about 30..maybe... anywhere from 30-45?" So we repeated that number back to him, he again confirmed. Called back at 9:15. Man answered saying "look we've just started your food, it's real busy on the roads (side note: other roommates food got delivered from other location around corner from DeSandro, it took ten minutes), should be ready in ten and it'll go out." So I ask again, saying it has been 2 hours. Man says there's nothing he can do the food will be there within 45 minutes. 9:40 rolls around. Still no contact. Myself and roommate drive down to store. Streets are bare, cleared of all snow traffic rain/floodwaters, it took us five minutes to drive there. We walk in to a man yelling on the phone and we ask if our food is there. He begins yelling at us saying the food went out already, refused to show us the ticket, or go back and check on the order. Still yelling that the food went out. We head back home. It's now past 10:30 and still no call from a driver, manager, anybody about any status or even that our food or order has been cancelled. These guys are rude to paying customers, and wasted our evening, not even bothering to just tell us the order has been cancelled, still unsure about that since we HAVE NOT RECEIVED IT.
name: DeSandro on Main

text: Ok so I grew up im NY/NJ in italian neighborhoods and i certainly know good authentic pizza and this place is joke.. The only people stupid enough or care enough to eat here are all the drunk people across the street when the bar lets out. The three times i ate their was awful. I had the chicken parm.sandwhich and there was barely any chicken. It was dry and no sauce. I went there just to order a small salad and the owner told me i cant buy a small salad unless i buy an entree. I laughed and walked out.
